loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 55 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en una cas propia en el distrito de Cayaltí, que se encuentra a mas de una hora de distancia del distrito de Chiclayo.   Es un  distrito que se caracteriza por que sus pobladores se dedican a la  actividad agricola y ganadera.

José se dedica hace más de 10 años a las labores agricolas junto con sus hijos quienes le ayudan para que el trabajo sea menos pesado, en sus chacaras o tierras cultiva frejol que es un alimento sano y rico para el consumo diario de los pobladores.

José  a solicitado un préstamo  de 3000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para lacompra de úrea paramejorar sus tierras y tenga una mejor cosecha de frejol, también para pagos de jornales de trabajadores que lo ayudan en el cultivo de frejol.

En Cayaltí José es conocido por el buen trato que da ha sus trabajadores que lo ayudan en las actividades agrícolas, es responsable y  trabajador.  Todas esas mejoras que tiene es solo para tener mejores ingresos econónicos y poder cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
José is a 55 year old husband and father. He lives with his wife and children in their own home in the district of  Cayaltí, located an hour from the district of Chiclayo. It's a district characterized by the inhabitant's agricultural and ranching work.

José has spent more than 10 years doing farm work with his children, who help with the lighter work in his fields and bean fields, a healthy and delicious food for the residents' daily consumption.  

José has asked for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa  to buy for urea to improve his land and have a better bean crop. He also needs to pay his laborers who help harvest the beans. 

In Cayaltí, José is known for treating his workers well, which has helped him in his farm work. He is responsible and hard working. All of of these inprovements are to have more income and be able to pay for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve his crop land and to pay his workers.

loans.name: Ervin Santiago

texts.es:
El señor Ervin Santiago  de 35 años es propietario de un taller artesanal de calzado. Este negocio lo inicio hace 8 años cuando decidió independizarse este tipo de negocio se trabaja diario según comento diario realiza calzado y diario entrega el producto.
Él con el crédito comprará materia prima como  pega, cuero, cuerina, brasil, plantillas, suelas…etc.
texts.en:
Ervin Santiago, 35, owns an artisanal shoemaking shop.  He started this business 8 years ago when he decided to become independent.  This type of business requires daily work, he commented.  He makes and sells shoes daily.

He will use the loan to buy raw materials like: adhesive, leather, naugahyde, imitation leather, soles, etc.

loans.use: to buy shoemaking supplies.

loans.name: Erik Leonardo

texts.es:
Erik  es un joven de 24 años que fabrica cabinas de sonido, o bafles para equipos de sonido. En el taller de Erik sus clientes  pueden comprar las cajas con el sonido integrado o solamente la caja, porque algunas  veces el cliente  adiciona por su cuenta el sonido. Su negocio inició hace 8 años después de recibir su liquidación en un almacén de audio  donde trabajaba y decidió invertirla en su propio emprendimiento, teniendo en cuenta que  había aprendido este arte en un instituto de educación diversificada del estado, lo perfeccionó  mediante estudios técnicos en el servicio nacional de aprendizaje “Sena” y finalmente lo diversificó a través de un centro de sistema  especializado. En su negocio cuenta con dos empleados y  muchos clientes ubicados  en las ciudad de Barranquilla en el departamento del Atlántico, en Ocaña  en el departamento de Santander y en Medellín en el departamento de Antioquia,  además de contar con un mercado doméstico muy cercano en su propio municipio:  “Soledad” también ubicado en el departamento del Atlántico. 
Su sueño es tener un local que integre su taller de producción y un punto de venta, meta por la que  está dispuesto a esforzarse y  a trabajar persistentemente con tal de alcanzarlas,  pues es un hombre joven y casado que tiene un pequeño hijo de 4 años, al cual desea  forjarle un futuro prometedor, mientras él también crece como empresario de la microempresa. Este es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materiales como tablex y  felpa en mayor volumen,  para elaborar bafles y poder dar curso oportunamente  al pedido que han hecho sus clientes. Su mayor desafío es el costo de producción de sus productos, que hace que tengan un precio costoso, pero también reconoce que estos artículos tienen clientes 
muy selectos, que son los que justamente se acercas a su taller  para comprarle, y con ello Erik obtiene sus utilidades para el sostenimiento de su familia.
texts.en:
Erik is a young man of 24 years who makes speaker cabinets or speakers for sound equipment. At Erik’s workshop his customers can buy the boxes with the speaker drivers included or only the box, because sometimes the customers add the speaker drivers on their own. He started his business eight years ago after being laid off at an audio store where he was working and deciding to invest his severance pay in his own enterprise, keeping in mind that he had learned this trade at a diversified high school of the state. He perfected his skills through a technical education with the “Sena” national learning service and finally diversified by means of a specialized systems center. He has two employees in his business and quite a few customers located in the city of Barranquilla in the Atlantic Department, Ocaña in the Santander Department and Medellín in the Antioquia Department, in additional to a local market quite near his own city of Soledad, also located in the Atlantic Department. 

His dream is to have a business location that integrates his production workshop with a point of sales. He is willing to work hard and persistently to meet his goals, since he is a young man and married, with a young, four-year-old son for whom he wishes to forge a promising future, while he himself grows as the owner of a microenterprise. This is his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy materials in large volume such as particle board and plush cloth for making speakers and fulfilling the orders of his customers in a timely way. His major challenge is the production cost of his products, which makes them expensive, but he also acknowledges that these items have very select buyers, who are precisely those who come to his workshop to buy from him, and by whom Erik makes his profits with which to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as particle board and plush cloth in large volume.

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.es:
Hipólito tiene 36 años de edad,  el es casado, vive en casa de la madre con una hija que ya es dependiente. Hipólito vive en una zona urbano marginal del distrito de Mórrope,  cuenta con servicios de agua, el lugar donde vive  es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias.

Hipólito se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales,  dicha labor la realiza desde hace 12 años, el cuenta con corrales apropiados y espaciosos los cuales están ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando su ganado se encuentra con el tamaño y peso ideal lo comercializa en el mercado local, teniendo experiencia otorgada por la madre con la cual inicio este negocio.

Hipólito está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para poder pagar la mano de obra para la construcción de su domicilio. 

Hipólito tiene la seguridad de que su negocio cuenta con un mercado amplio de comercialización, lo que garantiza el éxito, el es una persona perseverante y responsable, las personas que lo conocen lo describen como alguien amable y generoso.
texts.en:
Hipólito is 36 years old, married, and lives in his mother's house with a dependent daughter.  Hipólito lives in a marginal urban area in the Mórrope district that has running water.  The place that he lives is a small community of about 100 families.

Hipólito works raising and selling animals.  He has done this work for 12 years.  He has appropriate and spacious animal pens that are located in the back part of his house.  When his livestock reaches the idea size and weight, he sells it at the local market.  His mother started the business and taught him about it.

Hipólito is asking for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to pay for labor for the construction of his home.

Hipólito is confident that his business has a large market for sales, which guarantees success.  He is a responsible and persevering person.  The people who know him describe him as kind and generous.

loans.use: to pay for labor to construct his home.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary, 48, a grocery seller, and her husband, a carpenter, earn a combined income of $14 per day. They have three children, all of them studying in school. Every month, Nary has to spend $50 on food, $10 on electricity, $30 on school fees, and $20 on other expenses.

Because all of her children are studying now and she hopes to send them to university, Nary needs to earn more income to support them and the other family expenses. She is therefore requesting a loan of $1000 to buy more grocery goods to sell and hopes to ultimately expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 30 years old and lives with her partner. She has two children and was born in Quillabamba. Judith has her own tailoring business which is located in her home. She studied the art of tailoring for three years in a private institution called, "Arco Iris." She has had her business in her home for one year. 

With the $600 loan Judith plans to purchase fabric, thread, and other materials that she needs for her business. Her dream is to expand her tailoring shop and to concentrate on making dresses and other clothes. Judith is a very ambitious woman and is committed to making all the necessary payments on time.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.
 
Lanie has a food shop that sells homemade ice cream in different flavors. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making ice cream.

Lanie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making ice cream.

loans.name: Gioconda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Gioconda soltera, madre sus hijos están estudiando, sus metas es que sus hijos se preparen profesionalmente. Mujer trabajadora, emprendedora tiene su propio negocio venta de cosméticos y variedad. Su vivienda muy humilde se le ha presentado dificultades como los efectos del invierno provocando inundaciones.
 El negocio lo inicio con fondo propios y para el mejoramiento económico de su estado de vida. Con el préstamo comprar mercadería como: pinturas labiales, de mano, sombra, vanidad, cremas, perfume, desodorantes entre otros productos.  Para cumplir con los pedidos y ofrecerle mayores variedades. Permitiendo obtener utilidades.
texts.en:
Gioconda is a single mother with school-age children. Her goals include helping her children to prepare themselves so that they can become professionals. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has her own business selling cosmetics and a variety of other products. Her modest home has presented her with difficulties, such as the after-effects caused by the winter flooding.

Gioconda started her business with her own funds so that she could improve her financial status in life. With this loan she will buy merchandise such as lipsticks, hand lotions, eye shadows, compacts, crèmes, perfumes, deodorants, and other products so that she can complete her orders and offer more variety. This will allow her to generate a profit.

loans.use: to purchase lipsticks, hand lotions, eye shadows, compacts, crèmes, perfumes, deodorants, and other products.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 28 years of age and is married. She is engaged in a retailing business in her village. She sells spices, breads, milk, diapers and cooking oil. She just started her business last year and is happy that her business still operates and is able to gain PHP 3,000 per month.

Lourdes believes that she can increase her profits if she can add more products to sell in her village.  She  is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy beauty products like perfumes, lotions and face powder to sell to her customers.  She will earn 25% of the capital she invests. She will use the profit to create a better way of living for her family.

loans.use: buy beauty products to sell

loans.name: Maria Elba

texts.es:
María Elba tiene 32 años de edad es casada, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 12,11,10,8,7,5 y 3 años de edad  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro, Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jesús de gran Poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.
se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Marlín y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos,urea, líquidos, urea y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder comprar un solar y hacer una casa para poder vivir con la familia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y viajar.
texts.en:
Maria Elba is 32 years old, married, and lives with her husband and 7 children, aged 12, 11, 10, 8, 7, 5, and 3 in Ventanas canton, Los Rios province.

The members of the “Caminando Hacia el Futuro” (Progressing Towards the Future) Communal Bank are located in the “Jesus de Gran Poder” (Jesus of Great Power) settlement in Ventanas canton. They are dedicated to short-cycle agricultural activities, sowing corn and rice. They buy their products in Comercial Marlin and sell their crops in the same location in Ventanas.

Maria Elba is requesting a loan to buy seeds, supplies, urea, liquids, and fertilizers for her crops. The loan will help her economically to supply necessities and confront challenges such as plant plagues and illnesses. 

Maria Elba's dream is to be able to buy a lot and build a house where she and her family can live. In her free time she likes to go for walks and travel.

loans.use: buy seeds, supplies, liquids, urea and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh is 43 and married, with two daughters. He lives with his family in Ho Minh City.

For the past seven years, Minh and his wife have owned a general store in front of their house where they sell instant foods, beverages, and personal-use products.

Minh would like a loan to buy a greater quantity and quality of products to sell to his customers. He hopes that this will enable him to attract more customers.

He hopes that he will increase his income and help improve his family's living conditions through the loan.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in his general store.

loans.name: Kazia

texts.en:
Kazia is 30 years old, a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has been in this business for three years.

Kazia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more beans for sale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more beans for sale.

loans.name: Lien's Group

texts.en:
Lien was born in 1965. She lives in Loc Ha village, Mai Lam commune, D. Anh district. She has three children who are going to school. Her husband has been in the army for many years. He earns a monthly income. He usually stays with the army, but sometimes he comes home to visit his family. Because her husband is often away, Mrs. Lien has to care for her children alone. She grows rice and operates a general store out of her home where she sells groceries. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2008 and has repaid loans punctually. She is the leader of a 5-member group loan from SEDA. At this time she would like to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy tables and chairs to expand her general store.

About other borrowers in her group:
Cam is 42 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.
Xuan is 57 years old. She has three children. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy chicken feed.
Hiep is 46 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy food for pigs.
Nu is 31 years old. She has one child. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed pigs.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to expand her general store.

loans.name: Malaa B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Malaa B Group in Western Kenya! Joshua is the facilitator of the Malaa B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.  

Joshua takes care of seven children at home, together with his wife.  He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Joshua had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 23 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joshua was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joshua and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Joshua will educate his children and repay his loan with the same.

In 2012, the members of Malaa B Group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Picture
Joshua is pictured in the photograph together with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 27 years old and lives in West Point. She is single and has two children, aged 8 and 11; they are currently in school and live at home. For the past five years, she has been selling soft drinks in her community. She has less customers so she is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business. Her plan is to become a big business owner in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Tham

texts.en:
Tham, 41, is married and earns a living to support her family by running a general store. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Tham has been running a general store from her home for three years. Tham would now like to take out a loan to expand her business. With the loan, she intends to repair her home and store and buy products in bulk, such as food and basic goods to sell from her store. She hopes that this will improve the living conditions of her family and generate more income from her business. She also hopes that this will enable her to save money for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to repair her home and store and buy foods and basic goods in bulk to sell from her store.

loans.name: Nui

texts.en:
Nui is 40 years old. She lives in Trung Ban village, Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. She has two children who are going to school.

She makes rice cakes to sell.  She has had this job for ten years. She has a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). The last time she borrowed 7,840,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This is the third time she borrowed money from SEDA. In this loan she would like to borrow 9,630,000 VND to buy rice to make rice cakes.

loans.use: to buy rice to make rice cakes

loans.name: Rosa Jahayra

texts.es:
Rosa Jahayra tiene 21 años de edad evive en unión libre tiene 1 hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de dos años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao hace 2 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San Juan.

Solicita el crédito para  seguir trabajando en la agricultura comprar abonos agrícolas. Con el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar las semillas sin ningún tipo de problema por el dinero.

No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema El sueño  es tener un terreno.

En los tiempos libres le gusta realizar quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Rosa Jahayra is 21 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has one child. She lives with her husband and two-year-old son in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Rosa is a member of the San Juan Communal Bank, which is located in the neighborhood of San Francisco and part of the parish of San Juan. The members are farmers.

Rosa is a farmer who has been growing cacao for two years. She buys and sells in San Juan. Rosa is requesting a loan so that she can continue farming. She plans to buy compost. The loan will be a great help because the money will enable her to buy seeds without any problems. At the moment, she is not facing any challenges. Her dream is to have a plot of land.

In her free time, Rosa enjoys performing the household chores.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana  de 40 años de edad casada, trabaja como estilista en su propio salon de belleza desde hace más de 20 años.  Esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de comprar productos para su negocio (tintes, pinturas, otros), pues se acerca la epoca de promociones y navidad y sus clientas demandan mas atencion y trabajos y asi puede ofertar a sus clientes diferentes cosas para que sus clientas esten satisfechas con el trabajo que ella hace en su negocio.
texts.en: Ana is 40 years old, married, and has worked as a stylist in her own beauty salon for more than 20 years. She is asking for her 3rd loan with the intention of buying products for her business (tints, dyes, etc.) since she's approaching sale season and Christmas. Her clients are asking for more care and services. Also she can offer her clients different things so that they may be satisfied with the work she does in her business.

loans.use: to buy business supplies (tints, dyes, etc.)

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: El joven Oscar a sus 19 años de edad es un excelente trabajador e hijo, puesto que es el principal apoyo de su madre en el taller de confecciones en el cual trabaja y donde realiza labores de confección que su madre le enseño. Con el ánimo de mejorar el proceso productivo y calidad de las prendas elaboradas en el taller, se requiere de la compra de una máquina recubridora con la cual se pueda cumplir estos objetivos. El sueño del señor Oscar es continuar trabajando en el taller de su madre e iniciar estudios universitarios que pueda aplicar en el taller.
texts.en: The young man Oscar, age 19, is an excellent worker and son.  He is the principal support of his mother in the sewing shop in which he works and carries out the sewing work which his mother taught him.  The goals of improving the production process and the quality of dresses made in the shop require the purchase of a reconditioned sewing machine with which he can fulfill these objectives.  Señor Oscar’s dream is to continue working in his mother’s shop and begin university studies that can be applied to the business.

loans.use: to purchase a reconditioned sewing machine.

loans.name: Ledmy Esther

texts.es:
Ledmy es una joven de 21 años de edad muy trabajadora y optimista, ha trabajado desde pequeña porque sus padres no tenían muchos medios económicos y con su trabajo los apoyaba para los gastos de la casa, ella a pesar de lo difícil de su infancia, Ledmy vive en una choza, pero eso no la amilana para salir adelante y con mucho esfuerzo se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulatoria.
 
Ella ha trabajado de todo y con los ingresos que obtenia, poco a poco pudo juntar el dinero suficiente y con ello inicion su negocio de venta de ropa, Ledmy camina por las calles de su barrio vendiendo sus productos , los cuales tienen mucha acogida por sus clientes, ya que ella es muy atenta con ellos y sobre todo porque es honrada y honesta, lleva trabajando en este negocio desde hace ya 1 año y medio, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque desde muy temprano sale a las calles para ofrecer sus productos y ese esfuerzo tiene su recompensa, como dice el dicho “ Al que madruga Dios lo ayuda”.

Ledmy está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada ella podrá mejorar su vivienda ya que ella desea colocar un kiosco para ofrecer sus productos y no mucho a las calles y con esta mejora ella tendrá una mejor calidad de vida y mas seguridad para ella asi como tambien mejores ingresos y poder cumplir su mas grande sueño: "Tener una vivienda optima para vivir"
texts.en:
Ledmy, 21, is a very hardworking, optimistic young woman.  She’s worked since childhood because her parents did not have many economic resources and she helped cover household expenses with her work.  Despite the difficulties in her childhood, Ledmy lives in a hut but this does not discourage her from continuing forward and with much effort she works selling clothes in an itinerant manner.

She has worked at everything and with the income she earned she gradually saved up enough money to start a business selling clothes.  Ledmy travels along the streets in her neighborhood selling her wares which are well received by her customers because she’s very attentive to them and, above all, because she’s very honest and trustworthy.  She’s been working in this business for a year and a half and she believes that she does well because she heads out to the streets very early to offer her products and this effort has its reward; like the saying states: “God helps she who gets up early.”

Ledmy is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided she’ll be able to finish building her dwelling and and be able to improve her home and install a kiosk and not spend so much time on the streets. This improvement will mean a better quality of life and more security for her since she’ll have a dwelling in good condition.  For her, her greatest dream is: “To have an optimum dwelling to live in.”

loans.use: to finish building her house.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: Paulino tiene 36 años, es un hombre trabajador y se esmera por sobresalir adelante, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Nery de 31 años y sus 04 queridos hijos a quienes desea ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad a la que se dedica Paulino es el cultivo de café, pues posee 03 hectareas de propiedad, siendo el lugar exacto donde siembra sus productos, convirtiéndose así en uno de los principales productores de la zona porque trabaja sus cultivos de manera tecnificada. Sus productos más rentables son la piña y el cacao, por tener mayor demanda en el mercado nacional. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar y lo hace con mucha perseverancia, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los puntos de venta situados en la ciudad de San Francisco. Ahora lo que prioriza es dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos como sacar la maleza, fumigar y fertilizarlos, por necesita contratar jornaleros. Este será su crédito número 01 con MFP, esta llano a aportar sus cuotas puntualmente como lo venía haciendo en sus anteriores créditos, en su banco comunal es un socio participe y  puntual en toda las reuniones acordadas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará abono y fertilizantes para mantener sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Paulino is 36 years old. He is a hard working man and tries to get ahead. He lives in his own house with his wife Nery, who is 31, and their four dear children, to whom he would like to offer a better quality of life. The activity in which Paulino makes a living is in coffee crops, as he has three hectares of land where he plants his products. He has become one of the main producers in the area due to his technologized method of cropping. His most profitable products are pineapple and cocoa, as there is a greater demand for these in the national market. 

What he likes the most about his job is harvesting his crops and he does this diligently. He has worked for the last 15 years in this activity and he believes that the most difficult part is transporting his products from his ranch to the outlets in the city of San Francisco. 

At the moment his priority is to care for his crops by weeding, fumigating and fertilizing, for which he needs to hire labourers. This will be his first loan with MFP. He is committed to paying his quotas punctually as he has done in other loans. In his communal bank he participates and is punctual to all of his arranged meetings. With the 1,500 PEN he will buy manure and fertilizers to care for his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Juanitah

texts.en: Juanitah is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for 4 years and describes her business environment as busy because many people do business in that place. To earn extra income she runs a grocery store. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standard and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 60,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a blow dryer and hair chemicals.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer and hair chemicals

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: Nicolasa, tiene 40 años de edad, no pudo completar de forma completa sus estudios de modo que no termino su primaria. Con el tiempo ella conoció a su hoy en día esposo con quien procreó 2 hijos uno en sexto grado y el mayo quien solo curso la primaria quienes apoyan a su padre a realizar limpieza, aplicación de abonos y demás insumos agrícolas para proteger sus cultivos de café. El terreno que ella cultiva lo adquirió por medio de su padre quien le dio una parte y otra con mucho esfuerzo donde siembra además de café, granos básicos (maíz y frijol). Una vez recolectado el grano ella le vende a una persona de su comunidad quien compra, procesa y a su vez revende el producto a bodegas que se dedican exclusivamente a la compra-venta de café ubicadas en la ciudad y en ocasiones lo hace ella directamente cuando tiene la posibilidad de ahorrarse el traslado del grano hasta la ciudad. Ella solicita crédito el cual invertirá en abonar y foliar sus cultivos de café para hacer de su propiedad más productora y pagar mano de obra para darle un buen mantenimiento a la misma teniendo como resultado una mejor producción en esta nueva temporada y un mayor cuidado sobre sus cultivos. Sus metas hacer de esta producción más exitosa que la anterior, incrementar los ingresos económicos y apoyar a su hijo en sus estudios. Como sueño fortalecer el patrimonio a sus hijos y dar a cada uno de ellos una tierra digna y bendecida para trabajar.

loans.use: para compra de insumos agricolas y pago de mano de obra para asistir sus cultivos de café

loans.name: Scholastica's Group

texts.en:
Scholastica, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 13 farmers in Chwele District. She is 55 years old, is married and has 10 children.

Scholastica likes to think of herself as a very experienced farmer. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2015 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Scholastica plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Scholastica’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 4 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Amento

texts.en:
Mr. H. Amento is a very dynamic man. A married father with four (4) children, he manages a mill he set up himself thanks to a $450 credit that was subsequently reimbursed. This initiative allowed him, with the assistance of his wife, a salesperson, to feed his children and provide them with an education.

Now, in Mr. H. Amentos' community, there is a great need for a spice mill and he would like to provide it to his people. However, he does not have the money needed for this new project. He is asking for an $850 loan to build this new mill. The loan will help Mr. H. to take better care of his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur H. Amento est un homme très dynamique. Marié et père de quatre (4) enfants, il gère un moulin qu’il a installé lui-même grâce à un crédit de $450 qu’il a obtenu et remboursé sans incident. Cette activité lui permet, avec le concours de sa femme, revendeuse, de nourrir les enfants et d’assurer leur scolarité. Aujourd’hui, un grand besoin de moulin à condiments se fait sentir dans la localité et Monsieur H. Amento se propose d’en mettre un à la disposition des populations. Mais il n’a pas les moyens nécessaires pour ce nouveau projet. Il sollicite pour ce faire un crédit de $850 pour l’acquisition d’un moulin à condiments. Comme impact, ce crédit permettra à Monsieur H. de mieux subvenir aux charges de sa famille.

loans.use: to acquire a spice mill

loans.name: Maulid

texts.en:
Maulid lives in Tandika area of Dar es Salaam. He is married with four children of which two are in primary school other two are in secondary school. Maulid sells fresh fish in retail. He has to wake up very early in the morning everyday, go to the shores of Indian Ocean and buy fish from fishermen. He resell these fish in Tandika market.

Maulid want to improve his business by having enough working capital to purchase a large amount of fish. The profit margin for fish selling is small but he can improve it by having enough stock of fish. Since fish business is perishable Maulid is planning to buy some equipments which together with ice blocks can help keep the fish fresh until evening. Ice blocks are bought from Ice suppliers. Maulid is in need of USD 550 to make his plan work.

loans.use: Equipment to improve fish selling business

loans.name: Ruth Maria

texts.en:
My name is Ruth M. and I sell ice lollies and jelly. I have been doing this for a year and my sales are excellent as there are a lot of kids in the area who buy them a lot. I want to buy more ingredients so I can make more and therefore sell more. I would use the earnings to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Ruth M. me dedico a la venta de paletas y gelatinas, tengo mi negocio hace un año, mi ventas son excelentes ya que en nuestra comunidad viven muchos niños y estos son los mayores compradores, deseo tener mas inventario para tener una mayor produccion y asi vender mucho mas, y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: To buy gelatine, milk, fruit, sugar, lolly sticks, cups, colouring and flavouring/compra de gelatina, leche, frutas, azucar, paletas de madera, vasos, colorantes y saborisantes

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica T. is an orphan who is married and has five children. As an orphan she said it was never easy. But having seen other orphans in positions of responsibility and leadership Veronica states that she then decided to make it in this cruel world. Her constant motivation has been the challenge of providing education, food and medication to her kids, especially as her husband earns very little from his job.

With a loan of $100, she intends to provide her community with beauty products. She intends to buy some hair products and cosmetics that she will sell and use the profit to educate her children and provide basic needs for them. She also plans to increase her business and train apprentices. She plans to repay her loan in 15 months.

loans.use: Veronica would like to purchase hair products and cosmetics for her hair salon.

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en:
For three years Nadir has been running his own orchard, and this business gives him the opportuniy to support himself. He is 27 years old, lives in Khaladj village in the Salyan region and is single.
He needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides to improve his orchard and enjoy a better harvest.

loans.use: to buy pesticides

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo O. is a 45 year old married mother of 4. She is from Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks, provision, food and has machine for grinding of tomatoes for her customers. She has been in this business since 1987. She is requesting for a loan of $625 to buy more drinks, provisions, food for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, provisions, foodstuffs

loans.name: Avazbicko

texts.en: Avazbicko S. lives in Mastchokh; she is divorced and has 4 children. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2004. She describes herself as a serious and strongly motivated client. Loan sums have been permanently increased, which shows business stability and income increase. Avazbicko S. is a very experienced business person, who has a wide variety of business, including women's wear and shoes. She is partially engaged in another business: livestock. She trades in the bazaar, and thanks to her business capacities, she has clients who want to buy only her goods. Now Mrs. S. requires a loan for 4100 STJ, to increase her existing turnover and to purchase new merchancise, popular and in demand among the population today.

loans.use: To renew the existing assortment.

loans.name: Kasokoso Group

texts.en:
Hildah is a 38 year old widow with five children. Hildah, Aisha and Annet all have brick laying businesses. Hildah wants to pay school fees for the orphans with the extra business profits.Mollaw sells raw foodstuffs in the market and wants to use the loan to purchase more foods for sale. Margret sells used shoes.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To re-invest in their businesses

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Rhoda K.. She is married with four children, who are between the ages of 12 and 24 years old. In 2007, Rhoda established a clothing business. Rhoda has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now seeks another loan in order to purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

Rhoda is a perfect example of why micro-finance works and why the vast majority of people in her position repay their loans. A lot of people who hear about micro-finance (or kiva.org) for the first time wonder “how do you make sure people pay back their loans?" and "won't the borrowers just take the money?” Such questions wrongfully imply that the individuals who access micro-credit (usually the "poor") are less trustworthy, efficient, or educated than other people. Regardless, most MFIs have due diligence procedures in place to assess client risk, as well as measures (e.g., collateral arrangements and group lending, where a loan in default is borne by the group as a whole) to address this risk. More importantly, there is an incentive that is built into each and every micro-loan: the borrowers are incentivized to repay their loans so that they can receive additional loans as their businesses continue to grow.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback arrangements. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. Accordingly, most women in Tanzania receive poor financial support and, as such, have very little income to provide for their basic needs and services. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. In practice, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women; specifically, in a SELFINA sale and leaseback transaction, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client (to provide the client with cash flow) and then leases the equipment back to her so that she can continue to use the equipment.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Bahodurova

texts.ru:
R. Bahodurova who is 29 years old, is married and is a mother of two sons. She has a college education. After marriage she began selling women's clothing because all of the responsibilities of a family caretaker were on her shoulders after her husband went to Russian Federation to find work. She was studying in a university with hopes of getting a good education and finding a decent job in her field. But the circumstances were not in her favor of realizing her dream. She has been applying for a loan at MicroInvest since 2005 with a $100 in assets. In the future she plans to expand and increase the assortment of goods to include children's clothing.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Баходурова Рано – 29 лет. Замужем, мать двоих сынов. Образование высшее. После замужества начала заниматься продажей женскими одеждами потому как все заботы о семье легли на ее плечи после поездки мужа в РФ на заработки. Она училась в Вузе с надеждой получить хорошее образование и найти достойную работу в своей сфере. Но обстоятельства не позволили ей осуществить свою мечту. Начала кредитоваться в МЗФ Микроинвест с 2005-го года с активами на 100 долларов. А в будущем планирует расширится и добавить в свой ассортимент детскую одежду.

loans.use: Increase assortment

loans.name: Melania Patricia

texts.es:
When she began her business, Melania Patricia had on old pedal sewing machine. With time and due to demand, she purchased a modern machine. She works with families and especially with her husband, who sells her products in other cities.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Cuando inicio el negocio tenia una maquina de pedal viejita con el tiempo debido a la demanda compro una maquina moderna, trabaja con sus familias y en especial su esposo que es quien comercializa en otras ciudades.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials such as fabric, thread, lacework and other supplies

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Kofi A. is professional photographer. He is married and has 3 dependants. Mr. A. covers a wide area for his work, and would like to have a motorbike to help him make his rounds.

He is asking for a loan so he can buy a motorbike to carry out his business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to use in his business

loans.name: Nangendo Agnes, Kamu Kamu Group

texts.en:
Agnes N. is a member of the Kamu kamu women’s group in Lugazi. She is 35 years old and married with 6 children.

She has been selling new clothes as a hawker for 3 years, and she has been a member of her group for 2 years. She is requesting a loan in order to expand her business by purchasing new clothes, which will in turn enable her to continue to pay for her children's school fees. Her dream is to buy a plot of land and to then construct her own house.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional clothes

loans.name: Sony

texts.en:
Sony S. and her husband, Voeun Krouch, live in a small village on the Mekong River about 10 miles north of Phnom Penh, Cambodia's capital city. Married for 24 years, they have one son and four duaghters. Two of their children are married themselves; one son is a construction worker; and the youngest two daughters are in school.

For the past 16 years, Sony has helped support her family by weaving silk into cloth, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middle man in her village, who then resells it in Phnom Penh's markets. Meanwhile, Voeun is a mason.

To help grow her weaving business, Sony is requesting a loan of $300 U.S. dollars to purchase more silk.

loans.use: To buy silk for a weaving business

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married and lives with her husband in the town of Pavlograd in central Ukraine. After Ludmila had resigned from her last job she couldn't find a new job in her field for a while. Her family was facing a tough financial situation at the time, so she decided to take a risk and start her own small business. Today Ludmila runs a small kiosk selling shoes and clothing in the local market. Currently, she has 4 vending facilities in the same marketplace and about $16,000 invested in inventory.

Ludmila is a determined entrepreneur. She has been in business for about 20 years. She knows how to set goals and achieve them. Ludmila recognizes that financial assistance from "Nadiya Ukraine" has provided significant support for her business and has promoted its stable growth. Ludmila is requesting a loan for 5000 Grivnas to increase her turnover capital, which will allow her to re-supply her inventory and increase her sales. Eventually, Ludmila Anna is hoping to rent a bigger vending facility and open her own little shoe store. She believes that financial assistance in combination with her zeal, perseverance and diligent work will someday help her dream come true.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal footwear and clothing

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es casada y tiene 1 hija de 19 años, su esposo es albañil, es por eso que ella inicio su negocio para apoyarlo con los gastos familiares ya que sus ingresos eran variables, comenzó hace 2 años vendiendo ropa entre sus vecinos y poco a poco logro incrementar sus clientes obteniendo buenas ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses comprar mercancía y así tener variedad para la temporada otoño que esta por empezar. Con tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Francisca is married and has a 19-year-old daughter. Her husband is a bricklayer. Since his income was not steady, she started her business to help out with family expenses. Two years ago she began selling clothing to her neighbors and little by little she was able to increase her customers and make a good profit. She needs a loan for US $250, which will be repaid in 3 month, to buy merchandise and to have variety for the fall season which is about to start. With your help she will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil, is a 43 year-old father of four children. Khalil lives in a small village close to Nabatieh in the South of Lebanon where he works as a mechanic. He is a well-known expert in his business, and people from all the surrounding villages come to his garage to repair their cars. Over the years, Khalil has learned that it is far less expensive to buy spare parts in bulk by their wholesale unit price, rather than individually. He has therefore requested a loan of $1,000 from Al Majmoua to purchase the wholesale spare parts which will help him increase his small business's profitability. This is the second time that Khalil will be working with Al Majmoua. His first loan was repaid successfully and on-schedule.

loans.use: Khalil would like to purchase a supply of wholesale car parts for Khalil's auto repair shop.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice K. is an executive member of Ntinda Kafene Women's Group.  She manages a retail shop in her town's trading center that sells sugar, soap, maize flour, baking flour, cooking oil, and many other household staples.  Beatrice's shop is know for always being open, as well as being very clean, organized, and tidy.  Therefore, she has many loyal customers.  In order to restock her shop and increase the variety of products she offers, however, Beatrice is requesting a loan of $1000.

loans.use: To restock supplies and diversify products offered.

loans.name: Erick Enmanuel

texts.es: El joven Erick Manuel tiene la edad de 29 años habita en la Concepción, junto a su mamá y hermanos este joven es muy trabajador, se dedica a la agricultura y a la vez trabaja en una empresa para poder ayudarle con los gastos del hogar a su mamá y hermanos .E l papá del joven le ayuda en la finca para que el vaya a trabajar. Los sueños de este joven es llegar a establecer una manzana más de piña. Ya que el se siente muy contento por el apoyo que le brinda nuestra financiera. El solicita este préstamo para comprar insumos agrícola, como abono, veneno y otros para los cultivos y así tener una buena cosecha del cultivo de piña, y ofertar a sus clientes la buena calidad y la captación de mas clientes.
texts.en:
Erick Manuel is 29 years old and lives in the Concepcion with his mom and brothers. He is very hard working, works in a farm and at company to help his mom and brothers. His father helps him on the farm, so he can go to work. Erick would like to create another block of pineapple. He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies, like fertilizers among others. He wants to have a good harvest of pineapple and offer his clients good quality products and increase his clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies like fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will purchase garlic and hot peppers

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina tiene 28 años de edad, por mucho estuvo viviendo con su pareja, pero hace 6 años se casaron, viven en una casa alquilada. Desde que se casó es la encargada de preparar los almuerzos para los que laboran en la chacra, se levanta eso de las 6.00am para preparar el desayuno, luego alimenta a los animales que cría, tanto cuyes, como conejos, y ahora último acaba de comprar tres cerditos de los que tiene que estar muy al pendiente de su alimentación. A eso de las 8.00am preparar el menú para llevar el almuerzo para su esposo que esta preparando la chacra para la siembra de arvejas, una vez que les sirvió regresa recogiendo pasto para sus cuyes y conejos. Pero cuando es la temporada de cosecha si permanece en la chacra para coger las arvejas y a la vez supervisar a los peones. Mientras que su esposo se dedica a los trabajos más duros y pesados como cargar los sacos una vez que ya están cosechadas. Delfina viene trabajando 4 préstamos consecutivos con MFP y siempre pagó todas sus cuotas en las fechas fijadas. La cantidad solicitada es para la compra de 2 sacos de semilla de arvejas, lo que calcula costará 820 soles y con el resto del dinero comprará abonos para la chacra de papa que sembraron hace un mes.
texts.en:
Delfina is 28 years old, and has lived with her partner for many years. They married six years ago, and live in a rented house. Since they married, she is in charge of preparing meals for those who work on the farm. She gets up at 6.00am to make breakfast, then feeds the animals that she raises, including guinea pigs and rabbits. She has recently bought three little pigs, and has to be very attentive to their feeding. At 8.00am she makes the lunch meal to take out to her husband, who is preparing the fields for sowing peas. Once she has delivered the meal she returns home with grass for the guinea pigs and rabbits. During the harvest season she stays out in the fields to pick the peas and supervise the labourers. Her husband undertakes the hard and heavy work such as filling the sacks with the harvest. Delfina has worked with MFP on four consecutive loans and has always made her repayments on the designated dates. This loan will be used to buy two bags of pea seeds which will cost 820 soles, and with the rest of the money she will buy fertilizer for the potato field that was sown one month ago.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Maritza es socia del Banco Comunal “21 de Febrero”, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos y posee estudios de secundaría completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años, se dedica al engorde de ganado menor (ovinos y porcinos); su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir ganado (ovinos) para venderlos como carne. 
Con este préstamo de S/ 600.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 03 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir mas ganado (ovejas cara negra) y engordarlos para venderlos en forma de carne en las ferias y mercados de Ilave, su anhelo es dedicarse también al engorde ganado mayor y ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the community bank 21 de Febrero, in Ilave district, Collao province, in the department of Puno. She is 25 years old, married, has four children, and has completed her high school education. Maritza has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for four years, and she’s in the business of raising small livestock (sheep and pigs). With her first loan of 300 soles, she was able to buy and raise more livestock (sheep) to sell for meat. With a new loan of 600 soles, which she plans to repay in three monthly installments, Maritza will be able to buy more blackface sheep to raise and sell for meat at the fairs and markets in Ilave. Maritza plans to become very skilled at raising livestock; she wants to set a professional example for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and raise more livestock (blackface sheep), which can be sold for meat at fairs and markets in Ilave.

loans.name: Sin's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four members. Its leader, S., 39, is a mother of three children, all of whom are attending school. She is a widowed mother. She works in the massage center providing massage service. She has been in this service for more than two years. She gets good recognition from her manager very often because she works very hard. She is a manageable mother and a responsible neighbor.

She uses an old motorbike as her family's transportation but it is broken very often. S. is taking out a loan to buy a new motorbike for her work and for her family's transportation.

The other group members are: S., 24, who works in a hotel and is taking out a loan to buy more cooked ingredients for his wife's store; S., 30, who also works in the hotel, is applying for a loan to repair her motorbike for her transportation; and N., 23, who serves as a public cleaner and is taking out a loan to buy more cooking materials for selling Khmer noodles after her work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Divino Rostro Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Divino Rostro, está integrado por las señoras Martha S., quien vende comida en su casa, ofrece platos de menú corriente en los almuerzos y cenas que ofrece a sus clientes, Doña Sandra Vanesa Sequeira, vende cosméticos y joyería de plata, doña Juana Mercedes que tiene una pulpería en su casa y doña María Auxiliadora R. que vende rosquillas de manera ambulante en los diferentes departamentos del país. Estas señoras son originarias de la ciudad de Diriomo, siendo mujeres muy trabajadoras, emprendedoras y responsables, ejemplo de esto tenemos a la señora Juana Mercedes B. quien con mucho esfuerzo ha sabido mantener su pequeña pulpería, ella es una mujer de 56 años con muchas esperanzas de salir adelante, se siente con muchas energías de emprender más en su negocio. Ella vive con su esposo, no tiene a ningún hijo a cargo, trabaja para mantenerse, su esposo le ayuda a hacer compras y además colabora con los gastos de la casa.
Doña Juana expresa que ella se siente muy orgullosa de trabajar con Adim porque ha tenido la oportunidad de compartir capacitaciones donde está aprendiendo a manejar el negocio, poco antes de trabajar con el crédito ella pensaba cerrar el negocio y en Adim ha aprendido que el negocio puede seguir compitiendo con otros establecimientos, esto le ha dado un reto en la vida.
El grupo espera siempre ser un grupo puntual, esto les ha dado mucha satisfacción y oportunidad de trabajar.
texts.en:
The members of the Divino Rostro group are Martha S. who sells food from her house, providing a running menu for lunch and dinner; Sandra Vanesa Sequeira who sells cosmetics and silver jewelry; Juana Mercedes who owns a general store in a space at her house; and Maria Auxiliadora R. who travels the country selling "rosquillas" (a local pastry). These women are natives of the city of Diriomo. They're hard-working, entrepeneurial and responsible. As an example of this, we have Juana Mercedes Bermudez who, with much effort, has learned to operate a small general store. She is a woman of 56 with a lot of experience at getting ahead and energy to spare for improving her business even more. She lives with her husband. She works to keep herself but her husband helps with sales and shares the household expenses. Juana says that she is very proud to work with Adim because it's given her the chance to attend seminars and learn to manage her business. Before starting to work with the bank, she thought about closing the business but Adim has taught her that businesses sometimes have to compete with other businesses and that it's nothing more than another of life's challenges. The group always expects its members to repay their loans on time, something that has given them a lot of satisfaction along with the chance to work.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Truong Thi

texts.en:
H. Truong (632981252) is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyen. She is married and has 2 infant children. To making a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. H. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 Vietnamese Dong a month from these activities.

In 1998, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. H. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 Dong which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. The loan will be the 10th loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: For baby livestock

loans.name: Abubakr

texts.ru: Худойкулов Абубакр житель города Яван. Имеет собственный участок земли , который использует для того под посев пшеницы и других злаковых культур. Кроме того он сажает овощи. В днный момент земля засеена пшеницей. Поэтому он обратлся к нам за кредитом , для того, чтобы купить удобрения и обработать пшеницу. Своевременная обработка даст возможность получить хороший урожай. Урожай он сможет быстро реализовать и получить доход.Абубакр жнат и имеет троих детей.
texts.en:
Abubakr K. lives in the town of Yavan. He has his own plot of land which he uses for sowing of wheat and other cereals. He also plants vegetables. At this time the land is sown with wheat. He has come to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer for wheat. Timely fertilization will help him collect a good harvest. And then he can quickly sell the harvest and make a profit. Abubakr is married and has three children.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a fertilizer for wheat

loans.name: Armando Javier

texts.es:
A sus 41 años de edad, en la ciudad de Masaya, el señor Armando Z. se dedica a su actividad de elaboración de hamacas típicas dedicándose a esto desde hace 7 años habiendo alcanzado una gran experiencia en este trabajo.

Actualmente, el señor Armando requiere de la compra de los materiales de trabajo para elaborar las hamacas ya que son comercializadas tanto a personas nacionales como a extranjeros. Es por este motivo que él ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de dichos materiales de trabajo con el fin de continuar elaborando estas bellísimas hamacas típicas Nicaragüenses para todas las personas.
texts.en:
At 41 years of age, in the city of Masaya, Armando Z. makes typical hammocks. He has been doing this for seven years, and he has achieved a high level of experience in this work. Currently, Armand needs to buy work materials to make his hammocks, which are commercialized as much to Nicaraguans as to foreigners. For this reason he has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan. He will use the loan to buy work materials to continue making this beautiful, typical, Nicaraguan hammocks for everyone.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy work materials

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Y. Nguyễn Thị (1044061361) is a 29-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has two school-aged children.

Y. owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month.

In 2004, Y. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

Y. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 5th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Chiltoma Group

texts.es: Foto De izquierda a derecha: Nubia Auxiliadora Obregón González, Consuelo del Carmen P. González e Idayda Carolina P.
texts.en: In the photo from left to right: Nubia Auxiliadora Obregón González, Consuelo del Carmen P. González, and  Idayda Carolina P.

loans.use: Pruchase fruit to sell

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.en:
Junie L. is a 23-year-old entrepreneur who lives with her family in a slum in Puerta Plata. She is originally from Haiti, but moved to the Dominican Republic with her husband in search of a better life. The Dominican Republic boasts a much higher standard of living and per capita GDP (gross domestic product) than Haiti. Even so, there is a great deal of racism toward Haitians, who tend to find themselves working at menial jobs if they are lucky enough to find work at all. Junie has been struggling to adapt to the new culture and language in Puerta Plata.

Junie and her husband live with their children, Ricardo and John Pierre, who are 8 and 5 years old. The children attend a local school where they study hard to make good grades. Junie ultimately hopes to enroll her children into a university, but her income is not currently sufficient to harbor such a dream. She makes 2,000 DRP a month (about 57 USD), but thinks she will be able to significantly increase her earnings through Esperanza.

Junie plans to use her loan to start a small restaurant in her home. She says that she will cook rice, beans, chicken, and beef, which are some of the staples of the Dominican diet. She will buy the raw materials from a local food vendor in her neighborhood. Ultimately, Junie would like to open a fully-fledged restaurant in a busier section of Puerta Plata. That goal is a long way off, but the determination in Junie’s eyes suggests it is a definite possibility. Your contribution will help Junie make the first step to turn her aspirations into reality.

loans.use: To purchase food and ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Astromelia Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora Astromelia es socia del Banco Comunal Rocafuerte, un grupo de 21 mujeres que residen en el pueblo de Rocafuerte, aproximadamente media hora de la ciudad de Portoviejo. La ciudad es muy conocida por los dulces que vende. El grupo Rocafuerte es muy unido, y las señoras se llevan muy bien entre ellas. El día de nuestra entrevista con Sra. Astromelia era el cumpleaños de una de las socias, por eso sirvieron unos bocaditos y cada socia aportó un poco de dinero para regalarla. 

Sra. Astromelia tiene 44 años, es casada, y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 son mayores de edad y 2 son menores (de 15 y 16 años). 3 de ellos viven con ella todavía. Ella y su esposo tienen un estudio de fotografía, llamado “Estudio Arely’s” por su hija, Arely. Su esposo también trabaja como profesor, entonces ella atiende el negocio durante la semana mientras él está en clases. Su hija también les ayuda con el negocio. Iniciaron el negocio porque el sueldo de su marido no les alcanzaba para pagar sus necesidades básicas, y a ella no le gustaba mucho al inicio, pero ahora sí le gusta, aunque dice que siempre llega muy cansada a la casa al fin del día. Trabajan todo tipo de eventos, como por ejemplo matrimonios y cumpleaños, normalmente 1-2 por semana, y trabajan tanto con cámaras digitales como de rollos. 

La señora está pidiendo un crédito a la Fundación ESPOIR para invertir en la compra de materiales para su negocio, como por ejemplo papel, químicos, álbumes y una cámara. Dice que su sueño para el futuro es jubilarse para poder descansar, también está pensando en poner algun negocio en la misma casa para no tener que salir más de la casa para trabajar. 

Ella ha sido socia de su banco comunal para años ya, es socia fundadora y el banquito en sí es bastante antiguo, el grupo ya tiene 32 ciclos trabajando juntos. “Me ayudan bastante,” dice de los préstamos. Solamente una vez hace 4 años tuvo un problema para pagar su crédito, aparte de eso ha sido muy puntual.
texts.en:
Mrs. Astromelio is a member of the Rocafuerte Community Bank and is in a group of 21 women who live in the town of Rocafuerte, which is approximately half an hour from the city of Portoviejo. The city is very well-known for the sweets that it sells. The group Rocafuerte is very united, and the women get along very well. The day of the interview with Mrs. Astromelia was the birthday of one of the members, so they served snacks and every member contributed some money to give a gift. Mrs. Astromelia is 44 years old, is married, and has 4 children, of whom 2 are adults and 2 are younger (15 and 16 years old). Three of her children still live with her. She and her husband have a photography studio, called “Arely’s Studio,” after their daughter Arely. Her husband also works as a teacher, so she takes care of the business during the week while he is in classes. Her daughter also helps them with the business. They started the business because her husband’s salary isn’t enough for them to meet their basic needs. At first, she didn’t like the business very much, but now she enjoys it, even though she says that she is very tired when she comes home at the end of the day. They work at all kinds of events, like weddings and birthdays. They normally work once or twice a week, and they work with both digital cameras and cameras with film. She is asking for a loan from Fundación ESPOIR to invest in the purchase of materials for her business, like paper, chemicals, albums and a camera. She says that her dream for the future is to retire so that she can rest. She is also thinking about having some business in her own house so that she doesn’t have to leave home to work. She has been a member of the community bank for years. She is a founding member, and the bank is very experienced. The group has already worked together for 32 cycles. She says that the loans help her a lot. Only once, four years ago, she had a problem of repaying her loan, and apart from this, she has been very punctual.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paper, chemicals, albums and a camera for her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
La Sra. Mary F. tiene 32 años y esta casada con el Sr. Rubén Darío Martinez que tiene 30 años, el mismo se desempeña como oficial de policía en la ciudad de Caacupé, a 50 km. De la capital del país. Tienen una hija de ocho años que actualmente esta cursando sus estudios primarios.
La Sra. Mary F. habilito la despensa cuyo nombre es Vanina Jazmín en el año 2007. Dicha decisión la tomo considerando que se mudo a un barrio nuevo donde había pocos negocios habilitados por lo que prácticamente no tendría competencia en la zona. 
El préstamo que solicita desea invertir en la compra de mercaderías en forma mayorista como ser arroz, azúcar, fideos de distintos tipos, yerba, harina, productos enlatados y otros. De esa manera tendría un menor costo por las mercaderías y obtendría mayor utilidad por la venta de las mismas.

loans.use: Compra de mercaderías en forma mayorista como ser arroz, azúcar, fideos de distintos tipos, yerba, harina, productos enlatados y otros.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia G. is a fish vendor and has been in her business for the past twenty-five years. She and her fisherman husband, Delfin, are partners not only in life but also in business.

Growing a business without access to credit was hard for Cecilia since both she and her husband have no other business for a source of income. This became worse when her two children had to go to college.

Wanting to sustain the education of her children in college, Cecilia had to make her business profitable by growing it. Thus, she decided to join ASHI to be able to have access to additional capital.

From then on, Cecilia’s business started to grow until the time has come when Cecilia now has to request a larger amount of capital. She has to increase the volume of the various fish she buys and sells in her fish stall in the municipality’s public market.

Someday, Cecilia wishes that, out of the profit her business makes, she will be able to purchase a vehicle to be used in her business for selling and buying a larger volume of fish in far off places.

Cecilia is so happy for having loans for her business because her profits have enabled her to send her two children to college. Her eldest is a commerce graduate while the second child is a college undergraduate. Whatever life they will be having in the future, Cecilia will be very happy to turn over her business to her children someday.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Luz Amelia

texts.es:
Luz Amalia tiene dos negocios, hacen movilidad escolar, su esposo maneja una de las combis,  en diferentes horarios llevan 30 niños al colegio en Nueva Esperanza, también tienen una  bodega donde vende gas, en este negocio las ventas han bajado bastante.  
Necesita un préstamo de 2800 soles, para compra de 4 llantas para sus carros y realizar algunos arreglos de la combi.
El sueño de Luz es tener una flota de autos.
texts.en:
Luz Amalia has two businesses, one of which is taking children to school. Her husband drives one of their small vans and takes 30 kids to school in Nueva Esperanza at different times during the day. They also have a small shop where they sell soda. Sales in this business have dropped significantly. She needs a loan of 2800 soles to buy 4 tires for their vehicles and to make a few repairs on the van. Luz dreams of having lots of cars.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 4 tires for their vehicles

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline B. is popular as “Vangie” in their community. She is one of the inhabitants in Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 26 years old and finished only high school studies. Due to financial constraints, she is not able to pursue her college studies. She works as a maid and helps her parents to earn a living until she got married to Alexander B. and they are blessed with five children. For the sake of their daily living and future of their children, both of them work hard to earn income.
	As a way of gaining income, her husband works in a rice mill located at Boret, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya while Vangie engaged in fish, fruits and vegetable vending. She started it with a small capital, but being an industrious mother, she can able to earn a net income of Php 600.00 per week which they used to budget for their daily needs and for the education of their children. Since their children are in the highest stage of education, they need to earn more income to support their studies. In this regard, Evangeline joined the Microfinance Institution and applied for a loan amount of P 5,000.00 to be able to increase her capital for the improvement of her business. She hopes that with her patience and sacrifices, she can able to improve her small business and their children will be able to finish their studies.

loans.use: additional capital in selling fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio tiene 43 años, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 20 años se dedica en las tareas agrícolas y ganaderas, él sale todas las mañanas para observar sus tierras y estar pendiente del crecimiento de sus cultivos. Sus principales productos agrícolas son la papa, el olluco, la cebada y el trigo, pero los más rentables, en su caso, son la cebada y el trigo porque tiene mejores precios en el mercado. Adicionalmente, Gregorio cría vacas, ovejas y cerdos, en un lugar que preparó en su propio terreno, los cuales vende cada tres meses, luego de que han alcanzado el peso adecuado. 
Su deseo a futuro, como el de todo agricultor, es incrementar su producción e incrementar sus animales.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito con MFP a su nombre, pues anteriormente era su esposa la titular de los créditos, siendo ambos muy reconocidos en su banco comunal por su responsabilidad. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de un torete para incrementar la cantidad de animales que tiene.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 43 years old and lives with his wife and 4 children in his own home. For the past 20 years he has worked in farming and ranching. He goes out each morning to check on his fields and to watch his crops grow. His main crops are potatoes, olluco (a small, potato-like tuber), barley and wheat, but the most profitable are barley and wheat because they have better prices on the market. In addition, Gregorio raises cows, sheep and pigs in a place that he fixed up on his land. He sells them every three months once they reach the right weight. His hope for the future, like all farmers, is to increase production and have more animals. This is the first time he has asked for a loan from MFP in his own name. Before, his wife was the borrower but both are known in their community bank for being responsible. The loan he requests will be used to buy a bull in order to increase the number of animals he has.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a bull.

loans.name: Rad

texts.en: Rad S., 33, is married with three school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she and her husband are engaged in a business of selling fish at the market, earning collectively an income of US $10 per day to help cover the family expenses. They help each other in the business to ensure that their new and existing customers are satisfied with their services. Mrs. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. S. is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase a kind of Cambodian food (Pror Huk) made from fish to stock and resell at retail for a higher price.

loans.use: To buy supplies of fish  (Pror Huk) for resale

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is happily married to Dace Jane, who is also his business partner. They run a computer shop in their village of Arellano, beside the University of Saint Louis Tuguegarao City. Most of their customers are teachers and students. They have been engaged in this business for almost five years.

Since technology is becoming more advanced, Romeo is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 from Kiva lenders to buy the necessary materials for them to upgrade their computers. This loan will enable the business to grow and become more stable for the future of their children. Romeo is hoping that his request will be granted.

loans.use: Additional capital to upgrade their computers

loans.name: Sut

texts.en: Sut E. is a 48-year-old cultivator, a married mother of three young children. Sut E. was not available for a photograph so her husband is pictured instead. Sut E. is married to Sgoun Vinh, age 47, who is a construction worker. Sut E. hopes to make extra income by using her loan to order rice to resell at a profit.

loans.use: To order rice to resell

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Mr. Sun V., 20, is a single man and resides in Phnom Penh city. Presently, he works as internal staff in the marketing department for a private school and earns a salary of $150 each month. Sun V. dreams of having a new enterprise but he does not have the capital to start it. Recently, he borrowed a loan of from Kiva through HKL to be used to operate a phone sale business.

loans.use: To operate a phone sale business.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is thirty-eight years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to five children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

Sara sells beans and groundnuts. She buys bags of beans and groundnuts from nearby communities and sells them to food vendors and retailers in her community. She has been in business for thirteen years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy beans and groundnuts

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es: El grupo Nuevo Horizonte se caracteriza por ser muy unido, y por tener negocios en la misma zona central D. la localidad, una parte del grupo vive en alquiler, algunos en casa prestada pueD. ser D. suegros o padres, algunos en casa propia. El grupo está compuesto por 10 socios D. los cuales 3 son varones y 7 son mujeres, la mitad D. las socias se dedican al negocio D. la venta D. alimentos tipo snack, el resto se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes y comercio D. computadora.
