Marisel Shirley que es la presidenta del grupo es una promotora  mayorista D. tarjetas D. teléfono desD. hace 10 años, Julia atienD. en su snack desD. hace 15 años, AyD. tiene su frial y también una tienda D. artículos en general esto desD. hace 10 años, Leoncia	se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes con una antigüedad en el rubro D. 20 años, Amanda	es comerciante	desD. hace 6 años, Marcia Olivia es comerciante D. calzados desD. hace 3 años atrás, Maria angelica se dedica al comercio D. ropa y tiene una experiencia D. 20 años en este rubro, Ross Aurelio venD. 	equipos informáticos con una experiencia D. 6 años, Freddy atienD. su pensión donD. ofrece almuerzos y otros platos esto desD. hace 23 años, Nestor Hector tiene una vidriería que atienD. hace 15 años. Como se pueD. ver el grupo en general tiene bastante experiencia en sus respectivos grupos. La competencia como en todo negocio a nivel nacional está presente pero lo bueno es que tienen sus temporadas y este grupo va a invertir para tener ingresos en las fiestas carnavaleras. El crédito es utilizado para la compra D. mas mercadería para surtir un puesto D. ingreso como por ejemplo un snack, una proveedora D. alimentos que tiene puesto en el mercado y los comerciantes D. computadoras para la compra D. accesorios que luego comercializa, el que hace trabajos D. vidrios comprara marcos y vidrios para la venta y para sus trabajos que mensualmente tiene. Las personas negociantes que solicitan créditos en agrocapital esperan ver mejorar sus negocios con la ayuda del crédito que se les otorga, esperan ver mejorar a sus hijos en la educación y mejorar su forma D. vida, aumentar y ampliar sus negocios. Estas personas componentes del grupo son personas con experiencia en créditos y están muy acostumbrados a trabajar con créditos ya que saben utilizarlo en sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group "Nuevo Horizonte" (New Horizon) is very close and the members have businesses in the same central area of their town. Some of the group lives in rented homes, others in houses loaned to them by in-laws or parents, and others own their own homes. The group is maD. up of 10 members, of whom 3 are men and 7 are women. Half of the members sell snack food, the rest sell groceries and have a computer business. Marisel Shirley, the president of the group, has been a wholesaler of telephone cards for the past 10 years. Julia has had a snack business for 15 years. AyD. has a snack shop and has also had a general store for 10 years. Leoncia has been selling groceries for about 20 years. Amanda has had a business for 6 years. Marcia Olivia has sold shoes for 3 years. Maria Angelica sells clothing and has been in this business for 20 years. Ross Aurelio has been selling computer equipment for 6 years. Freddy has had a small restaurant where he offers lunches and other meals for 23 years. Nestor Hector has been making glass for 15 years. As you can see, in general the group has a great deal of experience in their respective areas. As with all businesses in the country, there is competition, but the good thing is that each group has its season. This group is going to invest in order to make money during the Carnival parties. The loan will be used to purchase more merchandise to stock a business such as a snack stand, or for a person who makes meals to have a stand in the market. The people with computer businesses will purchase accessories that they will sell, the glass maker will purchase frames and glass for sale and for his monthly jobs. The business people who request loans from Agrocapital hope to improve their businesses with the help of the loan. They hope to improve their children's education, improve their quality of life, and to grow and expand their businesses. The members of this group are experienced with loans and are very accustomed to working with loans as they already know how to use them in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Soan

texts.en: Soan C. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 19 years old. Soan is single. To make a living, Soan operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling processed food like pork tocino, longganiza and chorizo in the local community. Soan has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Soan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Soan is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Soan from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Idermunh

texts.en:
Idermunh is 29 years old and lives with his parents and two younger siblings in Tuv province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His father works at a government tax office, and his mother works as a accountant for an electric power center. They have been living in their current home for 19 years. They repaired their car this year with money from these jobs. 

Idermunh has been operating a taxi service since 2008. After running his business for almost three years, he has a number of consistent customers. Idermunh's customers usually call him by phone when they need his services, an arrangement convenient for the customers. His average daily revenue is approximately 15,000 tugrugs (~ 10 USD). Previously, he had a Korean “Excel” car, but he was able to acquire the higher quality Toyota Chaser for his taxi service. 

Furthermore, since 2008 Idermunh has been growing potatoes in Jargalan soum of Tov province as well. He is a decent and very hardworking person. He says, “I would like to work hard in order to expand the business and to purchase my own place to live separately from the family. ” He is requesting a 3,600,000 tugrug loan to purchase large amount of seed  potato to plant in the upcoming spring.

loans.use: To purchase large amount of potato seeds to plant

loans.name: Eirá  Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Eirá Mercedes S. Aguilera, es una señora  emprendedora dueña de un negocio de venta de jugos, agua y choco-litas. El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$10,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 10 años. Este negocio está ubicado en Mercado Israel lewite entrada principal de la COTRAN 
 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de leche, agua helada y gaseosa.

Es casada, con dos hijos a su cargo, este se encuentra en edad escolar. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella Trabajaba como domestica.

Lleva 8 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 3 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos para poder competir en el mercado, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Eirá is an enterprising woman and the owner of a business that sells juices, water, and chocolate milk. She started with capital of 10,000 NIO which she borrowed ten years ago. Her business is located in the Israel Iewite market, in the principal entrance to COTRAN. She is asking for this loan in order to provide working capital to invest in milk, water, and soft drinks. She is married and has school-aged two children. She says that she used to work as a domestic before starting this business. Eirá has had eight previous loans through CEPRODEL, within the past three years, which she has invested into her business. She's been able to grow the business by diversifying her merchandise to be able to compete in the marketplace. All of this thanks to the financing through CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana, de 21 años, es una joven muy alegre y con muchas ganas de sobre salir en la vida. Vive con su esposo en la casa de su madre y lo que más desea es tener un futuro mejor.

Desde muy joven sintió que tenía que trabajar en todo lo que pudiera, fue así que a la edad de 17 años se dedicó a vender comida rápida. Con esas ganancias pudo juntar el dinero que necesitaba para comprar 2 vacas, las cuales junto a los corderos que su madre le regaló, han logrado que poco a poco salga adelante con la venta de ganado.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es alimentar a sus animales, ya que les tiene mucho cariño, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar su ganado hasta la feria de la ciudad. Con el tiempo, espera incrementar la cantidad de animales que tiene, ya que siente que es hora de crecer.

Este es el quinto préstamo de Maximiliana con MFP y quiere pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a posteriores préstamos, con lo cuales pueda mejorar su negocio, sabe que en su banco comunal la apoyaran y la guiaran, ya que es una socia muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará un par de corderos para alimentarlos y cuidarlos, y posteriormente venderlos.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is 21 years old. She is a very joyful young woman who really wants to get ahead in life. She lives with her husband in her mother's house and what she wants the most is to have a better future. Since the time she was very young, she felt that she had to work as much as she could. That is why, when she was 17 years old, she began to sell fast food. With those earnings she was able to get the money together that she needed to buy 2 cows. Together with the lambs that her mother gave her, she has been able to get ahead little by little by selling cattle. What she likes the most about her job is feeding her animals, since she has a lot of affection for them. She has been doing this for 7 years and thinks that the hardest part is transporting her cattle to the city market. With time, she hopes to increase the number of animals that she has, since she thinks that it is time to grow. This is the fifth loan that Maximiliana has had with MFP. She want to make her payments on time since she wants to access loans afterwards in order to improve her business. She knows that her communal bank will support her and guide her, since she is a well liked member. With the thousand nuevos soles she has requested, she will buy a couple of lambs to feed and take care of and later sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase animals

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 52 años, madre D. cuatro 4 hijos y juntos viven en su casa propia. DesD. hace 18 años venD. golosinas, en donD. su público objetivo son los niños, escolares la gran mayoría, puesto que venD. cerca D. una escuela. Aprovechando los horarios D. recreo y D. salida, no se da abasto para atender varios niños, es por ello que recibe la ayuda D. sus hijos, además la apoyan cuando necesite comprar alguna mercadería y necesita transportarla hasta su casa.  Este negocio le es muy rentable, ya que lo productos que venD. tiene mucha demanda. Su mayor anhelo es aumentar sus ventas, así como su carreta D. golosinas para poder abastecerse D. más mercadería. Este es su onceavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D. pertenecer a su grupo comunal, ya que valoran mucho la amistad, además asegura que será muy responsable con sus pagos. El crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra al por mayor D. golosinas, como: cajas D. galletas D. diferentes sabores, caramelos, chupetines, refrescos, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Luz is 52 years old, the mother of 4 children, and together, they live in her own house. For around 18 years she has sold treats and her customers are children, the great majority students, since she sells near a school. She benefits from the students' recreational and departure times but is unable to buy merchandise to serve all the various children and has to rely on assistance from her own children for both merchandise and transportation to and from her home. The business is very profitable due to high demand for the products. Her major hope is to increase sales, and to supply her cart of treats with more merchandise. This is her 11th loan with MFP. She is very content to belong to her communal group, since she places high value on friendship, and she promises to be very responsible with her payments. The loan she solicits will be used for buying wholesale treats, such as packages of cookies of different flavors, caramels, and lollipops, among other products.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING TREATS TO SELL

loans.name: Ijilsekhbayar

texts.en: Ijilsekhbayar is 41, widowed, and has a 12-year-old daughter, Bolor-Erdene, who attends a local secondary school. They live in a rental apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In 2008, Ijilsekhbayar, started selling bricks to local construction companies. From the beginning, the business has been doing well, with business capital increasing from 500,000 MNT (~357 USD) to 2.3 million MNT (~1,660 USD). Ijilsekhbayar dreams of owning a larger brick factory that can meet the needs of larger construction companies. She also hopes her daughter will achieve a high level of education. Ijilsekhbayar is now requesting a loan to buy construction materials for her brick baking.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Ma. Jesovie

texts.en:
Ma. Jesovie F., 39 years old, is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married to Raymundo. To earn a living, Ma. Jesovie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ma. Jesovie has been engaged in her business for over three years now.

In 2008, Ma. Jesovie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Jesovie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Ma. Jesovie from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Three people make up this group loan, located in Ha Bour village in Prey Veng province. Mrs. Ly S. is the group leader, selected by the other members, each of whom will use their pieces of the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Ly S. is 40 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Choun Soy, have a small child. They are farmers who own a half-hectare plot of land on which they grow rice to support their family. In addition, her husbandworks as a laborer. Although they try to maximizetheir business, they believe they can earn more of an income. For this reason, to improve the standard of living of her family, Mrs. Ly S. is requesting a loan to buy piglets and pig feed in order to start a new business. The rest of the loan will be used to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Seun

texts.en:
Mrs. Seun N. is a married woman with three children, one of whom is a laborer in Thailand, while the others are attending local public school. Her husband, Mr. Sorn Khen, is a fisherman who can earn some money from selling fish and frogs to support his family. This family lives in Daeum Pou village in Takeo province. 

Mrs. Seun N. is a farmer who owns a three-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice to sell to support her family. Now she has a problem because her field should be planted but she does not have enough money to support it. So to improve production, Mrs. Seun N. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, gasoline, and rent a plow to plow her field. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, gasoline, and rent a plow to plow her field

loans.name: Vutha

texts.en:
Mrs. Vutha C. (pictured above) was married in 1991 and she has three children:  two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. The family lives in a small village a long National Road Number Two, about thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Vutha has been selling fruit (banana and jackfruit) since 1994. She buys them from her fellow villagers and transports them to sell in Takhmao market located in Phnom Penh. In addition, she also sells Cambodian cakes in her village. From 12 pm after lunch, Vutha prepares and makes the cakes by herself and sells them through the afternoon.

Vutha does not have enough capital to use for her cake selling business, so she is asking for a loan of $100 to finance her capital.

loans.use: To use as additional capital.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel de 27 años de edad  es casado, labora en la alcaldía municipal de Nueva Guinea como supervisor de proyecto,  ademas cuenta con ingresos adicionales que le permiten mayor estabilidad economica. 

Abel esta solicitando su 2do credito  para realizar compra de material de construcción y poder construir un dormitorio que le brindara mayor comodidad a su familia. Expresa sentirse muy satisfecho con el servicio recibido, pues con el credito anterior logro comprar su computadora, la que le sirve como instrumento de trabajo en su jornada diaria. 

Se ha caracterizado por ser un excelente cliente, responsable, honesto, de buen liderazgo, su familia es de buenos principios religiosos y morales.
texts.en:
Abel is 27 years old, married, and works for the City of Nueva Guinea as a project supervisor. He also has additional income that allows him to have greater financial stability.

Abel is requesting his second loan so that he can buy construction materials to build a bedroom that will provide greater comfort for his family. He is very happy with the service he has received. With his previous loan he was able to purchase a computer that he uses every day for work.

Abel is known for being an excellent client. He is responsible, honest, demonstrates good leadership, and comes from a family with outstanding religious principles and morals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build an additional bedroom

loans.name: Agape Women Group

texts.en:
Kolu B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Agape Women. Kolu is 41 years old and is married with four children who range from 5 to 15 years old. She also cares for two siblings. Kolu was not able to attend school due to poverty.

For six years, Kolu has been selling bread in Congo Town Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 10,400 Liberian dollar portion of this 38,800 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more bags of flour. She describes herself as a hard-working person.

Kolu’s goal is to expand her business, build a house, and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of flour

loans.name: Carpo

texts.en:
Carpo T. is from the town of Talibon. He is 45 years old and married with seven school-aged children. To make a living, Carpo owns and operates a business venture providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income is primarily from hauling scrap metal for local businesses and community members.

Carpo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Carpo has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Carpo is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to expand his business. This will be Carpo's seventh loan from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support his family.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cloth for his business

loans.name: Juvylyn

texts.en: Juvylyn A. is from the village of Caraniogan. She is 30 years old. Juvylyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Juvylyn raises pigs for breeding. Juvylyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Juvylyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvylyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Juvylyn is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Juvylyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Khusravjon

texts.en:
Since he was a boy, Khusravjon has loved animals. He has learned to raise them well so that he can market them. Khusravjon is not married and lives with his large family. As the oldest brother, he has to work hard to support his family. He needs to invest in his livestock and sheep breeding business and, consequently, he's asked IMON International for a loan that will allow him to purchase young cattle and the feed for them. Khusravjon is sincerely grateful for your support.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. Tajikistan has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Today Tajikistan is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture, and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve agricultural production and manufacturing, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have the opportunity to develop viable businesses. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Kisoga United Group-Kayunga

texts.en: N. Christine belongs to Kisoga United Group-Kayunga. Her involvement in business began years back when she tried her hand at a poultry business that sadly is not operational any more. She used the experience and money she got out of running that business to venture into agro produce sales. She also has a commercial motorcycle business that she says is invaluable as regards the addition onto her overall profits. 160,000 shillings is what she makes in a month. With this loan, she wants to buy more agro produce for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more agro produce for resale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “22 de Setiembre” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con seis hijos y sin estudios.
Rosa   se dedica  a la crianza, compra y venta de animales menores, además de esto, también realiza el engorde de ganados como, toros y chanchos. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, con un préstamo inicial de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, el cual  le permitió iniciar con la actividad que realiza. Agradece a la institución por haberle dado la facilidad del préstamo para poder levantarse y seguir adelante no solo  en lo económico sino también en lo moral a través de las charlas.
Ahora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá incrementar el capital de su negocio.
Su sueño es seguir adelante  con  su negocio y tener una granja de cuyes. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las charlas.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank "22 de Septiembre" [September 22nd] located in the Llave district, province of El Collao and department of Puno. She is 50 years of age, in a committed relationship, with six children and uneducated. 

Rosa earns a living raising, buying and selling small animals. In addition to this she fattens livestock such as bulls and pigs. She has been working with the Manuela Rosa Movement for five years with an initial loan of 300 nuevos soles which allowed her to start up her business. She appreciates the institution for granting her the loan so that she may rise up and continue on, not just economically but also morally by means of the talks. 

Now she will seek a new loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, money which will allow her to expand her business capital. Her dream is to continue on in her business and have a guinea pig farm. Her favorite part of the Communal Bank are the talks.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Rey

texts.en:
Rey G. is from the village of Cabungaan Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 34 years old and is married. Rey owns & operates a transportation business. He has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rey joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to repair his vehicle to offer better service. This will be his first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle to offer better service

loans.name: Ruth Maria

texts.es: Ruth María N.  vive en el barrio Los Almendros del municipio de Soledad,  donde vende productos naturales y mercancía variada;  es muy usual encontrar en su negocio  vitaminas, Omega 3 entre otros productos  como fantasías, cosméticos, aunque también vende calzado y ropa interior y para niños. Ella inició este negocio puerta a puerta  en el año 2004 entusiasmada por su cónyuge,  que se dedica a la litografía y  haciendo trabajos a los laboratorios conoció los que hoy son los  proveedores de Ruth María y a los que  inició comprándole  $200.000 COP,   en productos naturales como los ya mencionados;    gradualmente  Ruth ha ido adicionando otros artículos, como ropa, fantasías, cosméticos y casi todo lo que sus clientes necesitan para su vida diaria, porque ha  aprovechado efectivamente  la gran clientela que se desprendió de su negocio inicial de venta de productos naturales. Sus principales clientes, son los habitantes del barrio y muchos referidos de estos en  otras comunidades; Ruth María es una muy buena empresaria que les acredita  a sus clientes  solo lo que ellos pueden pagar  y en los plazos acordados, por eso recupera su cartera semanalmente y algunos en cada quincena. Ella compra de contado y adquiere frecuentemente descuentos, porque sus proveedores la conocen muy bien y a su vez sabe como negociar sus compras. Su margen de contribución es del 40%   con respecto a los productos naturales,  recupera esta  inversión con la primera cuota, pero regularmente las  divide en 4   plazos de pago de acuerdo a cada cliente y también hace algunas excepciones con un pequeño número de sus compradores ofreciéndoles plazos especiales un poco más largos,  pero no muy usuales.  Relacionado con la mercancía que distribuye su margen de contribución  es de 45% y los planea con sus clientes en 2 cuotas. Su sueño ahora es tener un punto de ventas en un sitio estratégico, pero sabe que se requiere un capital inicial importante y por eso está trabajando fuertemente para lograrlo. Con su Credikiva que es su primer financiamiento comprará productos naturales que tiene encargados por sus clientes y también jeans, calzado, ropa interior y especialmente vestidos para niños, teniendo en cuenta que en las fiestas los padres de familia vestirán a sus pequeños con nueva ropa y estos a su vez lucirán los vestidos de Ruth María con mucha alegría y distinción.
texts.en:
Ruth María N. lives in Soledad’s Los Almendros neighborhood where she sells natural products and assorted merchandise.  It is quite usual to find vitamins and Omega 3 among other products like costume jewelry, and cosmetics in her store.  She also sells footwear, underwear and children’s clothes.

She started the business around 2004 encouraged by her spouse to do so.  He is a lithographer and while doing jobs for laboratories he got to know the people who today are Ruth Maria’s suppliers and from whom he originally bought $200,000COP worth of natural products like the ones already mentioned.

Gradually Ruth has been adding other items like: clothes, jewelry, cosmetics and almost everything else customers need in their daily lives because she’s known how to take advantage of the vast clientele that her initial natural products business generated. Her main customers are residents of the neighborhood and referrals from them who live in other areas.

Ruth María is quite a good businesswoman who floats her customers just the amount of credit they are able to repay in the time agreed upon.  Thus she recovers her outstanding debts weekly and some biweekly. She, however, pays cash so often gets discounts because her suppliers know her well and she is very good at negotiating her purchases.

Her recovery margin on the natural products is 40% and she usually gets that back on the first installment.  However, she splits up the amount into four installments according to the customer and sometimes makes exceptions for some customers giving them still longer repayment schedules; but this isn’t too common.  The other merchandise has a 45% margin and that she recovers in two installments.

Her dream now is to have a point of sale in some strategic location but she knows she needs an important injection of capital to do so.  This is why she’s working so hard to accomplish this.

With the Kiva loan, which is her first loan, she will buy natural products that she has pending orders for as well as jeans, footwear, underwear and especially children’s clothes keeping in mind that during the festive season that’s approaching parents will dress up their children in new outfits and the children will sport Ruth Maria’s outfits with much cheer and distinction.

loans.use: She will buy natural products her customers have ordered and also will buy jeans, shoes, underwear and especially children’s clothes.

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr.Edmundo; el tiene 47 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de papas el cual trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja siendo esta la que administra el negocio, a la vez el socio administra el servicio público de baño del mercado Virgen Asunta en el mismo que se encuentra su otro negocio el socio está muy contento ya que con el préstamo el podrá implementar mas su negocio.

El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar más productos para su negocio de venta de papas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Virgen Natividad communal bank that is located in the Urubamba district that is part of the Urubamba province in Cusco department.
He is Edmundo, 47, in a common-law marriage and he has 5 children.  The member alternates his daily activities by selling potatoes with his partner.  She manages this business and he  takes care of the public bathrooms in the Virgen Asunta market.  Their business is also located in this market.  He is very happy with the loan because this will allow him to improve the business.

The member is requesting a loan to buy more products for his potato sales business.

He is very content with the loan and promises to make all of the payments on time.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to buy more products for his potato sales business.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolás vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en el distrito de San Sebastián. El distrito de San Sebastián se encuentra ubicada en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, localizándose a 10 km. de la plaza de armas de la capital arqueológica de América del Sur. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco está construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca.
Nicolás se dedica a brindar servicios de transportes en su propio taxi y trabaja en el cercado del Cusco. Hace varios años que se dedica a brindar servicios y le va regular. Nicolás y su esposa tienen un pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas de forma ambulatorio, ellos llevan sus productos en una carreta y se instalan en la calle y venden a todos los transeúntes que pasan por esa calle. Con su próximo préstamo, Nicolás que espera recibir S/. 2300 nuevos soles. Por el momento desea incrementar el capital del negocio y va comprar mercadería como por ejemplo, dulces, galletas, gaseosas, tortas y muchos productos más. Nicolás pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el segundo año de funcionamiento y les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Nicolás lives with his wife and three children in the District of San Sebastián, which is part of the Province and Department of Cusco and located 10km from the town square. It is also the archaeological capital of South America. Cusco is an enchanting city that dates back to the time of the Incas. The city of Cusco is built at the base of an ancient Incan village.

Nicolás provides transportation services with his own taxi and works along the outskirts of Cusco. He has been providing transportation services for many years and works on a regular basis. Nicolás and his wife also have a small business selling sweets as street vendors. They haul their products in a cart, park it on the street, and sell to everyone who passes through their location. With this next loan Nicolás will receive 2300 PEN. At the moment, he wants to increase his business capital and purchase merchandise such as candy, cookies, sodas, cakes, and other products. Nicolás belongs to the “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) Communal Bank that is part of Asociación Arariwa. The Communal Bank is in its second year of operation and is doing very well.

loans.use: Purchase candy, cookies, sodas, cakes, and other products to sell

loans.name: Pasos Firme 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Ruth is one of the members of Pasos Firme 1 2 & 3 (Firm Steps) groups. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their 3 children.

Ruth is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for around 3 years, starting with a capital her partner in love gave her to make a  business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing underwear for men and women. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to add more products to his business.

Ruth's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally, her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area,.  This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

Notes: The two women in the small photo at the bottom are part of the group, they are completing the fifteen members. At the moment of the group photo, they were organizing the repayments schedule.

loans.use: to buy underwear

loans.name: Marry

texts.en:
Marry A. is from the village of Bacnor East. She is 41 years old. Marry is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marry owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Marry has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marry joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marry has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Marry is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Marry from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Goharik

texts.en:
Goharik V. lives in Vanadzor city with her family. Her daughter and husband help Goharik in her business, which consists of souvenir and glassware trading. Goharik has been engaged in this business for 21 years. She uses the income for her family. Goharik purchases an assortment of products from Yerevan once or twice a month, and from Georgia once a month.
This is Goharik’s 13th loan from Kiva partner, Nor Horizon, and her second loan via Kiva. Goharik used her first Kiva loan to buy a large lot of glassware and souvenirs, which she sold very profitably. Now she is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to increase her shop’s assortment by purchasing flower bowls, fruit bowls, etc.

loans.use: To purchase flower bowls, fruit bowls, etc.

loans.name: Elnura's Group

texts.en:
Elnura B., 25, is the leader of this group.  Elnura is a young mother of two children ages 2 and 6 months. She and her husband have started cattle breeding and reselling 6 years ago.  A monthly salary from her husband was used to purchase a bull. Her husband’s family helps to takre care of cattle and resell it in a local farmyard, because Elnura stays busy with her kids. Her husband is a police officer and very committed to his work, and devotes all of his free time to looking after cattle. Elnura’s customer base is constantly increasing since she has a good reputation due to dedication and product quality.  She plans to use this loan to continue to meet customer demand and buy two more good healthy bulls. Elnura and her group thank the lenders for understanding her situation. She hopes to build a good working capital and become the most successful supplier of cattle in the region. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Erwin Daniel

texts.es:
Erwin de 33 años, es un hombre trabajar que tiene un negocio de confección y elaboración de sandalias. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 15h00pm elaborando y reparando sandalias en su taller. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso el comienza a trabajar desde muy temprano haciendo sandalias. Vende las sandalias según sea su elaboración hasta $ 14. Quiere en un futuro tener un taller grande pero para eso primero quiere comprar con el préstamo suelas y materiales.
texts.en:
33-year old Erwin is a hardworking man who runs a sandal-making business. He works from 8am to 3pm making and repairing sandals in his workshop. As he is ambitious, he starts work early in the day. Depending on their style, he sells the sandals for around $14. 

In the future Erwin wants to have a large workshop, but at the moment his goal is to use the loan to buy soles and other materials.

loans.use: to buy soles etc. for his sandal-making business

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos D. C.:de 37 años trabaja en la albañileria, y aparte de eso tiene otra ocupacion y es el cultivo de cafe y mais el contrata personal para que le eyuden a cultivar su tierra,tambien para que lo riegue y le eche abono,el solicita este credito para la compra de plantas de cafe y compra de abono organico. como toda persona tiene su sueño el de el es sembrar la mayor parte de cafe y poder exportarlo al extrangero y asi aumentar su ganancia y asi tener mas oportunidades de superarse, cada dia mas.
texts.en: Juan Carlos D. C. is 37 years old. He works as a mason, and apart from this he also has another occupation: growing coffee and corn. He hires workers who help him farm his lands, and also to water them and add fertilizer. He is requesting this loan to buy coffee plants and also to buy organic fertilizer. Like every person, he has his dream, and his is to plant his lands mostly with coffee and be able to export it abroad, so he can increase his earnings and thus have more opportunities to get ahead in life, day by day.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora V. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years of age and married to Job V., a dressmaker. They were blessed with four children. Leonora is presently engaged in buying and selling firewood. She have been engaged in this business for three years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Leonora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be purchase more firewoods to sell. This will be her 4rth  loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, and as savings for future use, especially for future business expansion.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha L. (pictured with her loom) has been married for just three months and has no children yet. She is a silk weaver, while her husband is a construction worker. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

The family does not have any means of transportation. They spend a lot of money on traveling costs very often, so Sokha is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Yulisa Del Carmen

texts.es: Yulisa Del Carmen se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos y hielo. Tiene más de  9 años en su negocio, es una persona muy trabajadora. Inicio este medio de vida con la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo no ha sido fácil ya que estar pendiente de sus hijos y de su trabajo. El crédito es para la compra de leche, cremas, queso y cuajada, también bolsas para sus hielos. Sueña con ampliar su negocio, proporcionar más ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en: Yulisa Del Carmen sells milk products and ice.  She has had her business for more than 9 years.  She is a very hard-working person.  She started doing this for a living because she needed to defray household costs.  She has 3 children in her charge, and it has not been easy, since she has to keep an eye on both her children and her work.  The loan is for the purchase of milk, cream, cheese, and cuajada (cheese curd), as well as bags for her ice.  She dreams of expanding her business and bringing in more earnings for her household.

loans.use: to purchase milk, cream, cheese, and cuajada (cheese curd), as well as bags for her ice

loans.name: Santo Jeovanny

texts.es:
Santo de 37 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Es soltera tienen 5 hijos cada uno están en colegios fiscales. Su actividad comercial es la venta y elaboración de chifle.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás era empleado de una empresa hasta que un  día se independizo y realizo su propio negocio. Labora diariamente cortando y preparando los chifles. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere incrementar su capital comprando verde y mas para mercadería para su preparación.
texts.en:
Santo is 37 years old and lives in Primavera de Duran (an urban area that was originally irregular with various hills, brooks and ponds that are still present but it’s a disappearing ecosystem). He is single and has 5 children in primary school. He sells and makes chifle (fried plantain chips).

Santo used to work in a company until he decided to venture out on his own and started his own business. He works daily cutting and preparing chifles. With the loan, Santo wants to increase his capital by buying more plantains and foodstuffs for the chifle’s preparation.

loans.use: buy plantains.

loans.name: Ernesta

texts.en:
Ernesta is a farmer working in the Philippines in the far place of Mocag Baggao, Cagayan. She is asking for a loan amount of PHP10,000 to buy fertilizers and a seed variety of corn. She has been doing the business for 7 years with her husband Jaime.

She is now 39 years old, a mother to four school-aged children. Through their average net profit from farming of around PHP30,000, Ernesta is able to send her children in school continuously. In the future, she hopes for her children's success for she knows their success someday is also hers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and a seed variety of corn.

loans.name: Haja

texts.en:
Haja is 45 years old and lives in the West Point area.  She’s married and her husband is an office worker.  They have 3 children between 12 and 18 years old, all of whom live at home and attend school.  Haja sells a range of goods, including lappa (traditional clothing), cold water and soft drinks.  Her mother gave her the money with which to start the business.

Her main challenge is the high level of competition. What she likes about this business is that it gives her the ability to support her children.  Haja has requested this loan to purchase more lappa. She wants to be a worthy woman and give her children a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa (traditional Cloth)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA GENERACION III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de tejidos, ella tiene maquinas de tejer, ella teje chompas y pantalones de lana para niños y bebes y después lo distribuye a las diferentes tiendas donde vende ropa para bebes y niños, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de tejidos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como lana, hilos, cierres y botones para tejer las chompas y pantalones y también para el mantenimiento de las maquinas.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Nueva Generación III” (New Generation III) communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.

She is 30 years old and has a spouse and two children.  She alternates her daily chores with selling knitwear.  She has knitting machines and she knits sweaters and wool pants for children and infants that she then sells to various stores that sell clothes for infants and children.  She is able to support her children thanks to this business.  She wants to expand and improve the knitwear sales and is asking for the loan to buy materials like wool, thread, zippers and buttons to knit sweaters and pants and also to service her machines.

She is happy with the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy supplies like wool, thread, zippers and buttons to knit sweaters and pants and also to service her machines.

loans.name: Deverly

texts.en:
At 23, Deverly is very determined to be successful. She is single and is engaged in a retail business which is situated in front of her house. She offers shampoo, soap, bread and snacks in the community.

Deverly is requesting a loan of Php15,000 to purchase one box of milk, a box of detergent soap and some boxes of snack food. Deverly plans to save money for her future and also to support her mother and father in their daily needs.

In the future, Deverly hopes to expand her business by offering more products.

loans.use: to purchase one box of milk, a box of detergent soap and some boxes of snack food

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Vamos Juntas” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco.  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las nuevas siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

En el lugar conocimos al señor Mario que nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú), tiene 66 años de edad, está casado y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos, y nos cuenta:

“Actualmente, Yo vivo en la ciudad del Cusco y donde realizo mis actividades, Yo soy jubilado pero trabajo de cocinero en el centro comercial “La Canasta” en la ciudad del Cusco los días sábados y domingos. También me dedica a la venta de ropa y compro mi mercadería en la ciudad de Juliaca. Este crédito es para comprar más mercedaria como por ejemplo vestidos. Y mi sueño es abrir un restaurante turístico en el centro de la ciudad del Cusco”.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Vamos Juntas” (We Go Together) meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco, which is known in the region for being a tourist and commercial area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

It is here that the staff of Asociación Arariwa met with Sr. Mario, who was born in the city of Cusco in Peru. He is 66 years old, married, and has three children. Mario said the following:

“At the moment, I live in the city of Cusco and this is where I conduct my activities. I am retired but work as a cook at the La Canasta shopping center in the city of Cusco on Saturdays and Sundays. I also sell clothing and buy my merchandise in the city of Juliaca. This loan will be used to buy merchandise, such as dresses. My dream is to open a tourist restaurant in central Cusco.”

loans.use: to buy dresses.

loans.name: Nayantai

texts.en:
Nayantai is 55 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt or tent) in Hovd province of Mongolia. His three children attend the local high school. His wife works as a waitress at the Sports Center.

He worked as a carpenter at the wood factory from 1977 to 1995. In 1995 he started to make wooden frames for Mongolian yurts privately. He produces Mongolian yurt's walls, roof poles, and doors. He is very experienced in his field. He is planning to make more wooden yurt frames as the demand for new yurts will increase because of the marriage and festival season in September. He is a diligent man who says, "My oldest son just got married and I want to make wooden yurt frames for my son."

He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood to make doors, cabers (poles) and walls.

loans.use: to purchase more wood

loans.name: Digna Patricia

texts.es:
Digna Patricia tiene 21 años de edad es casada vive con el esposo y con los dos hijos de 5, 8 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la VCR Caminando Hacia el Futuro, Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Jesús de gran Poder, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Digna se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra sus productos en el Comercial Marlín y las ventas en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, líquidos, urea y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es poder tener su propio terreno para poder trabajar mejor.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear y dedicar más tiempo al trabajo.
texts.en:
Digna Patricia, 21, is married and lives with her husband and two children, ages 5 and 8, in Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The members of Caminando Hacia el Futuro Communal Bank, located in the Jesús de Gran Poder area of Ventanas Canton, work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Digna works in agriculture, growing corn and rice.  She buys her products in Marlín Store and in the stalls there and in Ventanas.

She is requesting the loan to buy seed, supplies, liquid fertilizer, urea, and fertilizer for the crops.  The support of the loan would help her economically to supplement her needs, to confront challenges like disease and illness.  Her dream is to be able to have her own piece of land to be able to work better.

In her spare time, Digna likes to go for walks and spend more time working.

loans.use: to buy seed, supplies, liquid fertilizer, urea, and fertilizer for the crops.

loans.name: Rouba

texts.fr: Madame Rouba  est une femme mariée de 61 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle gère  7 enfants et évolue depuis plus de 10 ans dans le commerce de denrées alimentaires. Elle a choisi cette activité dans le souci de ne pas rester inactive. Et c’est une activité qui marche bien pour elle au moment des fêtes. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de denrées alimentaires a revendre destinés a relancer et élargir son activité de commerce. Ce financement lui permettra d’avoir une autonomie financière afin de mieux gérer les dépenses familiales.
texts.en: Madam Rouba is a 61 years-old woman who lives in Senegal. She takes care of 7 children and works for more than 10 years in the foodstuffs business. She chose this activity in order to not stay inactive. Her business is working pretty well and espacially during Holidays. She is a member of U-IMEC since April. Madam Rouba is applying to a 100 000 frs loan to purchase foodstuffs to resell in order to boost and expand her business. This loan will allow her to be financially independent and to better run the family spending.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and resell

loans.name: Sisi

texts.en:
Sisi  is a married woman with one child who is not yet schooling. She has a business selling charcoal in Hai Gwafa in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Sisi requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase or order more charcoal for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan  for building a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Channy, 49 years old, is a grocery seller who earns $5 per day. Her husband is selling food earning $3 per day. They live with only one child, he is 18 years old. He helps her to sell the groceries at home. Each month, she has to spend $83 on food, $5 on electricity, and $5 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy more groceries to sell in her shop. She started this career about 7 years ago and she is able make some income to support the family, so she wants to extend her shop when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 25 años, convive con Dagoberto de 24 años, que fruto de esta relación tienen un hijo. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en la urbanización Sivia. Adela, consecuente y luchadora con sus objetivos, cuenta que años atrás la situación económica de esta parte del país estuvo estancado por la inestabilidad social y económica. Por tal razón no logró concluir sus estudios al quedarse huérfana de Papá y Mamá; y con 5 hermanos pequeños que tuvo que cuidar. La chacra que tenían no era suficiente para mantenerse ya que los frutos, no tenían mucha rentabilidad, es por ello que decidió trabajar como empleada del hogar, donde conoció a Dagoberto que ahora es su querido esposo. Tiempos después Adela con el poco ahorro que tenía más el de su esposo decidieron abrir un bar, donde ahora expenden licores, y toda clase de bebidas. Para ella los mejores días de venta son los fines de semana y feriados, dicho bar cuenta con un amplio lugar de esparcimiento. Esta feliz con este negocio ya que le genera un buen ingreso económico. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el que ella esta comprometida en cancelar puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas. Además está contenta con los de su banco comunal, porque son puntuales con el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 soles que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más licores para abastecer su bar.
texts.en:
Adela, 25, lives with Dagoberto, 24, and their son. They live in their own house located in the Silvia neighbourhood. 

Adela, who is consistent and fights for her goals, explains that a few years ago the financial situation in this part of the country suffered from stagnation due to social and economic instability. Because of this and the death of her mother and father she was unable to finish her schooling; she had 5 younger siblings to look after. The farm they had was not enough to support them as it wasn't very profitable. That's why she decided to work as maid, where she met Dagoberto, her beloved husband. 

Some time later, Adela and her husband used their small savings to open a bar, where they sell liquor and all kinds of drinks. For her the best days for the business are week-ends and holidays. The bar has plenty of room for recreation. She is happy with the business as it generates a good income. 

This is her first loan with MFP. She is committed to repaying it on time. She is also very pleased with her community bank, because everyone repays the loans on time. She will invest the 1,500 soles requested in the purchase of liquor to stock up her bar.

loans.use: to buy liquor for her bar.

loans.name: Aïda Thiam Fonk Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Fonk Liggey du banc villageois de Yaral  est créé le 05/10/11. Il est constitué de 15 femmes. Le commerce est leur principale activité. Il existe une parfaite solidarité entre les membres.

La présidente du groupe,Palla, âgée de 30 ans, est veuve et mère de 03 enfants. Elle fait du commerce et vend des denrées de première nécessite (riz, niébé, arachide, maïs, etc. Elle se ravitaille au marché de de sa localité ou dans les villes les plus proches dés fois. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans et a une bonne expérience. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en bleu-saumon et a levé la main gauche.

Avec son prêt elle voudrait acheter du niébé, du riz, de l'arachide, du maïs etc. 

Avec ses bénéfices elle voudrait acheter un terrain pour ses enfants et les soutenir dans leurs études.
texts.en:
Group Fonk Liggey, which depends from the Yaral "banc villageois" (village lending group), was created on 10/05/11. It is constituted of 15 women. Their main activity is retail. The members are in perfect solidarity with one another.

The group’s president, Palla, is 30 years old. She is a widow and a mother of three. Trade is her business, and she retails first-necessity goods (rice, cowpeas, peanuts, corn, etc). She gets her supplies from the market in Gouye Mbeut or sometimes from closer cities. She has been in this business for over ten years and is quite experimented. On the photo, she is standing on the right and is dressed in blue and salmon. She is raising her left hand. With her loan she would like to buy cowpeas, rice, peanuts, corn, etc.

With her loan, she would like to purchase black-eyed peas. With the profit, she would like to buy a parcel for her children and to help them attend school.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Mody

texts.fr:
Mody est un homme habite dans la région sud du sénégal agé de 57 ans , marié ,il a 3 enfants qui vont tous à l'école.Le premier fait la terminale le deuxième fait la 3em et le troisième est l'école primaire.
Mody travail dans le commerce de bétail depuis 1996 jusqu'à nos jours(15 ans).Avec son commerce ,il assure les dépenses de sa famille et la scolarisation des enfants.
Mody avec ce crédit augmente le nombre de bétails et dans l'avenir développer son activité pour pouvoir demain avoir sa propre maison et s'occuper de sa famille
texts.en:
Mody lives in the south of Senegal and is 57 years old. He is married and has three children who all attend school. The oldest is in the last year of secondary school, the second is in the last year of middle school,  and the third is in primary school. 

Mody has been working selling animals from 1996 until now (that is, for 15 years). With his business, he covers the family expenses and school fees of his children. 

With this loan, Mody wants to expand his flock and in future, develop his business so that later he can have his own house and live there with his family.

loans.use: to buy sheep to expand his flock.

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en: Duyen is 28 years old. She lives in Trung Ban village in the Yen Phong district of Bac Ninh. She was married and has three children who are still young. To earn a living, she not only grows rice but also makes tofu to sell. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has a monthly income of about VND 6,000,000. Duyen has participated in SEDA since 2007. The last time she borrowed VND 7,392,000 and repaid it punctually. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow VND 9,632,000 to buy beans for making tofu.

loans.use: to buy beans for making tofu to sell

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en:
Anastasie is 26 years old and is single. He is a carpenter and sells products such as tables, chairs, windows, and doors. His business is well organized. He works from 7 am until 5 pm every day and has five years of experience in this business. Anastasie employs five people to help him.

Anastasie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more wood to build more tables, chairs, windows, doors, and so on. With the profits from this loan, Anastasie will buy his own house and save for his future.

loans.use: to purchase more wood for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Dos Group

texts.es:
La señora Eusebia es casada, tiene 47 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 9 hijos 4 de los cuales estudian, se dedica a la crianza de animales, cerdos y pollo de engorde, inició este negocio con un pequeño capital y tiene 7 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de de pollos de engorde y la alimentación de estos, espera en el futuro contar con un capital mucho mas amplio. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales domésticos.
texts.en:
Eusebia is married.  She is 47 years old and completed 6 years of her primary education.  She has 9 children, 4 of whom are in school.  Her business is raising animals (pigs and chickens).  She started this business with a little capital and has 7 years experience.  She has the support of her husband who is a farmer.

Eusebia got together a group to request a loan for buying chickens to fatten and feed for these animals.  She hopes, in the future, to have more capital.  The other members of her group farm and raise animals.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten, and chicken feed

loans.name: Tofi

texts.en:
Tofi is married, 21 years of age and has one child.

Tofi owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has one year of experience in this business. Tofi needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase push knives, a wheelbarrow and pesticides. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be WST 300 or USD $125 per week) to improve or expand the business.

Tofi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Tofi's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase push knives, wheelbarrow and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and oil.

loans.name: Crisantemo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Crisantemo lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Oscar Enrique de 42 años quien se dedica al comercio de flores naturales en uno de los mercados más grande de Managua. Este negocio lo viene realizando desde hace 20 años junto a su esposa.
El tiene tres hijos de 20, 19 y 4 años de los cuales solo la menor está a su cargo.
Los otros integrantes son Marbelly de 29 años quien vende cosméticos desde hace 6 años y Leopoldo desde hace 15 años vende granos básicos.
texts.en:
The Crisantemo Group is made up of three hard-working, entrepreneurial people. Oscar Enrique is 42 years old and a member of this group; he runs a flower selling business in one of Managua's largest markets. He and his wife have been running this business together for 20 years.
Oscar has three children aged 20, 19 and 4 years; he now only has to provide for his youngest child.
The other members of this group are 29 year old Marbelly, who has been selling cosmetics for 6 years, and Leopoldo has been selling grains and pulses for 15 years.

loans.use: to buy flowers

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like rice retailing.

Nida dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée résidant à Adidogomé. Agée de 56 ans, Afi vit avec quatre enfants à charge. Afi est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile. Pour financer son achat, Afi nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en vue de mieux revendre et de réaliser plus de bénéfice afin de soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à leurs enfants.

loans.use: Acheter 14 sacs de charbon de bois.

loans.name: Dotsè

texts.en:
Mr. Dotsè H. is a married father of five (5) children. His primary business activity is shoe manufacturing and repair. His wife, reduced to being a simple housewife, has no ability to contribute to the household. Mr. H. is solely responsible for providing for the needs of the family. As generous as he is charitable, he provides free training to a group of very poor young men in his shop and provides benefits for his apprentices such as healthcare and lunch. His shop is very well frequented due to the quality of his work, but he is in dire need of materials to better meet the demands of his clients.

Mr. Dotsè H. is asking for a loan of $850 to purchase a machine and acquire shoe manufacturing materials in order to increase his clientele and improve his services. Realizing this ambition will benefit him greatly, particularly with regard to increasing his income.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur H. Dotsè est marié et père de cinq (5) enfants. Il a pour activité principale la fabrication et la réparation des chaussures. Sa femme, réduite à une simple ménagère n’a aucune capacité de contribuer aux charges du ménage. Monsieur H. se bat seul pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Aussi généreux que charitable, il forme gratuitement dans son atelier certains garçons très nécessiteux et subvient à certains besoins de ses apprentis comme la santé et le déjeuner. Son atelier est très bien fréquenté à cause de la qualité de son travail mais il manque cruellement de matériels pour mieux répondre aux exigences de ses clients.

Monsieur H. Dotsè sollicite ce crédit de $850 pour s’acheter une machine et s’approvisionner en matériels de fabrication de chaussures pour élargir la liste de sa clientèle et améliorer sa prestation de service. La réalisation de cette ambition lui sera très bénéfique notamment en matière d’augmentation de son revenu.

loans.use: Purchase a machine and acquire materials for manufacturing shoes

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos started selling tacos in his own home six years ago. Little by little, clients and demand for his product increased. A little while ago, he took his earnings and bought a trailer that allowed him to set up his business along the main streets of the city, creating a larger market for his tacos and the possibility to increase sales. But he spent all he had and now needs a loan of $925 that will allow him to buy ingredients to make his tacos.

Carlos is a hard worker and he promises to repay the loan within six months to a year. His daughter works alongside him at the taco stand, and with the two of them working together they are confident the business will grow. You have the opportunity to help them, and your support will be very useful. They are sincerely grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Translator

El señor Carlos, inició con la venta de tacos hace seis años, en su propio domicilio, poco a poco fueron incrementándose los clientes y la demanda por sus productos. Hace poco utilizó las ganancias que tenía para comparar un remolque que le permite ubicarse en una de las principales avenidas para cubrir un mercado más amplio, e incrementar sus ventas. Pero gastó todo lo que tenia y ahora necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 925 dólares que utilizará para la compra de insumos que requiere para la elaboración de los tacos.

Carlos es un hombre muy trabajador y se compromete a regresar el préstamo en un plazo de 6 a 12 meses, su hija colabora con él en la taquería y con el trabajo de los dos confían en que su negocio podrá crecer. Tú tienes la posibilidad de ayudarlos, tu apoyo será de gran utilidad para ellos y te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Buy taco ingredients

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
My name is Blanca D. and I am dedicated to the sales of home decorations such as vases, flowers, tablecloths, and kitchen towels. I have been involved with this business for the past 4 years and I have many clients that are very pleased with my products as well as the prices which are accessible for our community. My goal is to increase my inventory for greater earnings so I will be able to better feed my family and cover expenses in our home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es Blanca D. me dedico a la venta de adornos para el hogar como ser jarrones, flores, manteles, toallas para cocina, actividad que me dedico hace 4 años, tengo muchos clientes ya que les gusta mucho mi producto y tambien el precio que es accesible para nuestra comunidad, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mayores ganancias y asi poder alimentar mi familia y cubrir con los gastos de mi hogar

loans.use: purchase of decorations for the home

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs. Keo Sean is a 54-year-old widow and lives with her single child in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To supplement her family’s income, Keo Sean is not only employed as a primary school teacher, but she also runs a small tailoring business at home --together, she can typically earn around $2 each day.

In addition, her son works helping his household as a motor-taxi driver. This loan will be used by Keo Sean to purchase a motorcycle for her son and the leftover of the money is to buy thread and some tailoring tools.

loans.use: Needs a motorcycle and some tailoring tools for her business.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Since she and her husband split 3 years ago, Dominga, 47, has had to work hard so as to survive and feed her 3 children. She earns a living selling clothes for children, curtains, bed sheets and shoes for men. She walks around the streets and goes door-to-door to sell her products, since her house is too narrow and not handy for her customers.

As the holiday season is coming, Dominga needs a loan to purchase a large amount of the products she’s selling, especially clothes for children. Indeed, this period is usually the high season for selling clothes.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of clothes, curtains and shoes to sell during the holiday season

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina is a 52 year-old widow with 4 married children. Catalina works hard to rent out tables, chairs, tablecloths and other party related products. She opened this business together with her sister but after 6 years, her sister left the country and left her to run the business.

Catalina underwent difficulties to operate the business alone, which was worse after her husband's death. Her late husband supported her emotionally and financially. His job at the factory helped to cover their living costs.

In spite of these vicissitudes, Catalina persevered and today, her business is running more smoothly. She wants to buy more merchandise. She seeks a loan that will allow her to invest in plastic chairs so she can increase the variety of products to offer in her renting business.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Catalina tiene 52 años, ella es viuda y tiene 4 hijos, todos ya casados. Catalina se dedica al alquiler de mesas, sillas, manteles y otros afines para fiestas. El negocio lo abrió junto con su hermana, pero hace 6 años, su hermana viajo a otro país y quedo ella sola frente al negocio.

Le costo mucho a Catalina salir adelante sola, más aún luego de la muerte de su marido, ya que el era su gran apoyo emocional además de económico, pues el trabajaba en una fábrica y ayudaba con los ingresos y gastos de la casa.

A pesar de las vicisitudes, Catalina persevero y hoy día el negocio marcha bastante bien. Ella desea adquirir hoy un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de sillas de plástico de esta forma poder aumentar la variedad de su stock de alquiler.

loans.use: to buy plastic chairs

loans.name: Nuri

texts.en: Nuri is one of the active clients of Microinvest. Her first loan from our organization was in 2003, which was spent on an expansion of her assortment.
