She has been in trade for over 10 years, and of course she has a great number of constant clients. Her goods are less expensive than those in commercial shops and she purchases the goods herself. She brings her goods from the Istaravshan wholesale market, district of Khujand, Tadjikistan. Her daughter is her business partner, and she stays in business since her mother has left on a trip. Nuri has one problem: her roof is leaky  in her home, and she wants to increase the volume of her goods and get maximum profit so she can spend part of her income on reconstruction of her roof for family.

loans.use: Increasing the volume of goods.

loans.name: Kigandazi A Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for six months. Irene runs a small restaurant. Jane sells used clothes wants to increase the stock with the loan. Annet has a canteen business. Prossy sells fish while Rose has a public pay phone.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To re-invest in their current businesses

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en: Ramiz M. is an independent plaster worker in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He is 30 years old and has been working in this business for the last 5 years. The town of Khachmaz has been growing at an exceptional rate the last few years, resulting in a great demand for Ramiz’s services to increase. He is currently looking for funding, so he can purchase new tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase new tools for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies for his corn crop, cattle and feed. Also to rent machinery, contract labor and have the cattle  vaccinated and disinfected.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
The transportation business requires much investment being that the cost of fuel increases each time and the cost of spare parts has elevated to great magnitudes. In the city of Somotillo, Miguel Angel R. has been in the transportation industry with his own taxicab, which he works daily in an effort to bring home the daily bread to be ingested by his wife and three children.

The problem Mr. R. is facing is that he needs to buy spare parts for his vehicle because it is in bad condition and needs to be taken to the shop for repairs. For this, he has turned to Ceprodel for support with the goal of obtaining a loan to purchase the parts and continue with his transportation business in the municipality of Somotillo, from which he is a native.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de transporte es una labor que requiere de mucho inversión por la razón de que hoy en día el costo del combustible se eleva cada vez más y además los repuestos de los vehículos se elevan a grandes magnitudes. En la ciudad de Somotillo el caballero Miguel Angel R. se dedica desde hace cuatro años al negocio de transporte teniendo su propio taxi el cual lo trabaja todos los días procurando llevar el pan a la mesa para que lo puedan ingerir sus tres hijos y esposa.

La problemática atravesada por el señor R. es la necesidad de la compra de repuestos para el vehiculo debido a que está en malas condiciones y necesita adquirir estos repuestos para llevar el auto al taller y que sea reparado. Para esto ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel con el fin de que le proporcionen créditos para adquirir estos repuestos y así continuar con su labor de transporte en el municipio de Somotillo de donde es originario.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts to repair his taxicab.

loans.name: Nolvia Cecilia

texts.es:
Nolvia is 37 years old, is married and has one son aged 17 years. She lives in the region of Waspan Norte in the city of Managua. Her husband works as an officer in a company and he covers the household expenses. Nolvia is a designer and the loan she is requesting is to install ceramic tiling in her home as a remodelling project to improve their way of life. The family's plans are to continue improving and remodelling their home to obtain a dignified place to live and help with the professional education for their son.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Nolvia tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de 17 años de edad. Habita en el barrio Waspan Norte, de la ciudad de Managua. Su esposo trabaja como fiscal en una empresa y aporta a los gastos del hogar, Nolvia es diseñadora y el préstamo lo quiere para poner cerámica y mejorar su vivienda y tener un mejor nivel de vida. Los planes de la familia es seguir haciendo mejoras a su vivienda para lograr obtener un hogar digno y ayudar en la educación de su hijo para formarlos como profesionales.

loans.use: To install ceramic tiles in her home.

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Bui Thi T. is one of the first members of the TYM Fund when it first came to her area. She has 3 children, one of which is still going to school and the other two are grown-up and working. She and her husband have been doing carpentry for 8 years, selling tables, chairs, beds, closets and staircases. Having clever hands and being experienced, she has more and more customers and her designs satisfy many peoples’ needs. This time, she wants to borrow 425 USD to buy more wood and expand her business. Her average income is approximately 325 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Là một trong số những thành viên tham gia vào Quỹ đầu tiên của cụm. Chị Bùi Thị Thêu 47 tuổi cùng chồng là anh Nguyễn Văn Đề, vợ chồng anh chị có 3 người con, 1 con đang còn đi học, 2 con đã lớn và có công ăn việc làm ổn định, gia đình anh chị đã có trên 8 năm làm nghề mộc, hiện tại anh gia đình anh chị chuyên làm bàn, ghế, giường, tủ và cầu thang với một số mặt hàng đó là rất phù hợp với nhu cầu hiện nay, là người thợ khéo tay cùng với kịnh nghiệm làm nghề mộc nên các mặt hàng của gia đình anh chị rất có chất lượng và mẫu mã cũng đa dạng, từ đó việc kinh doanh của gia đình anh chị là rất thuận lợi, để đáp ứng với nhu cầu thị trường gia đình anh chị có bàn bạc vòng vốn này xin vay 7.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào mua gỗ và mở rộng xưởng sản xuất. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: buy wood for carpentry

loans.name: Djantoyerela (La Prudence Group

texts.fr:
The members of the Djantoyerela group are married women who, on average, are 40 years old and have five children. They live in extended families with their husbands, their in-laws, their husbands’ other wives, and their children in the village of Djinina, in the Fana subprefecture (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali). The members of the Djantoyerela group sell grains, Shea almonds and candy. They came together because they are in the same line of business and all live in the same village. The Djantoyerela group is on its eighth group loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and all of its previous loans were repaid in full. They buy their products in neighboring villages (Marka Coungo, Tinkole and Santiguila), which allows them to keep a sufficient supply. These products are sold as is or are turned into flour to make “farou farou,” a local cake adored by children. For the part of their business that consists of processing Shea almonds, a portion of the loan will be used to pay other women for the almonds. They will sell their products in the villages named above. Each member of the group is involved in at least two different parts of the business and has a great ability to adapt to economic hardships. They hope to earn an average profit of 17,500 CFA francs per month.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Les membres du groupe Djantoyerela sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’age de 40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles élargies avec leurs maris, les beaux parents, les coépouses et les enfants dans le village de Djinina, sous préfecture de Fana (Région de Koulikoro République du Mali). Les membres du groupe Djantoyerela font le commerce de céréales et d’amendes de karité et la vente des friandises. Elles se sont connues parce qu’elles font les mêmes activités et vivent dans le même village. Le groupe Djantoyerela est à sont huitième prêt de groupe avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elles s’approvisionnent dans les villages voisins (Marka Coungo, Tinkole ou Santiguila) et constituent ainsi un stock suffisant. Ce stock est soit vendu en l’état ou transformé en poudre pour faire le fourou fourou (gâteau local) très prisé par les enfants. Pour l’activité de transformation des amendes de karité, une partie du prêt est utilisée pour payer les amendes auprès d’autres femmes. Les ventes sont effectuées dans les localités ci-dessus citées. Comme on le constate elles mènent chacune au minimum deux activités et disposent d’une grande capacité d’adaptation à la réalité économique. Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 17.500 FCFA par mois.

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Santos Rosendo

texts.es:
Santos works buying plastic tubes in order to cut them into small pieces and shape them in the forms of T, Y, L. These serve for sewer connections and the finished product is sold in large quantities in the stores of the El Rosario Santos area. He is single and lives in the area of Tembladerani (city of La Paz) in his parents’ house. His loan will be directed toward the purchase of a greater quantity of tubes, which will allow him to reduce costs. It is the second time that he has applied for a loan through Impro as well as Kiva. His credit history favors him very much as he is qualified as client 1, meaning that he makes all of his payments punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Santos se ocupa en comprar tubos plásticos para cortarlos en pequeños pedazos y moldearlos en forma de T, Y, L. Esto sirve para las conexiones de alcantarillado, el producto terminado se vende en grandes cantidades a las tiendas de la zona de El Rosario Santos es soltero y vive en la zona de Tembladerani (ciudad de La Paz), en la casa de sus padres. El crédito será destinado para comprar mayor cantidad de tubos, lo que le permitirá reducir sus costos. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito, tanto en Impro como en Kiva. Su historial le favorece bastante, esta calificado como cliente 1, lo que quiere decir que paga puntualmente todas sus cuotas.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Norma Maria

texts.es:
Norma inicio su negocio porque tenia muchos gastos ya que 2 de sus hijos estudian la secundaria y el mas pequeño de 7 años esta en la primaria, fue entonces que para ayudar a su esposo busco una actividad que le brindara ingresos y con ayuda de su cuñada quien la enseño hace 2 años a vender productos plásticos ella poco a poco esta logrando una estabilidad económica a través de sus ventas.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía ya que la falta de capital hace que se le caigan algunas ventas. Con tu ayuda Norma saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Norma began her business because she had a lot of expenses. Now her two older children are in middle school and the smallest, seven years old, is in elementary. To help her husband cover household expenses, Norma looked for a means of earning income. With the help of her sister-in-law, who taught her how to sell Tupperware two years ago, Norma is using her sales to slowly achieve economic stability. Norma is asking for a loan of US $250 to buy merchandise. She currently lacks the capital because her sales have fallen. She’ll repay the loan in three months. With your help Norma will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Зайналова Мохира проживает в районе Файзабад. Работает учителем в средней школе. Разведена и имеет одного ребенка. Живет с родителями , всю семью обеспечивает сама. Кроме работы в школе занимается животноводством. Возможность получить кредит , дает возможность купить еще одного бычка. Увеличив поголовье скота , ее хозяйство будет приносить больше дохода.Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mohira Z. lives in the Fayzabad region. She works as a teacher in a secondary school. She is divorced and has one child. She lives with her parents and supports the entire family herself. Besides working as a teacher she also does animal husbandry. The opportunity to receive a loan is an opportunity for her to buy another calf. By increasing the head count of her cattle her business will bring her more income. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys  vive junto a su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos de 3 años y 2 meses.
 
Ellos constituyen una pareja joven que,  gracias a su trabajo adquirieron un  lote de terreno en una de las zonas periféricas de la cuidad en donde realiza mejoras para poder vivir con un poco de comodidad.

 Se dedica a la confección de pequeñas alfombras, y su esposo se dedica a la elaboración de mochilas y trabaja como portero de medio turno en una institución, de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinará en la adquisición de materiales de construcción para ampliar las habitaciones de su domicilio.
 
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, y el segundo vía KIVA la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Gladys lives with her husband and two small children, who are three and two years old, respectively. Gladys and her husband are a young couple, who acquired some land thanks to their hard work. Their land is in one of the peripheral zones of the city where they are making improvements so as to live more comfortably. Gladys sews small rugs, and her husband makes backpacks and works as a doorman in the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to buy construction materials to expand the bedrooms in their home. This is Gladys' second loan with Impro, and the second through Kiva, whose evaluation qualified her for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials to expand two bedrooms in her house.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. is a 52-year-old married woman with seven children. Two of them are currently learning apprenticeship in the auto mechanic and glazing industries. Florence started her fish-selling business 25 years ago in Teshie, a suburb of Accra, where she lives. Specifically, Florence prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good fish meals. She has lots of customers who buy from her stand. 

With the loan, she wants to increase her working capital to enable her purchase fresh fish in bulk to serve her community. She expects to see her business grow and to be able to support her children’s education. she is a member of the loan group known as the "Abrabopa" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. She was in a meeting with her group members when her photograph was taken.

loans.use: To purchase assorted fresh fish.

loans.name: Gladis Adriana

texts.es:
Gladis P. F. forma parte del Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos de Tinco” de la provincia de Carhuaz.

Gladis tiene 31 años, y dos hijos con su conviviente, ella comenta que desde que falleció su mamá se ha sentido sola, siendo este hecho la mayor dificultad que ha tenido que enfrentar, Gladis afirma que ha crecido mucho en su negocio, considerando dicho crecimiento como su mayor logro. Ella comercializa animales mayores y menores, carne vacuna que lo vende en la feria de Carhuaz hace ya 04 años, comenta que empezó con s/300.00 comprando animales menores y vendiéndolos en la feria de Carhuaz como cuyes y gallinas y que en la actualidad tiene invertido en todo su negocio un aproximado de s/15 000.00 en animales vacunos, carneros, gallinas y cuyes que compra de las zonas rurales y los vende en carne o vivos, en la feria de Carhuaz, ella tiene que enfrentar los peligros que significa trasladar a los animales en camionetas, comenta que incluso una vez sufrió un accidente cuando se dirigía a su lugar de venta.
  
Con este préstamo de s/.3000.00, que pagará en ocho cuotas invertirá en la compra de ganado ovino.
 
Gladis comenta que el crecimiento que ha tenido es debido al esfuerzo individual y familiar.
texts.en:
Gladis P. F. is a member of the community bank “Manuela Ramos de Tinco” in the province of Carhuaz. Gladis is 31 years old and has 2 children with her partner. She says that since her mother's death she has felt alone. This has been the most difficult situation that she has ever faced. Gladis says that she has expanded her business a lot and that she considers this her greatest accomplishment. She sells both large and small animals. She has sold beef at the Carhuaz market for the past 4 years. She started with 300 soles, buying small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens and selling them at the Carhuaz market. She currently has a total of 15,000.00 soles invested in her business, in the form of cattle, sheep, chickens, and guinea pigs which she buys in rural areas and then sells live or butchered at the Carhuaz market. She bears the risks of transporting the animals in vans, saying that she once had an accident on her way to market. With this 3,000.00 soles loan which she will repay in 8 months, she will buy sheep. Gladis says that the growth of her business is due to her efforts and the support of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
El Emprendedor Concepción R. B. tiene la edad de 47 años, su estado civil es acompañado, Don Concepción tiene 2 hijos con las siguientes edades un varón de 10 años y cursa el 4 grado de primaria y su hijo mayor de 17 años que cursa el 4 año de secundaria, su compañera de vida no labora, los propósitos de Don Concepción son de mejorar cada día en la calidad de su negocio y proporcionarle al cliente la mejor atención para que quede satisfecho con el servicio sus deseos son que uno de sus hijos sea docente a como lo es Don Concepción para que esta tradición se mantenga en familia  por lo que Don Concepción tiene 2 trabajos imparte clases de primaria y el destace de cerdo que es una ayuda para sacar adelante a sus hijos sus sueños son seguir luchando en la vida para darle a su familia todo lo necesario para que no pasen por necesidades y también el contribuir a darle a sus hijos y a su esposa un lugar digno para vivir y así enseñarles a sus hijos a luchar por sus deseos y sueños propuestos.


La actividad económica a la que Don Concepción se dedica es el destace de cerdo, la ubicación de su negocio es en malpaisillo en el barrio larreynaga, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 15 años, Don Concepción inicio este negocio por necesidades de cubrir los gastos de su familia ya que el imparte clases de primaria y al ver que el salario no le ajustaba por lo que se ve obligado a trabajar en un oficio como es el destace de cerdo al comienzo le fue difícil porque no tenia la practica pero con la ayuda del tiempo fue que la adquirió y fue así como empezó y sus clientes le realizaban los pedidos de carne y así logro su fama con sus vecinos y sus amigos su esposa lo apoya y le ayuda en este oficio que le beneficia a toda la familia, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdo en pie ya que tiene que recorrer las diferentes comarcas en busca del mejor cerdo para sacar una buena producción de este.
texts.en:
Concepción R. B. is a 47-year-old entrepreneur who has a live-in partner and 2 children—a 10-year-old son who is in the fourth grade and a 17-year-old son who is a senior in high school. His live-in partner does not work. Mr. R.’ goals are to improve the quality of his business and provide better customer service so that the customer can be satisfied. He hopes that one of his sons will be a teacher like he is, so that the family tradition can stay alive. Mr. Concepción is both an elementary school teacher and a pork butcher, and these two jobs help him move his sons forward in life. He wants to keep struggling in life in order to give his family everything they need, and he wants to give them a decent dwelling, thus showing his children how to struggle to reach their dreams, wishes, and goals.

Mr. Concepción has a pork business located on Malpaisillo, in the Larreynaga neighborhood. He has been in business for 15 years, a business which he started out of the necessity to cover his family’s expenses because his teaching salary was insufficient. At first, being a pork butcher was difficult for him due to his lack of experience, but as time passed by, he started gaining more experience and consequently more customers. He gained popularity through his friends and neighbors, who started ordering pork. His wife supports him and helps him with the business, which benefits the whole family. The loan will be used as business capital to purchase pork because he has to frequent the different regions in search of the best pork.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Maria de los Ángeles inició el negocio desde joven, aprendió el oficio gracias a su abuela, y lo practicaba solamente con la familia y amigos cercanos, posteriormente una amiga que tenia un salón de belleza, la invito a ofrecer los masajes en su negocio. Comenzó el negocio en Julio del 2002 cuando su amiga le prestó el dinero para iniciar el negocio, el cual lo liquidó en un año, ya que al principio tenía poca clientela, principalmente eran sus familiares y no les cobraba como debía de ser.
Actualmente ya cuenta con dos mesas para aplicar los masajes, un pequeño stand donde tiene sus cremas, vendas, y demás utensilios que necesita, ya que ella misma elabora las cremas; además esta realizando una ampliación en su casa para tener independiente su negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir más materia prima para la producción de las cremas y aceites, ya que en estas fechas, (inicio de año), aumenta un poco la clientela, que regularmente es por recomendación, y poner un anuncio en la fachada de su negocio para mayor proyección.
texts.en:
Maria de los Ángeles started her work when she was young. She learned from her grandmother and she only worked for family and close friends. Later, a friend who owned a beauty salon invited her to offer massages from her business. She started her business in July 2002 when her friend lent her money to open her business, which she repaid in a year as at first she had few clients, most of her customers were friends and she was not charging them enough. Currently she has two massage tables and a small stand for her creams, cloth strips and other tools which she needs. She prepares the creams herself and is also enlarging her house to have a separate area for the business. She needs a MXN $4,000 loan which she will repay in six months in order to acquire the raw materials for preparing the creams and oils as these days, at the start of the year, she gets more customers. Most of her customers learn about her through word of mouth; she will use part of the loan to advertise in the storefront to attract more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for creams and oils

loans.name: Johneth

texts.en:
Johneth U. is a resident of Balite, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old and happily married to Allan U.; they were blessed with 6 children. Johneth's husband is a fisherman, and fishing is the major source of income in the family. Because of her desire to help, Johneth is the one who goes to the market and sells all the catch of fish of her husband.

Due to a strong demand for fish in the village, she joined HSPFI's micro-finance program and was able to receive her first loan. As time passed, their business has improved. And now dried squid is in demand not just in their village, but also in nearby villages of the province. Johneth now needs PHP 7,000 to buy boxes of dried squid and be the one in their place who stocks it.

loans.use: to purchase  boxes of dried squid for re-sale

loans.name: El Pozo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo tiene su domicilio en pueblo de Niquinohomo perteneciente a la ciudad de Masaya, estas tres mujeres tienen la misma actividad de ventas de Ropas y especies, venden  en la zona norte del país en ciudades como Matagalpa, Estela y Somoto. Se conocen desde hace muchos años y tienen una gran confianza una en la otra.

Doña Yahaira es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, madre de un niño, expresa que tenía necesidad de un crédito para comprar algunos artículos que no ofrecía, se informó en el mercado con una señora que trabaja con Adim, que es de la comarca y visitó la oficina, obtuvo la información y conformó su grupo para recibir la charla.
Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad que la aprendió de su mamá, espera salir bien en su crédito junto a sus compañeras y poder darle a su hijo estudios superiores.
Ella viaja por tres días a la semana fuera de su comunidad y un día va a Managua a comprar la ropa y especies, los otros días los dedica a su familia y a ir a dejar la cuota, ella es bien organizada con su tiempo y su negocio.
Su esposo le colabora con los gastos de su trabajo en la finca, piensa que van a mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
Doña Yhajaira ha  recibido varias capacitaciones y le ha servido para llevar un mejor control en su negocio.
texts.en:
This group calls the village of Niquinohomo, part of the city of Masaya, home. These three women all work in the same business: clothing and spice sales. They sell in the northern region of the country, in cities including Matagalpa, Estela and Somoto. They have known each other for many years and have a great deal of confidence in each other. Yahaira is the coordinator of the group. She is the mother of a young son. She comments that she needs a loan in order to buy items that she does not currently offer. She learned about Adim, a local organization, from a woman at the local market who works with the organization. She visited the office, gathered the information and formed her group, so they could all meet with Adim. Yahaira has been working in this business for years. She learned the business from her mother. She hopes to get ahead with this loan together with her partners in the group; she hopes to be able to give her son a college education. She travels 3 days of the week outside of her community, and one day of the week she goes to Managua to buy the clothing and spices. The other days she spends taking caring of her family and going to Adim to make the group's loan payment. She is very organized about her time and her business. Her husband helps pay the household expenses with his work on a farm. Yahaira plans to make improvements to their home. Yahaira has received several training courses; they have helped her to better manage her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.en:
Đào Hoàng (1328030876) is a 24-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyen. She is married and has an infant child. To making a living, Đào owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling poultry products in the local community. Đào has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $226) a month from these activities.

In 2003, Đào joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Đào has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Đào is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 Dong which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the 6th loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. Đào plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family

loans.use: Food products for resale

loans.name: Zhkera Group

texts.en: Zhkera is the group leader of Zhkera group. There are three members in this group. They want to expand their businesses and make them larger. Zhkera wants to take out a loan for her tailoring business. Sheullah wants to take out a loan for her quilt making business. Moaui wants to take out a loan for her father who makes cauldrons. They are requesting a group of loan 42000 Afghani for the term of 10 months. They are happy about this process of loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Zoila

texts.en:
Zoila is the president of the Virgen D. Los Angeles Village Bank, which meets once a month in the town of Huayllacocha, where she lives. Zoila is sixty years old and is the widowed mother of three children, all of whom are now adults with families of their own. Zoila’s main business is selling “jora,” the fermented corn used to make chicha, a traditional Andean corn beer. She buys dried corn in 14-kilo sacks for $7 apiece, soaks the corn to ferment it, and resells each 14-kilo sack for $10 soles to local chicha producers. She works seven days a week selling jora at the market in Izcuchaca, a large town about thirty minutes away that serves as a transportation and commerce hub for the Anta region. She usually works from 6:00 am to 3:00 or 4:00 pm, depending on business, and earns about $20 per day in profits. She has been in this line of work for the past ten years, and has developed rheumatism over the years from having her hands in cold jora water all throughout the day. 

Zoila is requesting a loan to buy sacks of dried corn. The money should be enough to buy 100 sacks of corn. Zoila has pledged to repay her Kiva loan in full and on time. She is grateful for the loans offered to her by Asociacion Arariwa, since it is the only financial institution that offers services in her town.

loans.use: Buy dried corn for fermentation

loans.name: Edjoè

texts.fr:
Cette dame est une sage femme, pour aider les femmes n’ayant pas de moyens à se procurer des  médicaments elle a commencé la vente de produits génériques et pharmaceutiques en détail. Elle fait cela depuis 5 ans déjà. Ainsi les femmes arrivent à se procurer les médicaments quand elles sont malades.
Son stock actuel est épuisé, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter des produits génériques "MEG".
texts.en:
This lady is a midwife. In order to help women who don't have the means to buy medicines, she began to sell generic and pharmaceutical products retail. She has been doing this for 5 years already. Thus the women manage to get medicines when they are ill.

Her inventory is presently sold out so she wants to replenish it and has asked WAGES for her first loan to buy "MEG" generic products.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of generic medicines

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty es una mujer de 56 años, los últimos años ha trabajado mucho para tener los ingresos necesarios para la construcción de su casa propia, la cual está en proceso y espera pronto se termine para tener seguridad y comodidad, ya que por el momento vive en la casa de su suegra. En el tiempo que lleva casada aprendió el oficio de su esposo, ahora es un apoyo dentro del negocio, puesto que es la encargada de la administración de los contratos. Ellos se dedican al alquiler de andamios (soportes de metal) que requieren para las construcciones, de la misma forma apoya en el negocio que tiene con sus hijos en el mercado de la ciudad donde atienden los pedidos de elaboración o reparación de diversos materiales de construcción. Esta actividad la viene desempeñando con mayor compromiso desde hace 3 años, tiempo en el que, junto a su esposo e hijos, atienden su taller desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Betty menciona que en compañía de su familia las labores son menos pesadas y juntos tienen proyectado ampliar su negocio para dar mejores servicios bajo el rubro de construcción. En Microfinanzas PRISMA este es su crédito número 18 y como parte de su banco comunal trata de apoyar a todas sus compañeras para trabajar en conjunto por el desarrollo y crecimiento de ellas mismas. Los 3200 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de algunos materiales que tiene pensado adquirir para alquilar y ampliar sus servicios.
texts.en:
Betty is a 56 year-old woman. Recently, she has worked very hard in order to earn the necessary income for the construction of her own home, which is still in progress. She hopes that it will be finished soon so that she can have security and comfort. Right now she lives in the home of her mother-in-law.

In the time that she has been married, she has learned the business of her spouse, and now has a support role in his business, a role where she is in charge of the administration of the contracts. They rent scaffolding (metal supports) which are required for construction. In the same way, the business, which they have with their children in the city market, serves the requests for the creation or repair of diverse construction materials. This venture began 3 years ago, during which, along with her spouse and children, Betty works in the shop from 9 in the morning until 6 in the evening. Betty says that in the company of her family, the work seems less tedious. Together they plan to grow their business so that they can provide better services in the field of construction.

This is her 18th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and as part of her community bank, Betty tries to support all of her fellow members to help them develop and grow. The 3200 Peruvian Soles she seeks she will us to invest in the purchase of some materials which she plans to rent to improve their services.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to rent

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet prepares and sells pastries like doughnuts. She is 31 years old, married and a mother with four children who are currently in school. She has been in business seven years now, taking care of the family. In spite of the challenges she faces, she manages to handle the demands of her customers and successfully meet their requests on time. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials, as the price of raw materials has gone up. She requests the support of a loan to remain in business. With this loan, she believes she can provide for her family and save money for future eventualities. She says your help is much needed in her life and business.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Chea, 42, and her husband, Mr. Ny Khin, 49, live on an island of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1984 and have seven children, five sons and two daughters. Two of their children are married and one lives outside the family home. Two of their sons are construction workers, one of their daughters weaves silk at home, and the others are still in school. 

S. was a weaver for twenty-three years. It is a skill she learned from her neighbor. She gave her loom to her daughter and started new business growing vegetables and crops. Mr. Ny Khen has been a fisherman for over twenty-five years. He fishes in the village and sells the fish to villagers.

S. is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase silk material for her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea tiene 58 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 30 años se viene dedicando a las tareas agrícolas, cultivando la papa y otros productos oriundos D. su zona. D. esta forma, junto a su esposo, han sostenido durante mucho tiempo su hogar. Por esa razón y para menguar su trabajo físico, hace algunos años atrás decidieron implementar una tienda D. comestibles en su casa, para obtener ganancias con ella y ya no tener que realizar mucho esfuerzo en sus chacras. Los productos que ofrece son los comestibles básicos y más demandados D. consumo diario, por lo que su tienda se ha convertido en una D. las más visitadas D. su localidad y eso les está brindando ingresos económicos estables. Esta la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, donD. trabajar en un banco comunal le ha permitido aprender el valor del ahorro. El dinero que ahora está solicitando será utilizado en la compra D. mercadería para surtir su tienda con productos D. primera necesidad.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Thorn N. is a 36-year-old mother of two, and raising a pig is a main part of her daily routine. Other than a daily profit from pig raising, she relies on her husband's business of driving a motor taxi, and fishing in Tunle Sap Lake.

The family includes two children, and one of them is enrolled in primary school. The family's living environment is not comfortable, due to the frequent collapses of their house. Thorn N. would like a loan to repair and decorate her old house.

loans.use: Repair and decorate her old house

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es:
Enriqueta es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 42 años y vive con su pareja y padre D. sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. ElL. tiene terrenos temporales (según L. lluvia) que son apropiados para L. siembra D. papas y olluco, auque le gustaría también producir arvejas, pero el clima muy frío perjudica este producto. Enriqueta está satisfecha porque tanto L. papa como el olluco son productos muy rentables, sobre todo el olluco, pues en algunas ocasiones ha llegado en vender hasta 120 soles cada saco. ElL. comenta que “es cuestión D. suerte”, pues el precio varía D. un momento al otro. Adicionalmente; en algunas ocasiones, junto a su esposo trabajan en las chacras D. sus vecinos, donD. le pagan 15 soles a elL. y 18 a él. D. ese modo, estas ganancias extras les sirven para sus necesidades diarias.
Este es su octavo préstamo con MFP y está muy agradecida porque estos créditos le han permitido incrementar su producción agrícoL., es por ello que no deja D. asistir a sus reuniones del banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en L. compra D. fertilizantes químicos para sus chacras D. papa.
texts.en:
Enriqueta is a very hardworking woman, she is 42 and lives with her partner and father of his 4 children in a house they own. She has seasonal land (depending on rain) that are suitable for cultivating potatoes and other root vegetables, she would also like to produce peas, but the cold weather is not good for this product. Enriqueta is pleased because the potatoes and other root vegetables are profitable because in a few occasions she has been able to sell them at $120 “soles” per sac. She indicates that “it’s a matter of luck”, because prices vary from one moment to the next. In addition, she occasionally works with her husband in their neighboors’ land, where she gets paid $15 “soles” and he gets paid $18 “soles”, these are additional earnings that are useful to cover their everyday needs. This is the 8th loan with MFP and she is very thankful because these loans have allowed her to increase production and that’s why she keeps attending the community bank meetings. The money requested will be invested in buying chemical fertilizer for the potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Fertilizer

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia M. is currently in the business of selling local Sudanese bread cooked in the cooking oil and is requesting a loan to purchase more baking flour. 

 Cicilia is 40 years old and is Married with a husband that is a police man. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send her children to school. 

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more baking flour

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana L. is from Zone 3A, Del Carmen, Iligan City. She is 40 years old. Rosana is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosana owns & operates a business buying and selling eggs in the local community. Rosana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosana is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP. These funds will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosana from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

location.town: Zone 3A, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Ham

texts.en:
Ham S., 48, is a widowed farmer who lives in Siem Reap with six of her children. She grows and sells rice. On average, she is able to make US$ 2 each day. She is also supported by four of the children; three are construction workers and one is a chef in a hotel.

Ham S. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Atyrgul's Group

texts.ru:
Асанбаева Атыргуль – лидер данной группы. Пятидесяти – пятилетняя Атыргуль – мать троих детей. Атыргуль и её муж занимаются домашним хозяйством. Они разводят овец. Они усердно копили свои сбережения, чтобы приобрести скот. В конце им удалось приобрести одну корову. В последующем они размножали скот и по мере необходимости продавали его. Трудно переоценить значение владения живности для Атыргуль и её мужа. Ведь за счёт скота они построили дом, дали детям образование и даже купили квартиру в столице. Они также имеют огород и выращивают там овощи. Атыргуль помимо этого держит коров и продаёт молоко. Только прибыль от молока составляет ежемесячно около двух тысяч семисот сомов. Хотя двадцать лет тому назад, когда они только начали заниматься животноводством, они вложили в покупку коровы всего тысячу сомов. Сейчас корова стоит, чуть ли не в двенадцать раз дороже. Атыргуль с мужем понимают важность того, как им удалось сэкономить время. И тем не менее, они вырастили детей и постарались предоставить им возможность получить образование и свободу выбора  профессии. И дети сделали свой выбор. Они избрали сферу органов правопорядка. Старшему сыну двадцать девять лет, женат. Он работает следователем в милиции. Среднему сыну двадцать семь лет. Он работает в уголовном розыске и пока холост. Младший сын ещё не закончил ВУЗ. Атыргуль хочет приобрести ещё одну дойную корову. Накопление средств займёт много времени, нежели этот кредит, за которым она и обратилась. Атыргуль очень надеется, что она получит его и сможет осуществить задуманное. Она планирует женить остальных двух сыновей и начать увеличивать поголовье скота. 

У Атыргуль три партнёра по группе:

Абдылдаевой Рахат тридцать сем лет. Рахат растит четырёх детей. Муж работает разнорабочим на стройке. Рахат находится дома, смотрит за пятилетним сыном. Но при этом она успевает заниматься животноводством и продавать молоко. Рахат нужен кредит для покупки бычка. 

Бейшенбаевой Розе сорок два года. Вместе с мужем занимаются домашним хозяйством: держат коров овец, а также воспитывают троих детей. Старшей дочери шестнадцать лет, а младшему сыну семь лет. Роза обратилась за кредитом, с целью купить овец для разведения. 

Орозбаковой Динаре тридцать шесть лет. Она мать троих детей. Супруг работает внештатным электриком. Сама Динара занимается розничной торговлей товаров повседневного спроса на дому. Динаре нужен кредит, чтобы закупить товар.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Atyrgul A. is the leader of this group. She is fifty-five and is a mother of three children. Atyrgul and her husband are in the sheep-breeding business. In the beginning they had to save diligently in order to purchase their first livestock. Eventually they were able to buy a cow, and later they started to breed livestock and sell it as necessary. It is difficult to over-estimate the importance of having livestock for Atyrgul and her husband: with the income they earned they were able to build a house, give an education to their children, and even bought an apartment in the capital. Atyrgul and her husband also grow vegetables in their own garden. In addition to the livestock-breeding business, Atyrgul keeps cows and sells milk. Just the monthly profit from the sale of milk is about 2700 soms (local currency). But twenty years ago, when they just started their livestock business, they were able to buy their first cow for only 1000 soms. Nowdays a cow costs almost twelve times as much. Atyrgul and her husband know the value of time. When they raised their children they tried their best to give them an education and the freedom to choose their profession. And the children have made their choice: they decided to go into police work. The eldest son is twenty-nine and is married. He is a police detective. The middle son is twenty-seven and he is not married yet. He works as as a detective as well. The youngest son has not yet finished college. Atyrgul wants to purchase an additional dairy cow. Without a loan it will take her a long time to save up enough money. She really hopes to obtain this loan so she can realize her plans. She would would like to get her two younger sons married and also to increase the size of her flock.

Atyrgul has three partners in her group: Rahat A. is thirty-seven. Rahat is raising four children. Her husband is a construction worker. Rahat stays at home and takes care of her five year-old-son. However, she also finds enough time to tend her livestock and sell milk. Rahat would like to get a loan to purchase a bull. Roza B. is forty-two. She and her husband tend to their sheep and cows. They are raising three children. The eldest daughter is sixteen, and the youngest son is seven. Roza is seeking a loan in order to purchase sheep for breeding. Dinara O. is thirty-six. She is a mother of three children. Her spouse is a self-employed electrician. Dinara has a home-based retail business. She would like to get a loan in order to purchase a stock of goods to sell.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité la vende d’œufs et de divers produits d’alimentation générale. Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 1999, elle s’approvisionne en produits d’alimentation générale à Lomé et en œufs dans une ferme à l’intérieur du pays.  Son stock de marchandises est en baisse elle voudrait se réapprovisionner et  sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 15 plateaux d’œufs et divers produits d’alimentation générale. 
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, avec  son commerce elle contribue aux dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
This woman runs a business selling eggs and other general foodstuffs. She began this business in 1999 and stocks up on general foodstuffs in Lomé and on eggs at a farm inland. Her stock of goods is declining and she would like to build it up again; she is thus asking for a loan from WAGES for the purchase of 15 trays of eggs and other general foodstuffs. She is married and has two children; through her business she contributes to the household expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 15 trays of eggs

loans.name: Vaniza

texts.en:
Vaniza S. is from the village of Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 22 years old. Vaniza is single and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Vaniza owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling coated and salted peanuts in the local community. Vaniza has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vaniza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vaniza is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Vaniza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Nafi

texts.fr: Nafi M. est une femme mariée de 49ans. Elle fait du petit commerce de tissu et ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital. Son objectif est de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie familiale.
texts.en:
Nafi M. is a married woman who is 49 years old. She has a small cloth business and this loan will allow her to strengthen her capital. Her aim is to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To carry out a small cloth business

loans.name: Los Canarios Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Canarios” esta representado por la señora Cristina  y conformada por por 10 miembros en la cual el 90 % mujeres y el 10% hombres todos residen en la misma zona D. San Jorge I, es un grupo que ya trabajo con nuestra institución pero descansaron dos ciclos para poder proseguir son gente muy cumplida y responsable por lo que la Fundación Agrocapital les brinda una nueva oportunidad D. seguir creciendo juntos. Los socios tienen diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta D. frutas y verduras en el mercado, venta D. pollo, ropa, atención en ferreterías y la presidenta es dueña D. su propia vidriaría en la cual atienD. con su esposo y donD. pueD. cuidar D. sus tres pequeños, la mayor expectativa que tiene la señora Cristina es poder tener una vidriaría bien equipada para poder hacer vitrales  y poder ampliar mas su tienda para que pueda comprar una mayor cantidad D. vidrio sin que este se encuentre en la intemperie y pierda brillo, todo este esfuerzo D. su esposo y ella es por el sustento D. su familia y en especial por el bienestar y la educación D. sus hijos.  El resto D. las socias destinaran sus fondos en la adquisición D. mercadería, insumos y materiales para incre4mentar sus ventas y generar un mejor ingreso que les permita mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus hogares. En cuanto a la competencia muchas D. las socias tuvieron que dejar D. vender algunos productos por la competencia pero a su esfuerzo y dedicación saben como salir adelante para llevar el pan D. cada día a sus familias.
texts.en:
The group "Los Canarios" is represented by Señora Cristina and consists of 10 members, of whom 90% are women and 10% are men. All live in the same zone of San Jorge I. This is a group that has already worked with our institution (Fundación Agrocapital), but they took a break for two loan cycles in order to be able to continue. They are very courteous and responsible people, and for this reason Fundación Agrocapital is offering them a new opportunity to continue growing together. The members have different business activities, such as the sale of fruits and vegetables in the market, and the sale of chickens, clothing, and hardware.

The president is the owner of her own glass shop, where she works with her husband, and where she is able to care for their three small children. Señora Cristina's greatest expectation is to have a well-equipped glass shop to be able to make stained glass windows and to enlarge her store so that she can buy larger quantities of glass without having to leave it outdoors where it would lose its shine. All this effort on the part of her husband and herself is for the support of their family and especially for the well-being and education of their children.

The rest of the group members will direct their funds to the acquisition of merchandise, supplies, and materials to increase their sales and generate better incomes, which will allow them to improve the quality of life in their homes. As for competition, many of the members have had to stop selling some products due to competition, but with their effort and dedication they know how to overcome difficulties to proviD. daily sustenance to their families.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: operating capital

loans.name: To-Kuru Omarsu Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the To-Kuru Omarsu Group (in Temne: May God Help Us). The leader of the group is Aminata C.. She has been a businesswoman for many years now. The 45-year-old Aminata sells shoes. She is married to a farmer and they have 3 children, one of whom is already married, one is in secondary school, and the other is a businessman. Aminata was born in a place call Konsho, in northern Sierra Leone. She will use this loan to further expand on her business. She will use it to buy dozens of shoes to add to her current stock. 

Members of the To-Kuru Omarsu group are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni city.  This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs will be accessing from SMT/Kiva Lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit, and consequently improve their living standards by sending their children to school, feeding themselves and their children, buying clothing, etc.

loans.use: Buy dozens of shoes

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan N. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling food and daily use products in her community. She is 24 years old, married and has one young child. They are from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. Joan has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Joan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Joan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase products to sell. Joan is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosesa

texts.en:
Rosesa L. is from the village of Letican, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 31 years old and single. To make a living, Rosesa owns and operates a variety store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and other daily used products in the local community. Rosesa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosesa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosesa is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is the wife of M. A. who has been involved in an animal sales business for the over 20 years. His good knowledge about animal breeds attracts customers.
Razia is a very caring lady. She does the domestic chores but she helps her husband by taking care of his animals too. Presently they have one cow at their home. Razia is requesting  a loan to buy goats to meet the needs of M.'s customers.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es socia del Banco Comunal Totorilla.
Miriam es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Miriam tiene una cebichería en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de 5 personas. Además Miriam vende pescado los días sábados y domingos.
Miriam necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de mesas.
Miriam sueña con tener un local propio y sucursales.
texts.en:
Miriam, 35, is a member of the Totorilla communal bank; she lives with her life partner and their three children. She has a ‘cebichería’ (place that sells ‘ceviche,’ marinated fish cocktails) in a rented location; she has five helpers and is open for business every day. She also sells fish on weekends. Miriam needs a 2500 sol loan to buy tables. She dreams with owning her own place and branch locations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables.

loans.name: Nyota Group

texts.fr:
Kahambu W. E. est présidente du groupe de crédit  Nyota, habillée en robe noire, elle lève sa main sur la photo, cliente au 16e cycle de crédit, âgée de 34 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants, tous  vont à l’école. Son mari est petit commerçant de divers produits.
Kahambu W. E. vend des divers entre autres les valises, chainettes, robes, chemises, pantalons, boubou femme, jubés, souliers, etc.  dans son petit magasin, et parfois dans des familles amies preneurs de ses produits. Elle a commencé son petit commerce  avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari. 
Son capital initial était de 100$. Ce qui lui a permis de lancer une activité de vente de riz et peu après, en collaboration avec  son mari, son business a évolue jusqu'à créer une petite boutique. Il y a 13 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. 
Avec  le crédit  de  l’IMF Hekima, Kahambu W. E. souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant 6 valises, 4 boubous femmes, 6 blouses et 6 jupes, 10 chainettes Manzanza.
Le grand défi de Kahambu W. E., elle est encore locataire (à son domicile et au lieu de travail) alors  tous les profits de son business payent les charges de loyers estimées à 20$ par mois. Et parfois son bailleur lui exige de payer une garantie de plus de 9 mois.
Dans l’avenir, Kahambu W. E. planifie accroitre son business et quitter la banque communautaire vers le groupe solidaire qui offre beaucoup plus d’avantages opérationnels en terme du montant de crédit, de taux d’intérêt et de l’échéance de remboursement etc.
En outre Kahambu W. E. souhaiterait dans un futur proche, acheter une parcelle et si Dieu lui prête vie, acheter aussi une voiture.
 Dans le 10 ans, elle ambitionne ouvrir une deuxième boutique dans le centre ville de Goma. Elle compte s’approvisionner à la source dans le grand centre commercial mondial soit à Dubaï ou soit à Chine.
Kahambu W. E. remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grâce à ces crédits, elle a déjà équipé sa maison, elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et son business prospère bien. 
Ce groupe Nyota  est  composé de 16 membres majoritairement femmes.
texts.en:
Kahambu W. E. is the president of the loan group Nyota. Dressed in the black dress, she is raising her hand in the photo. She is a client on her 16th loan cycle, 34 years old, married, and mother of three children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a small trader of various products. Kahambu W. E. sells diverse products like suitcases, small chain jewelry, dresses, blouses, pants, women's boubous (traditional clothing), skirts, shoes, etc. in her small shop. Sometimes family friends buy her products. She began her business with her own funds from her husband. Her initial capital was $100. This allowed her to launch a business selling rice. A short time afterward, in collaboration with her husband, her business evolved into a small boutique. She has now done this work for 13 years. With a loan from IMF Hekima, Kahambu W. E. wishes to increase her sales by purchasing six suitcases, four female boubous, six blouses, six skirts, and ten Manzaza chains. Kahambu's biggest challenge is that she still rents (at home and at her workplace). Thus, all of her business profits go to pay her rent, estimated at $20 per month. Sometimes, her lessor insists that she guarantee nine months' payment. In the future, Kahambu W. E. plans to grow her business and leave the communal bank for a united group which offers many operational advantages in terms of increased credit, interest tax, and repayment deadlines. Moreover, in the near future, Kahambu wishes to buy a plot of land and, god willing, a car. In ten years, she intends to open a second boutique in the center of Goma. She plans on getting supplies from the world's large commercial centers, either in Dubai or in China. Kahambu thanks the IMF Hekima for the loans she received without any material guarantee because, thanks to these loans, she has already equipped her house, she manages to meet her children's needs, and her business is prospering. The Nyota group is made up of 16 members, the majority of whom are female.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of six suitcases, four female boubous, six blouses, six skirts, and ten Manzaza chains

loans.name: Doung

texts.en:
Doung N., 52, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She sells corn at a local market for an income of about $4 per day. Her husband is a farmer who grows fruit trees on his own plot of land, earning an average income of $4 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

N. is requesting a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her husband to provide transportation services as a motor-taxi driver. This is her fourth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap N. (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Chorn Chea, live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2000 and have two sons. 

Sopheap has been a silk weaver since she was young, a skill she learned from her mother. She also taught her husband to become a silk weaver. They sell their finished products to a middleman, who in turn sells them at a Phnom Penh market. In addition to weaving, Mr. Chorn Chea also climbs up palm trees to collect palm juice. 

Sopheap has asked for a Kiva loan once before. Because the door and windows of her house are old and not strong, she decided to replace them. But, she does not have enough money for this. Hence Sopheap is applying for her second loan of $200 to make the replacements.

loans.use: To replace the door and widows of her house.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthorn C. lives in Pou Ta Mok village in Takeo province and she was born in 1980. She is the mother of two children who are both attending the local public school. Her husband, Mr. Khum Tub, is an agricultural machinery driver. He is shown in the photo with her.

Mrs. Chanthorn C. is a farmer who owns a two-hectare (5-acre) plot of land she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support their family living.

Now Mrs. Chanthorn C. has some problems because her field has infertile soil, it has a lot of insects, and it is far away from the irrigation system. So, to improve production, she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu E. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old and married with seven school-aged children. To make a living, Marichu owns a sari-sari (variety) shop selling both food and daily use products. Marichu has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marichu joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marichu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marichu is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Marichu from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Alexander Jose

texts.es: Alexander José tiene 24 años, su actividad económica es realizar la venta de lotería. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues está pensando en mejor su negocio, por lo que él es un hombre muy luchador y que disfruta de su actividad, por lo que recorre distancias muy largas para ofrecer sus productos de lotería nacional y premios instantáneos, por lo que se cansa mucho pero vale la pena para mantener a su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima e invertir en su negocio. el sueña con seguir trabajando y mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Alexander José is 24 years and he sells lottery tickets. He has dedicated himself to this business for 18 years. He is a hardworking man that enjoys his business which is why he travels long distances to offer his lottery products and instant prizes. He gets tired a lot but it is worth it to support his family. The loan he is requesting is to purchase materials and to invest in his business. He dreams of continuing to work and improving his standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: American Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “American” group, named after their most favorite country. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions.

Mohamed K. (who is pictured in the left) is the leader of this group. The thirty-seven-year-old is single with four children. He has been a businessman for seven years now, owning a shop where he sells sardines, milk, sugar, lollipops, etc.

Mohamed will use his share of the loan to buy more of the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to his stock.

loans.use: To buy more sardines, milk, sugar, lollipops, etc., wholesale to add to his shop

loans.name: Mariel

texts.en:
Mariel T. is from the town of Talibon. She is 28 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a fishing business. She has a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. She works hard to sustain her family, and especially to pay for her children's education.

Mariel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a  loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This will be her 1st loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Costa Pucú Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la compañía Costa Pucú de la cuidad de Caacupé. 
Son muy trabajadoras, muy organizadas y unidas, mantienen un buen sentido de pertenencia grupal; eso les favorece a la hora de la renovación del crédito, pues no teniendo días de atrasos pueden aumentar sus montos y pasar de ciclo. 
Las Señoras están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya, porque gracias a los beneficios que les ofrecen, tanto con los créditos como también con las constantes capacitaciones que reciben, encontraron la forma de ayudar al sustento de sus hogares.
Las integrantes ya culminaron hoy su ciclo crediticio número 4, poseen una antigüedad de 1 año 4 meses aproximadamente. 
Entre la integrantes se encuentra la señora
 Pablina, una mujer muy activa y trabajadora que lucha todos los días para sacar delante de la mejor manera a su familia. 
Ella tiene como actividad de costurera, hace de todo en cuanto a costura se refiera como confección de ropas, cortes de sabanas, fundas, ropas para niños, y otros. 
Además de esa actividad para el consumo de la familia ella cuenta con animales, lo que también le da mucho trabajo. 
Pero ella se siente muy bien trabajando y ayudando a su familia y desea mucho seguir haciéndolo. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales que ella utiliza para su confección.
texts.en:
The women of this group are from the Costa Pucú company, located in the city of Caacupé. They are hardworking, very organized, united, and maintain a good group identity. This helps them at loan renewal time. By not falling behind, they are able to increase their amounts and complete the cycle. The women are very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya because, thanks to the benefits and training that they receive, the have found a way to sustain their households. These members have completed their fourth cycle and have been in the program for approximately one year and four months. Pablina is among the members and is a very active, hard working woman who struggles daily to get her family ahead as best she can. She is a seamstress who makes clothing, sheets, bedspreads, clothing for children, and other things. She also raises animals for food, which is also hard work. She feels comfortable working and helping her family and would very much like to continue. She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies that she needs for her work as a seamstress.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Кодиров Исмоил проживает в районе Бохтар. Возраст, 33 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей на центральном рынке района. У него собственная торговая точка, где он продает парфюмерию. Имеет богатый опыт в этой сфере. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Ismoil K. lives in the Bohtar region. He is 33 years old, married and has two children. He has secondary education. He has been selling on the central market. He has his own vendor spot where he sells cosmetic products. He has a good experience in this field. He is taking out the loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Jazgul's Group

texts.en:
Jazgul S. is the leader of the group. She is 32 years old and married. Her spouse makes his income by working as an odd-job man. The couple brings up five children (3 sons and 2 daughters), and the eldest of them help their parents in house keeping. The family has its own business, which was started 4 years ago. They sell fruits and vegetables by wholesale. Due to years of working hard, the family has managed to increase cattle stock and improve their wealth. Jazgul’s family hopes to get a loan in order to purchase more fruits and vegetables. In the future she wishes to improve her family's welfare and develop their business. 

Nurzat M. is the group’s treasurer. She is 24 years old and married. Together with her spouse, who earns additional income by working at a building site, she brings up 2 children (a son and a daughter). Both of their children go to kindergarten. Nurzat increases her family's budget by working as a business producer. In order to make her plans of purchasing furniture come true, Nurzat hopes to get a loan. In the future she is planning to improve her family’s welfare. 

Mahabat K. is 36 years old and married. Her family has two children (a daughter and a son, who is a schoolboy). She lives together with her husband’s parents, who make their living by farming. Mahabat’s spouse raises money by working as a driver for Red Cross. She works in the accounting profession. Her family needs to get a loan in order to purchase calves for fattening. In the future the family wants to increase their cattle stock. 

Nazira M. is 27 years old. She is a farmer. She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to improve her living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nemwel

texts.en:
Nemwel is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. He has been farming for eight years and employs one farmhand. His main products are milk, eggs, vegetables and milk which he sells at the local market. He also earns income from his carpentry business in the same area. 

Nemwel is 47 years old. He is married with five children who are between the ages of 5 and 24. Three of his children are currently attending school.
