He recently repaid his previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 52,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve the living standards of the family. His biggest challenges have been lack of food storage facilities and the high cost of artificial insemination services. He says that in the next five years, he plans to have six dairy cows and be the main milk supplier to the local market. He says that with the previous loan he got he has been able to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida is the resident of Depalpur which is a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its dairy industry. She lives in the area named Basti abdullah with her family in a 2 room house.  She is a housewife, stays at home and does her household responsibilities. Her children are very young and needs her full time attention. She is the mother of 3 years old daughter and 2 sons, the elder one is 2 years old and younger one is just 1 year old. 

Khalida is 38 years old and married to N. A. who is involved in a transportation business for over 10 years. He operates a donkey cart, providing load and transport services to his customers and generates income for the family. His cart has become worn and needs a replacement otherwise, his work will be stopped, which he can’t afford as his earning are the main financial source of his family.  

Therefore, Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy a new donkey cart for her husband. She is hopeful that with the new cart her husband will be able to continue his work and provide better services to his clients.  

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application.  

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Khalida.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart for a transport business

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita E. is from the town of Surallah. She is 64 years old. She earns a living through farming, particularly planting rice crops. She said it's easier to sell rice compared to other crops because it is a Filipino's main food. Most of the people in Florita's town are farmers, so she wants to improve her business by selling quality rice. 

Florita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies

loans.name: Mario Anibal

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr.Mario; el tiene 49 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de estudio fotográfico, el socio trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa ya varios años atrás, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de San Sebastián. De esta manera el socio saca a su familia adelante.  

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de 1 cámara digital y para el mantenimiento de algunas maquinas.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago 
de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Mario is a member of the Communal Bank “Unidos Para El Triunfo” (United for the Triumph), which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

He is 49 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child.  Mario divides his time between his daily activities and his photography studio.  He and his wife have been working together for several years.  His business is located in the district of San Sebastián.  Through this activity, he is able to move his family forward.  He is requesting a loan in order to purchase one digital camera and pay for maintenance of his other machines.

Mario is grateful to those who helped fulfill his dream and promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase a digital camera & pay for machine maintenance

loans.name: Bururuma Progressive Group

texts.en: Deborah K. is the leader of the Bururuma Progressive Group in Kihihi. She is 40 years old and married, and she has five children, all of whom are older than nine. She has a business selling alcohol, that is, tonto and waragi from Nyamirambi, to the local people in her area. Deborah has been in this business for 6 years, in addition to farming, which is her mother business. She does not regret adding this business, because she is able to make over 240,000/= (Kenyan shillings) in profit each month. She makes the brew herself and sometimes sells the excess because there is a ready market. She needs a loan to buy bananas, which are a primary ingredient in the brew. She is very determined and focused and wants to expand her business further so she can have a happy family.

loans.use: To buy bananas to make the local brew

loans.name: Amando

texts.en:
Amando P. is from the village of Victoria San Mateo. He is 52 years old. Amando is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Amando owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Amando has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 30000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Amando joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amando is requesting a loan of 27000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Amando from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Reyna Elizabeth

texts.es: Reyna Elizabeth se dedica venta de cosméticos. Desde  hace más de 4 años que este negocio. Ella recorre las diferentes casas para ofrecer por medio de catálogos los productos que sus clientes le solicitan. Reyna es una joven que siempre ha tenido que buscar la forma de sacar adelante a su familia, la atención que les brinda a sus clientes es la mejor. Es por eso que realiza este crédito para la compra de  colonias, calzado, sabanas entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Reyna Elizabeth has sold cosmetics for more than 4 years.  She goes door to door to offer, via catalogs, the products that her customers ask her for.  Reyna is a young woman who has always had to find a way to move her family forward.  She offers her customers the best service, and that is why she is taking out this loan to purchase colognes, footwear, and sheets, among other items.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 46 years old and married with four children. He owns pool tables for commercial use and also runs a retail shop. Stephen also earns extra income from his rental houses and is able to educate his children with the income from his businesses.

Stephen has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy a pool table. In the next five years, he hopes to own twenty more pool tables.

loans.use: to buy a pool table

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Wasuk

texts.en: Wasuk is currently in a business of selling soft drinks and charcoal. She is 45 years old, married, with 5 children and all of them go to school. Wasuk borrowed a loan to stock more soft drinks and charcoal to sell. In the future, she hopes to pay for her children's schooling with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more soft drinks and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Bok Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de BOK JOM est un créé depuis l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de WANGO qui l'abrite. Il est composé de 12 femmes qui habitent pratiquement le même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe par des liens d'amitié et de voisinage. Leur principale activité est le petit commerce.

Madame HELENE N. (à droite de la photo avec une écharpe blanche) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 72 ans. Elle est veuve avec des enfants qui sont tous majeurs. Mais elle a la charge de ses 05 petits. 

Avant elle faisait la transformation de mil en couscous pour revendre au marché et dans le quartier. Elle fait maintenant un petit commerce de légumes et de poissons séchés. Elle vend des choux, du piment, des aubergines doux et amers. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de financer son petit commerce de légumes et de poissons séchés.

Son objectif est de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et de participer à la prise en charge de la dépense quotidienne de la famille et à l'achat des fournitures scolaires de ses petits enfants.
texts.en:
The Bok Jom group has been created during the inauguration of the Banc Villageois of Wango to which it belongs. It is composed of 12 women who live in almost the same neighborhood. They are friends and neighbors who decided to form a group together. Their main business activity is retail. Mrs. Helene N. (to the right in the photo, wearing a white scarf) is the group’s leader. She is 72 years old. She is a widow, and all her children are adults. But she has five grandchildren in her care.

In the past she used to cook millet couscous in order to sell it at the market or in her neighborhood. At present, she retails vegetables and dried fish. She sells cabbage, hot peppers, and sweet and bitter varieties of eggplant [aubergine]. Her new loan will allow her to finance her vegetables and dried fish business. Her goal is to provide for her personal needs and to  help to the everyday family expenses as well as with the costs of school supplies for her grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and dried fish

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Las señora Margarita  es originaria de ocotepec un lugar muy bonito de mucha naturaleza, ella es casada  con el señor Natividad  Hernández Morales, en donde procreo un hijo  de nombre Evodio de trece años de edad.
 
      Margarita solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía,  para surtir su pequeña tienda de abarrotes, ya que la hacen  falta algunos productos que por falta de ingresos no puede comprar.

     Ella deicidio poner esta  actividad para así lograr solventar su ingresos que se generan en su hogar a un que su familia es pequeña quiere darle lo más necesario y así animar a su  hijo  a seguir estudiando.

    Es una persona con muchos sueños ya que nos comenta que con la guanacia que valla obteniendo lo invertirá en la misma actividad para que así valla creciendo día con día. Y mejor sea sus ingresos para  tener de donde sostenerse.
texts.en:
Margarita is from Ocotepec, a very pretty place with lots of nature.  She’s married to Mr. Natividad Hernández Morales and has a 13 year old son, Evodio.

Margarita requested a loan to buy merchandise to stock her small grocery store because she’s lacking some products that the lack of income prevented her from buying.

She decided to set up this business to cover household expenses because, although the family is small, she wants to provide all that’s needed and encourage her son to stay in school.

She is a person with many dreams since she comments to us that the profits she will be getting will be reinvested in the business so that it will grow more each day and her income will be better so that she’ll have from where to support herself.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Enelita

texts.en: Enelita is married and runs a general store in the Philippines. She works hard to support her six children. Enelita is requesting an 1,800 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cook stove. She wants to save money by using the dried wood from nearby trees and limit the amount of money her family spends on charcoal. Enelita is aware that by using an Envirofit cook stove she is not only saving money but also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an Envirofit cook stove

loans.name: Bayarsaihan

texts.en:
Bayarsaihan is a widowed woman. She lives with her three children in Songino-hairhan district, Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in her older brother's backyard. Her older two children, aged 13 and 17, go to a local secondary school. The younger one hasn't reached school age yet. 

Bayarsaihan manages a grocery trading business in Ulaanbaatar city. She started her business in 2008 at a rented booth and gained much experience. She is planning to expand her business and wants to have her own supermarket in the future. She is an honest women who says, "I am trying hard to feed my family." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Yuli Maribel

texts.es:
Yuli es una madre joven de 24 años de edad, ella vive junto a su  novio e hijo en  una comunidad rural del distrito de Tambogrande – Piura.

La actividad que desarrolla Yuli  es la crianza de aves de corral (de pavos y gallinas). Actualmente cuenta con 40 pavos y 25 gallinas las cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local.  Su novio es agricultor y la apoya en las actividades que realiza, existe una buena relación familiar. 

Yuli solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar  alimentos balanceados para el engorde de sus pavos y gallinas para que estos tengan un mejor peso y tamaño  que le permita venderlos a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Yuli is a young 24 year-old mother who lives together with her boyfriend and son in a rural community in Tambogrande district – Piura.

Yuli's business activity is raising poultry (turkeys and hens).  She currently has 40 turkeys and 25 hens which she raises and fattens, and then sells in her local market.  Her boyfriend is a farmer and supports her in her business activities.  They have a good family relationship.

Yuli is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed with which to fatten her turkeys and hens so that they reach a better weight and size which will allow her to sell them at a better price.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: Rodrigo, tiene la edad de 56 años, está  casado y vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo. El lo que pretende es realizar la compra de los insumos para su fertilización y pagar la mano de obra de la siembra del frijol. El cuenta con el terreno en buenas condiciones para la explotación de este cultivo y cuenta con la experiencia necesaria para poder desarrollarla. Tiene como meta poder generarle a esta cosecha que viene las ganancias necesarias para poder mejorar su bienestar familiar y seguir creciendo como persona y cumplir sus metas a largo plaza. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Rodrigo is 56 years old, is married and lives with his 2 children and husband. What he wants is to buy materials to fertilize and pay for labor in his bean crops. Rodrigo has a good plot of land to grow these crops and has the experience necessary to be able to do it. As a goal, he wants this harvest to give him the profits necessary to improve his family’s well-being and to keep growing as a person and meet his goals in the long run. This is Rodrigo’s first loan and was received through FUDECOSUR. He hasn’t had any other loans in state banks but FUDECOSUR has given him the loan more easily and the interest rates are much lower.

loans.use: harvest bean crops.

loans.name: Vich

texts.en:
Mrs. Vich has a small kiosk where she sells cakes, sweets, and cooking ingredients, and she also provides telephone service to her neighbors for a fee. She has been running this sales business for over two years, earning a profit of an average of US$8 to cover the daily expenses in her family. She doesn’t have a life partner as she divorced her husband several years ago. She always tries to earn money to feed her two children who are students. 

Mrs. Vich would like to request a Kiva loan to buy pig-feed, piglets and to accumulate a larger quantity of inventory items for her kiosk. Mrs. Vich hopes she will be able to make more income for her family to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy pig-feed, piglets and to accumulate a larger quantity of inventory items.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is 34 years old and lives in the West Point area.  She attended school through 4th grade.  She’s single and has 2 children, aged 14 and 16.  They both live at home and attend school. 

She sells lappa (traditional cloth).  Her main challenge is the high cost of her purchases. What she likes about this business is selling to customers.  She is proud to be able to send her children to school.  

Musu has requested this loan to purchase more Lappa.  She will continue to use any profits to pay for her children's school fees.  One day she would like to own her own home.

loans.use: to purchase more Lappa (traditional cloth)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA GENERACION III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 55 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, el es propietario de un taxi que realiza servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco, el socio trabaja desde las 6.00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere mejorar el negocio de transporte. El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro, para comprar llantas y repuestos.
                                                
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is part of the Communal Bank “Nueva Generación III” (New Generation III), which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

He is 55 years old, married, and has two children. The member divides his time between his daily activities and his transportation business. He is the owner of a taxi and provides his service by traveling through different streets in the city of Cusco. The member works from 6am to 8pm. Through his work, he is able to help his children get ahead. The member wants to improve his transportation business. He is requesting a loan to maintain his automobile and buy tires and parts.

The member is happy with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance and to buy tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is 59 years old and is a married woman with one child. She has been engaged in farming for 16 years. She helps her husband till the land where they grow rice and corn crops. Edita also runs a sari-sari store business. She sells dry goods and vegetables.

Edita requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell, like canned goods. She hopes to have a bigger farm and store someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell, like canned goods

loans.name: Vianey

texts.es: Vianey tiene 22 años de edad es madre de un niño de 1 año, su esposo es trabajador de la construcción en la cuidad de México. Ella vive en una localidad llena de vegetación y de unos paisajes hermosos, la principal actividad económica de su localidad es la venta de borregos. Ella se dedica a vender estos animales desde hace 3 años y dice que ella y su esposo emprendieron este negocio para tener sus ahorros invertidos en algún negocio que les dejara ganancias, ellos compran los borregos en otras localidades y ahorita dice que nada mas tienen 5 borregos ya en la temporada de graduaciones de las escuelas se les venden muy rápido es por eso que esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para comprar otros 3 borregos para criarlos y en la época decembrina (navidad) venderlos a un buen precio ya que también en esa época se le venden muy rápidamente. La meta que tiene Vianey es tener un gran rebaño de borregos para que sus esposo y ella nada más se dedique a ese negocio para que ya no salga tan lejos a trabajar. Ella esta muy contenta por que le están haciendo el préstamo por que su negocio crecerá.
texts.en:
Vianey is 22 years old and the mother of a 1-year-old son. Her husband is a construction worker in Mexico City. She lives in a locale full of vegetation and with beautiful landscapes. The principal economic activity of this locality is selling sheep.

Vianey has been selling these animals for the last 3 years and she says that she and her husband began this business to have their savings invested in a business that would provide earnings. They bought their sheep in other  regions and now, she says they have no less than 5 sheep. Now that the era of school graduations has arrived, they will sell the sheep rapidly. That's why she is requesting a loan from this institution to buy another 3 sheep to raise so that by the December (Christmas) season, she can sell them at a good price when they sell rapidly.

Vianey's goal is to have a large herd of sheep so that she and her husband can dedicate themselves full time to this business, and he won't have to go so far to work. Vianey is very content to be seeking a loan because it will help her business grow.

loans.use: raise and sell sheep.

loans.name: Savoeurn

texts.en:
Savoeurn and her husband, Kong, are gardeners. They live in a village along National Road Number One about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have seven children - three sons and four daughters. Five are married and live outside the family home and two are gardeners along with their parents. Savoeurn is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. 

Savoeurn and her husband appear in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Mirna Isabel

texts.es:
Mirna, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, ella administra un chalet desD. hace 10 años, este surgió por iniciativa propia y hoy en día es su gran apoyo para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
Actualmente comprara mercadería con un préstamo, ya que desea reforzar el inventario con compras D. gaseosa, jugos, pan, estos productos le ayudaran para mejorar la atención a los clientes.
Su propósito es que a través D. los préstamos se pueda desarrollar en el negocio y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Mirna lives with her husband and three children.  She has managed a snack shop for 10 years. This occurred due to her own initiative and nowadays is a great help in covering household expenses. 

Currently, she will buy merchandise with a loan since she wants to bolster her inventory by purchasing soft drinks, juices and bread. These products will help her to improve her service to her customers.

Her objective is, through loans, to be able to expand her business and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, juices and bread for her business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia, a widow taking care of three children, runs a mini-cold store in her house in Abura. The fridge is stocked with a variety of fresh fish and meat. Cecilia will use this loan to purchase more fish and meat to sell, and plans to reinvest in her enterprise the new profits arising from her expanded operation.

loans.use: to purchase varieties of fish and meat to sell.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en: Dalal is a 50-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three school-aged children. She has established a computer business to help provide various types of reports and computer programs to members from her community and different companies. She is a relatively new business owner; she started her business operation two years ago. Today, she is requesting to borrow 2,000 USD from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more equipment for her shop in order to build a larger clientele who are in need of computer services. In the future, Dalal looks for things to add that are of value so that her business can expand. This will be her second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for her shop in order to build a large clientele who are in need of computer services

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 38 years old and is married with seven children.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like soft drinks, snack foods and other miscellaneous items to sell.

Mary Jane has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending and motorcycle transport.

Mary Jane aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as soft drinks, snack foods and other miscellaneous items to sell.

loans.name: Sango Fellowship Group
loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase machines and materilas

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro, tiene la edad  de 25 años, está casado y vive con su padres actualmente. El con el crédito va comprar los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal. El cuenta con el terreno ya sembrado y en producción, la plantación este año necesita algunas mejorar para poder cosechar el café en mejores condiciones y dar más rendimiento en cantidad por lo cual le hará esta asistencia. El quiere seguir adelante con el proyecto cafetalero y es por eso que lo asistirá de esta forma. El tienen como meta aumentar la producción de café y generar el máximo de las ganancias para su bienestar familiar y el propio.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 25 years old, he is married and currently lives with his parents. 

He is asking for a loan to buy supplies in order to care for his coffee plantation. The land is already planted and in production. The plantation this year needs some improvement in order to be able to harvest the coffee in best conditions and to give more production in quantity which is why the assistance will help him. He wants to continue forward with the coffee-growing project and this is why in this way it will help him. 

His goal is to increase the production of coffee and to generate the maximum earnings for his welfare, and that of his family. It is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had loans previously with state-owned banks, but FUDECOSUR has made the process easier and the rate of interest in much lower.

loans.use: to buy supplies in order to care for his coffee plantation

loans.name: Antonia Group

texts.en: Antonia is 61 years old and lives in Tinago, Ozamis City, Misamis Occdiental. She is married, has four grown children and earns a living by selling canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles and other items to her customers. She has been in this line of work for four years and is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more items to sell. She joined PMPC last year as a way to expand her business. She also leads a two-person loan group. Although they borrow as a group, each member has her own business

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: La señora Simona vive con su hija,  en casa propia,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida hace varios años, desde tempranas horas de la mañana hasta  las 16:00,  la cliente prepara su comida para la venta en su domicilio y vende en el mercado de la misma zona donde ella vive,  gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo la cliente pudo adquirir su propia vivienda, el crédito esta destinado a la compra de un frízer grande para poder ampliar mas su negocio así también la cliente invertirá en capital de trabajo, de esta manera la cliente podrá generar mayores ingresos y poder terminar de construir su vivienda, es una persona muy amable y muy buena se siente agradecida con  la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que gracias a su apoyo sacara adelante su negocio mejorando asi su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Simona lives in her own home with her daughter. For the past several years, she has been selling food beginning in the early morning hours until 4pm. Simona prepares the food at home and then sells it at the market in the area where she lives. Thanks to the effort she puts forth in her work, Simona has been able to acquire her own home.

This loan will be used to buy a large freezer so that she can increase her business. Simona also wants to invest in operating capital so that she can generate more income and finish the construction of her house. She is a friendly and good-natured person who is grateful for the support Emprender has provided. Thanks to this assistance, Simona has been able to move forward so that she can improve her business and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a large freezer.

loans.name: Santa Rosita - El Tambo Group

texts.es:
La Sr. LUISA FRANCISCA de 37 años de edad madre soltera con 01 hijo menor de edad  de 11 años en etapa escolar, mujer luchadora  con los ánimos de salir adelante. Es socias de la  alcancía comunal “Santa Rosita – El Tambo”.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de ropas vestidos para niños y adultos en su tienda comercial alquilada. El préstamo solicito para poder invertir en su negocio en comprar ropas vestidos para niños y adultos. La clienta Desea para el futuro comprar su propio Local en un centro comercial. La Sra. LUISA FRANCISCA se encuentra ubicada en la fotografía en la segunda persona, se encuentra en la parte derecha vestida con chompa color rosada y un pantalón color azul con rayas color celeste.  Las personas de parte superior de la fotografía son la Sra. Roció Sonia y la Sra. Roció Pilar se faltaron por motivo de salud.
texts.en:
Luisa Francisca, age 37, is a single mother of one 11-year-old. She is a hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead. She is a member of the “Santa Rosita – El Tambo” communal bank.
She sells clothing for adults and children in a store which she rents. She is requesting this loan to invest in her business through the purchase of clothing to sell. She wants to buy her own store in a shopping center in the future. She appears in the photo second from the right in the pink sweater. The people in the upper part of the photograph are Rocio Sonia and Rocio Pilar, who could not be present due to health reasons.

loans.use: to sell clothing.

loans.name: Veng

texts.en:
Veng, 50, is married and resides in Kampong Chnang Province. Veng sells groceries and her husband raises pigs.
 
Veng is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase piglets to raise for sale. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business of raising more pigs. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise for sale.

loans.name: Aurora Del Carmen

texts.es: Aurora, está decidida a continuar trabajando con préstamos para darle un buen mantenimiento a su granja, en esta ocasión comprará concentrado por quintales para mantener almacenado y poder al alimentar a su gallinas, esto le ayudará para tener disponible la cantidad suficiente de concentrado y alimentar a su granja en los siguientes meses. El préstamo anterior le ayudó para construir una galera con cerca para la misma granja, siendo un gran aporte para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en: Aurora has decided to continue to apply for loans to properly run her farm. This time she will buy and store concentrated feed for her chickens, helping her to keep a sufficient amount of feed at the farm in the coming months. The previous loan helped her to build a fenced henhouse at her farm, which was a major contribution to the improvement of her business.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es: Lina, de 68 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy perseverante, esta casada y es madre de dos hijos a quienes crió y educó, hoy son independientes. Ahora ella vive a lado de Gildebrando de 77 años, quien acompaño en su vida y vivió momentos felices, tienen una casa propia en donde a diario trabajan mucho para así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. La tienda de Lina es una de las mas concurridas de su calle, es que ella a diario desde muy temprano sale al mercado en busca de las verduras mas frescas y los pollos mas gordos para vender en su tienda, es por eso que sus clientes siempre van, ya que tiene lo primordial para la comida. Asimismo vende bebidas gaseosas y también cervezas, para el cual éste último productos tiene mucho cuidado ya que solo vende a mayores de edad, Su negocio esta ubicado en su misma casa y siempre esta ahí esperando a sus clientes como hace 20 años como cuando inicio y siempre con una sonrrisa atiende a las personas quienes la quieren mucho. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, se divierte y la pasa muy bien, cuando empezó a trabajar tuvo algunos altibajos pero con bastante empeño pudo superarlo. Tiene muchas metas, pero lo que más prioriza es ampliar su tienda y así ofrecer mayor variedad de productos. Este será el crédito número 18 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal del cual ella tiene el gusto de decir que es fundadora y aportar a que todos sus integrantes sean personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 2,000 soles, comprará más mercadería y productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, además de invertir en andamios para poder ordenar mejor lo que ofrece.
texts.en:
Lina, age 68, is a very good, kind, and perseverant woman.  She is married, and she has two children who she raised and educated.  They are now independent.  She lives by the side of 77 year old Gildebrando, her life companion with whom she has had happy experiences.

Lina’s store is one of the busiest on the street.  Starting very early every day she goes to the market looking for the freshest vegetables and the fattest chickens to sell in her store.  That is why her customers always come, because she has the essentials for meals.

She also sells soft drinks and beer.  She is very careful to only sell beer to adults. Her business is located in her house.  She is always there waiting for her customers just like she did 20 years ago when she started.  She always has a smile when she waits on people, and they are very fond of her.

She likes her work a lot.  It is fun, and she has a very good time.  When she started working she had some ups and downs.  However, she was able to overcome them with a lot of determination.  She has a lot of goals, but her biggest priority is to expand her store and offer a greater variety of products.

This will be her 18th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support.  This way she will feel more secure about advancing in her work.  She once more pledges to make her payments on time as she has done with the previous loans she has had.

She is pleased to be part of her communal bank.  She has the pleasure of saying she is the founder, and the members are all responsible and supportive people.  She will use the requested 2,000 soles to buy more products to offer her customers.  She will also buy shelving in order to be able to better organize what she sells.

loans.use: to buy more products and shelving.

loans.name: Dambe Group

texts.fr:
Dambé est un regroupement de femmes de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 2 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels  les légumes, les tissus, les friperies, et les produits cosmétiques. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a deux ans. Elles sont à leur quatrième   prêt de groupe. 
Habi est un membre du groupe Dambé qui vend de la friperie, elle est habillée en blanc en face de sa tasse de friperie.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, deux balles de friperie. Elle se procure  de ses  produits à Koutiala et Sikasso auprès des grossistes. Elle vend ses articles en détail et au comptant au marché de Koutiala, en ambulant à une clientèle diverse et variée, elle est très sollicitée. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Dambé comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 260.000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Habi compte réaliser 290.000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce. .
texts.en:
Dambé is a group of women from Koutiala who know each other well. They live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. They are on average 31 years old, married, and have at least two children.  

This group of women sells various items such as vegetables, fabric, second-hand clothing and cosmetics. To increase the size of their businesses, the members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program two years ago. They are currently on their fourth group loan. 

Habi is a member of Dambé who sells second-hand clothes. In the photo, she is dressed in white and seated facing her basket of second-hand clothes. 

She plans to use the loan to buy two packages of second-hand clothing. She buys her products in Koutiala and Skiasso from wholesalers. She sells her items on a retail basis for cash on the street and at the Koutiala market, to a diverse and varied clientele. She is in very high demand. 

While the other Dambé group members expect to make an average profit of 260,000 francs CFA each during this loan cycle, Habi expects to earn 290,000 francs CFA. 

In addition to loan repayment, they use a portion of their income for personal expenses and to grow their businesses.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Antokia Group

texts.en:
Merina, who is in her late 30s, is married with three children; two of them go to school,  She has had been selling food for about three years now.  She works  from 6.00 am to 8.00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Merina's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a sack of rice, maize flour, wheat flour, some kilos of sugar, beans and she paid school fees.  She has repaid all her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to increase chairs, a set of plates and repair her restaurant.  Her dream is to one day be able to open a big restaurant.

She will share this loan with her loan group “Antokia” which has a total of 13 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy  chairs, a set of plates and repair restaurant.

loans.name: Djantoyerela 3 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe DJANTOYERELA 3  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  32 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KALAKAN, commune de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: le riz, l’arachide, de gombo et le mais avec TENIMBA la personne à droite sur la photo. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 4 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 240 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et frais de labours pour la campagne agricole.

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en: Kareem was born in 1980. He is married and lives with his 2 children and his wife at a sector in Jordan called Baqaa. ‎Kareem is working in drug store but his income doesn’t enough to cover all his family expense, so he decided to open his ‎own business which is Water treatment plant. He started his project with a small amount of money. This business is ‎changing his life and improve it also he could buy a house and lives in, he is so happy of his business and now he wants to ‎expand his business and develop it more, therefore he applied for a loan to help him make a good promotion for his ‎business to attract more customers so increase his incomes, which will help him support his children financially, and insure ‎a good future for them.‎

loans.use: to help him make a good promotion for his ‎business to attract more customers so increase his incomes

loans.name: Laufai

texts.en:
Laufai is a 29 year old woman, married with 3 children. Her husband like her has always been unemployed and the family has depended on relatives for financial support for things such as educating the children. 
Her business is a taro plantation. She is now selling 50 bundles of taro at USD 7 each per week and earns USD 300 per week. Previous loans from SPBD have been used to build up the plantation to a level where she is now able to use some of the income for school fees.

loans.use: Purchase fertiler, weed killer, equipment

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Berkie is 50 years old and a mother of 7 children. She has a basic education. Her trade is the processing of oil palm fruits and kernels for sale. She supplies the finished product to specific customers who use them in the manufacture of local soap. She intends to use a KIVA loan to purchase more kernels since the rains would begin in this part of the country.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Irma Suyapa

texts.en:
My name is Irma R. and I make a living selling cosmetics such as creams, perfumes and deodorants. I've been doing this for a year now ,ever since I lost my job and had a hard time finding a new employment, because it's hard to find work in my city. My goal now is to buy more products, so I can sell more and in the future have my own store, but more importantly, so that I can feed my family.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Mi nombre es Irma R. me dedico a la venta de cosmeticos para dama como ser cremas, perfumes, desodorantes, actividad que realizo hace 1 año ya que perdi mi trabajo anterior y en nuestra ciudad es dificil conseguir un trabajo en una empresa, mi meta es poder tener muchos productos para tener una mayor venta y asi poder en un futuro tener una tienda de cosmeticos, y lo mas importante alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: purchasing lotions, creams, deodorants, perfumes

loans.name: Zipporah Nchang

texts.en:
Born in 1959, N. Zipporah Nchang is married and is the mother of five children. She suffered from a sickness which required two surgeries which left her bankrupt. This made it difficult for her to invest in the business she was operating. She decided to contact GHAPE for help. After becoming a member, she was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. She obtained two loans to invest in her existing business and raised money to buy a sewing machine.

Given a loan of $500, she plans to sew and sell dresses as well as sell food items. Her profits will go towards buying a plot and paying school fees for her children. She plans to repay the loan in 18 months. The first installment will be made four months from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase food items and cloth

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza works selling clothing on credit, and her husband installs gas meters. Their home is located in the zone called Nueva Potosi, in the city of La Paz. This is the first time she has requested a loan. The money will be used to cover medical costs for her husband, who hurt his ankle in an accident and has to be in a cast during his recovery. It's important to emphasize that her husband is not healthy, and the financial situation of the family could be at risk. It for this reason that IMPRO supports this loan. Her work makes her eligible for this credit because she already has experience in her business.

Maritza se dedica a la venta de ropa a crédito y su esposo realiza instalación de medidores de gas. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona villa Nueva Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado para la curación médica de su esposo ya que tuvo un accidente del tobillo y tiene que ser enyesado para su recuperación. Es importante recalcar que si el esposo no sana, la situación financiera de la familia podría estar en riesgo; por esta razón es que IMPRO apoya a este crédito. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: She needs help covering the medical costs for her husband after his accident.  The financial well being of the family is at risk.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
For the past 24 years, Juana and her husband have been running a small saddlery business from a workshop in their home in Ayacucho, Perú. While her husband crafts exquisite leather saddles, Juana fashions the blinders and bits from leather and silver. As a young boy, Juana’s husband learned this craft, and when they got married, Juana began to learn as well. Every piece is handcrafted and the melting and molding is done with the wooden stove in the workshop. Located in the hills of Ayacucho, they have many customers, as horses and donkeys are a principal method of cargo transportation between city and country. All their work is done on a contract basis, filling orders as they arrive.

As a professional goal, Juana says she and her husband would love to one day open a store and workshop outside of their home. On a more personal note, Juana also plans to use the profits she has been saving in the bank to facilitate a university education for all four of her children and eventually construct a house of her own, as the one in which they currently live is rented. For all these reasons, Juana is very grateful to have been a part of her village bank for the past 13 years. It has been of immense help, she explains, teaching her how to save and assisting her in the realization of her many goals. Juana is requesting a loan of $800, with which she and her husband will buy leather to fashion and old coins to be melted and molded.

loans.use: Buy leather to fashion saddles and old coins to be melted and molded into blinders and bits.

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Roeun, 36, and her husband, Mr. Tek Khen, 37, have been married since 1991. They have five children, three sons and two daughters. All of their children are studying in local schools. Roeun’s home is about twenty five kilometers from Phnom Penh. Roeun has been a silk weaver since 1991. It's a skill she learned from her neighbor. Her husband is selling mosquito nets, cotton scarfs, and cloth on his motorbike from village to village. They both work hard to support all of their children to study to as high a level as possible.

Roeun is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $1,000. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and to pay for the preparation of her loom. Some of the amount will also be used for expanding her husband’s business of selling mosquito net, cotton scarfs, and cloth.

loans.use: Buy silk materials; prepare loom for weaving; and purchase mosquito nets, cotton scarfs, and cloth for reselling.

loans.name: Petnonela's Mwangaza Group

texts.en:
Petnonela, age 35, is a widow and takes care of her 3 children (ages 10, 8, and 4). She owns a shop, where she sells general items. She started this business in 2006 and now makes a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales. She works from 6am to 7pm daily.

Petnonela took out a previous loan to buy items for her shop. She now hopes to do this again. She will share the loan with Suwa, a member in her loan group, who has a charcoal store.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her general store

loans.name: Nora Bertha

texts.en:
I have had my business for 6 years. This is the source of income for my family. The business is comprised of selling new and used clothing in different areas in the city of Nuevo Laredo. I want to invest more into the business such as purchasing electronic devices and more merchandise. I request a loan of US$1,000 to purchase additional merchandise and electronic devices for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 6 años con el negocio. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia. El negocio es la venta de ropa usada y nueva yo vendo en diferentes partes de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Quiero invertirle más al negocio como aparatos electrónicos y más mercancía. Solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls, para la comprar de mercancía y aparatos electrónicos para tener más mercancía en el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and electronic devices

loans.name: Koubouratou

texts.fr:
Born March 17th, 1969 in Cotonou, Mrs. Koubouratou Y. is married and mother of two children who she supports. Since she was a little girl, she has been doing business with her mother and learning basic business techniques. About ten years ago she began her own business in Suru-Lere, a working-class suburb of Cotonou. Her area is well patronized because it is located on the road to the main market Dangokpa; demand is so high her stock can’t meet it. She is therefore seeking a loan to build her supply in order to meet customer demand. 
Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.
Née le 17 mars 1969 à COTONOU, dame Y. Koubouratou est mariée et mère de 2 enfants à charge. Depuis qu’elle était toute petite, elle faisait déjà le commerce avec sa maman avec qui elle a appris les techniques de base du commerce. Il y a environ une dizaine années déjà qu’elle s’est installée pour son propre compte à SURU- LERE un quartier populaire de COTONOU. Le lieu d’activité étant bien achalandé parce que se situant sur l’axe du grand marché DANTOKPA, la demande est très forte alors que les produits en stocks ne couvrent pas cette demande. Elle sollicite alors ce crédit pour s’approvisionner afin de répondre à la demande de la clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 20 sacks of wheat flour and 12 sacks of rice

loans.name: Brenda

texts.es:
Brenda, a native of the "municipio" of Condega, is married and has two children, one of whom is school-aged. For ten years, she has made a living making and selling tortillas, having her own shop in her house in Condega. Despite her house being in bad shape, she has decided to invest in rebuilding it and also in remodeling the shop where she makes tortillas. It's for this reason that she has applied to Ceprodel for a loan that will allow her to buy construction materials for starting work on the project.

It's important to stress that Ceprodel loans have benefited this lady and that she and her dear children who, more than ever, need their mother's support, will continue benefiting from them.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Brenda G. originaria del municipio de Condega es casada, con dos hijos de los cuales uno de ellos se encuentra en la edad escolar. Desde hace diez años se dedica al negocio de la elaboración y venta de tortillas teniendo su propio establecimiento en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Condega. A pesar de que su vivienda se encuentra en mal estado con mala infraestructura, ella ha decidido invertir para la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación y además le es de mucha necesidad remodelar el local donde elabora las tortillas. Es por esta razón que ella acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita adquirir el recurso económico para la compra de los materiales de construcción para iniciar con esta labor.

Es necesario recalcar que por medio de los créditos otorgados por Ceprodel ha esta dama serán beneficiados tanto su negocio, ella y sus queridos hijos que hoy mas que nunca necesitan del apoyo de su mamá.

loans.use: Buy construction materials.

loans.name: Yesenia De Los Angel

texts.es:
Yessnia is a young24-year old lady who has a significant other, two children and another one on its way. Her companion is an office receptionist who supports the family's finances. Yessenia is a security guard and works at the local mall. She has been a security guard for two years. The loan she requests is to replace the zinc and wooden planks in her bedroom, this will help improve the lifestyle of her three little kids.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Yessenia es una joven mujer de 24 años, es acompañada y tiene 2 hijos y uno más que viene en camino. Su compañero de vida es oficinista y apoya en los gastos familiares. Yessenia se dedica a la vigilancia y trabaja en un centro comercial de la ciudad, como guarda de seguridad, tiene 2 años de dedicarse a este oficio. El préstamo lo solicita para cambair el zinc y unas piezas de madera en su casa de habitación, ya que quiere mejorar la calidad de vida para sus tres pequeños hijos.

loans.use: Change wood and zinc from her home

loans.name: Bimala

texts.en:
Mrs. Bimala A. lives with her husband daughter in Bhatkepati Village.  The majority of people in this village are engaged in farming. Her husband, Mr. Rabi A., is a taxi driver and her daughter is in 8th grade.
Mrs. Adhikari opened a poultry farm three years ago to improve the standard of living for her family. She sells chicken to the retailers.  She is requesting a Rs 20000.00 loan to buy expand her business by purchasing small chickens to raise. She wants to use her income to provide a better education for her daughter because the cost of education is very high in Nepal.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with three sons. She supports the essential needs of her household by running a small business selling household items and clothing merchandise in the busy city market in Berdyansk. Currently, Tatyana has about $3000 of working capital in her business and her income amounts to $2,000.

Tatyana is very patient and polite. Her commitment to good business and her natural friendliness attract many potential clients. A variety of quality products also makes her kiosk a popular stop for passing customers. Tatyana continues to work hard investing her time and efforts in the growth of her business. She has been in this trade for 7 years and her business is continuously expanding. Tatyana is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to purchase assorted merchandise at good wholesale prices. This loan will help to significantly boost Tatyana's revenue and grow her business, further improving the quality of life for her and her family.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: To purchase assorted merchandise

loans.name: José Oswaldo

texts.es:
Jose is a married 20 year old man who lives n barrio 380. His wife is a homemaker. Jose works for a private company as a sales representative, a position that he has held for one year. His wife is pregnant with their first child, which will be born in a few months. For this reason, Jose would like to build onto his home to improve their quality of life for the new baby. With the money that he is requesting, he will build a room onto their home so that they can be more comfortable. In the future, Jose would like to save enough money to open a beauty salon that his wife would run.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

José tiene 20 años de edad, habita en el barrio 380, es casado, su esposa es ama de casa. Don José trabaja en una empresa privada desempeñándose como ejecutivo de ventas tiene un año de estar laborando. La esposa de José está embarazada su bebé nacerá en pocos meses, por lo que desea construir su hogar para darle mejor calidad de vida a su bebé. Con el dinero que está solicitando es para hacer un cuarto en su vivienda para estar más cómodos. Desea en un futuro reunir capital para poner un salón de belleza para que lo administre su esposa.

loans.use: Construction of a room.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina N. is 40 years old and the mother of three children. Her children are currently in school. To support her household, she has been preparing foods like gari and beans as we call it, with fried ripe plantain to serve loyal customers in the neighborhood.

Gari and beans are eaten both in the morning and in the afternoon and Georgina has been doing this business for the past 3 years; she says selling of this food is very nutritious and very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her make good income to support her family. Georgina is a member of the group called Amazing Grace Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like plantains, gari and beans

loans.name: Fali

texts.fr: Fali V. est revendeuse de tubercules d’ignames à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle exerce cette activité depuis bientôt 3 ans. Agée de 45 ans, Fali est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Pour éviter les ruptures de stocks et mieux satisfaire la clientèle, Fali souhaite avec ce crédit acheter des ignames dans les villages environnants et aussi louer un magasin pour le stockage de ses marchandises. Cette chance lui permettra de mieux gagner sa vie
texts.en:
Fali V. sells yams in Danyi, a village about 175 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She has done this for nearly three years. Fali, aged 45, is married and has four children. To avoid stock shortages and better serve her clientele, Fali wants to use this loan to buy yams in nearby villages and rent a storehouse for the yams. This opportunity will allow her to better earn her living.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yams to sell and also rent a storehouse

loans.name: Caty Liz

texts.es:
Caty es socia del Banco Comunal San Gabriel.
Caty es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo de 4 meses.
Caty tiene su negocio de venta de cosméticos, empezó con este negocio hace ya 2 años y medio, ella  reparte los productos que le piden a través de su catálogo. 
Caty necesita un préstamo de 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de sus productos de belleza para tener un stock.
Caty sueña con construir su casa y ser independiente más adelante..
texts.en:
Caty is a member of the communal bank San Gabriel. Caty has partner, is 23 years old and one son of 4 months. Caty owns her own cosmetics business. He started this business 2 and a half years ago. She delivers products that are purchased by catalog. Caty needs a loan of $150 USD which she will use to purchase her beauty products in order to have good stock. Caty hopes to build a home and eventually become independent.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock beauty products

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia S. is a 24-year-old married woman with two kids. For the past four years, Afia has been making a living through trading. She owns and operates a jewelry shop in her community. She sells earrings, necklaces, wristwatches etc. and supports her family with income from this business.

With the loan, She wants to increase her working capital to enable her purchase high quality jewelry products to serve her loyal customers during this festive seasons. She believes that she will generate additional income to improve her family's living conditions. She is a member of a group known as the "Abrabopa" (translated, Good life)Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans. She was in attendance during her group meeting when her photograph was taken.

loans.use: To purchase more earrings, necklaces, wristwatches etc.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca inició el negocio porqué siempre le ha gustado el comercio, además de que por donde vive no había quien vendiera verduras lo cual la motivó a empezar a venderlas y poco a poco ha ido agregando más productos. Comenzó  en Agosto de 1992,  a vender verduras desde que llego a su actual domicilio, posteriormente abrió una tiendita, pero por cuestiones de una enfermedad tuvo que cerrarla y quedarse solamente con el negocio de las verduras. Hoy en día de nuevo ha comenzado a levantar su tiendita y ya la tiene más surtida.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $5,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas  para comprar más verduras y abarrotes que le permitan tener bien surtida su tienda para este mes de diciembre en que las ventas aumentan por motivo de las fiestas navideñas.
texts.en:
Francisca started her business because she has always liked commerce. Also, because in the area that she lives there was no one that sells any produce and that motivated her to start selling it and slowly, she has been adding more products. She started selling produce on August 1992 as soon as she arrived at her current address. Lately, she opened a small shop but due to health reasons, she had to close it and only stayed with the produce business. Today, she has started again to build up her small shop and provide it with more assorted products.

She needs a $375 loan to buy more produce and groceries that will allow her to keep the shop with a good assortment of products during the month of December when the sales increase due to the holiday festivities.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A. is forty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to six children – all boys. Almost all her children are out of school. The last born has yet to complete junior high school. She lives together with some of her children and her husband in Offinso, a business and farming community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Akua’s husband is a farmer as well as a sewing machine repairer in their community. Akua works to help her husband provide for the family. She is a fish monger and also sells vegetables on a small table top. She sells in a shed in the local market square. She procures her goods from big-time fish mongers in Kumasi who sell at wholesale prices.

Akua has been in business for two years. According to Akua, most of her customers are food vendors and households in her community. With the loan,she wants to purchase tilapia and other fish in bulk on a visit to the big towns to reduce frequent travel. This, she also believes, would enable her to save more money to pay for the education of her last born.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish and tilapia

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La señora Brígida es socia del Banco Comunal “03 de Mayo”, de Crusani, distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 45 años de edad, es madre viuda con 04 hijos y posee estudios de tercero de secundaría (incompleta). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 06 años, se dedica a la venta de golosinas, gaseosas y pan por las tardes; su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mercadería para su negocio (golosinas variadas). 
Con este préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales; podrá mejorar su negocio y adquirir mercadería surtida al por mayor y de esta manera surtir aun mas su negocio.  Su anhelo es ver a sus hijos profesionales, por ello viene ahorrando sus dinero, con ello garantizará el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Brígida is a member of the "03 de Mayo" Communal Bank, from Crusani, the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao in the Puno area. She is a 45-year-old widow with 4 children and completed three years of high school. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 6 years. She sells sweets, soft drinks and bread in the afternoons. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, with which she acquired merchandise for her business (assorted sweets). With this loan of 1500 nuevos soles, she agrees to commit to paying in 5 monthly payments. She will be able to improve her business and acquire assorted merchandise wholesale and in this way diversify her business even more. Her wish is to see her children become professionals, and for that she is saving her money and will guarantee her children's future.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her business and acquire assorted merchandise wholesale and in this way diversify her business even more. Her wish is to see her children become professionals, and for that she is saving her money and will guarantee her children's future.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
A mother of six, Rhoda B. is 39 years old. She is married to Moisses B. and lives in Anito, Mambajao, Camiguin Province in Southern Philippines. She engages in buying and selling ready to wear (RTW) clothes. She purchases clothes and sells them with a low percentage of income. Every day, she works hard to meet the needs of the family but their income is not enough.

Now she needs an amount of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional clothes and earn a higher income. This will be her first loan with Kiva's partner HSPFI and, if granted, this will be a big help for them to have a good living.

loans.use: To purchase ready to wear (RTW) clothes to sell

loans.name: Lucrecia Margarita

texts.es:
En el Mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León la señora Lucrecia Q. se dedica con esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de cosmético siendo vendidos por ella misma en su localidad diariamente.

Sus inicios fueron muy duros porque estudiaba por las tardes y por las mañanas trabajaba con su mamá en la venta de cosas de horno siendo esta su labor cotidiana hasta que decidió afirmar un negocio el cual es el de venta de cosméticos. La razón por la que espera en Ceprodel es porque ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de los cosméticos para ofertarlos en su local.
texts.en:
In the "La Terminal" market of the city of León, Lucrecia Q. works at at her cosmetics sales business, selling her products herself every day from her stall. It was very difficult for her initially because she was studying in the evenings and working with her mother in the mornings selling items made of horn. This was her day's work until she decided to open her cosmetics sales business. She is asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy cosmetics to retail at her stall in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: John

texts.en: John E. is married with 3 children and has received an education through commercial school. John is a trader who sells eggs in Eguase near Cape Coast, which he has done since 2007. His wife also works as a trader in the Cape Coast area. John uses his income to pay for school fees, rent and utilities. John will use the loan to purchase more eggs which he will use for selling. With the new profits from his expanded business, John plans to build a house for his family.

loans.use: John will use the loan to purchase more eggs which he will use for selling.

loans.name: Amudat

texts.en: Amudat sells clothes and sachet water in her shop. Amudat is 45 years old, married, and has 2 children. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN100, 000 ($700 US). This loan will help her to purchase more clothes and sachet water to sell. She is indeed grateful to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and sachet water for her shop.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is 46 years old and is married to Apolinario, who is a simple farmer in their village. They are blessed with three children. The eldest is Alejandre, now 27 years old and a college graduate, he is followed by Alexander who is 23 years old also a vocational graduate and now working as Technician, finally their youngest, Shamiya is 21 years old. Through hard work the couple has been able to sustain their daily needs and support their children through school.

Sherlita is engaged in hog raising and vending business. According to her, the business she manages needs additional working capital so that she may expand it. She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 and she hopes that through this loan, she will someday convert both of her businesses into profitable ones.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr: A. Pierrette est âgée de cinquante et un (51) ans. Pierrette est née à SAKETE un village du Département du PLATEAU dans le Sud BENIN. Pierrette est mariée à BOURAÏMA Fachinan un employé du service des Travaux Publics du Bénin. Pierrette et Fachinan ont quatre enfants: trois garçons et une fille, tous majeurs. Pierrette vit à Yénawa, un quartier de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin dans la maison de son petit frère où elle exerce son activité. Pierrette vend à manger(riz, haricot, pâte de maïs, pâte de farine de manioc et pâte de causette d'igname). Pierrette a déjà eu quatre crédits avec ALIDé. Pierrette a bien remboursé ses crédits et a pu amener son activité à un stade supérieur avec. Pour pouvoir continuer de développer son activité et de mieux servir sa clientèle, Pierrette sollicite un cinquième crédit de la part de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Pierrette is 51 years old and was born in SAKETE, a village of PLATEAU County, in southern Benin. She is married to BOURAÏMA Fachinan, an employee in the public works service of Benin. Pierrette and Fachinan have four children: 3 boys and a girl, all of age. Pierrette lives in Yénawa, a district of the city of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, in a house belonging to her younger brother. There, she operates her business selling cooked food (rice, beans, cornmeal mash, cassava mash, and yam chips mash). She has already had four loans with Alidé and has repaid them. She was thus able to raise her business to a higher level. To be able to continue developing her business and to serve her customers better, she’s requesting a fifth loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a 50-kg sack of corn, a 50-kg sack of rice, a 25-kg sack of beans, and some firewood

loans.name: Colonia De Los Vasquez Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:  Clara del Socorro P. González, María Damaris C. y Carlos José Martínez.

Doña Clara del Socorro se dedica a la elaboración de calzado, en su casa tiene un pequeño taller con dos trabajadores, ella vende su producción en el mercado de Masaya a tiendas que le compran al por mayor. Tiene experiencia de varios años en este negocio, ella ofrece zapatos de varón y sandalias de mujer, con el crédito compró pega, cuero, suelas, etc.
Tiene cuatro hijos ya grandes que ayudan en el taller, ellos estudian y trabajan, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Sueña con mejorar su taller para trabajar bien en el invierno.

Doña María Damaris C., es una madre joven con dos hijos aun adolescentes, ellos estudian en la escuela cerca de su casa, ella sueña con verlos terminar sus estudios y mejorar la casita.
Se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya donde tiene muchos clientes, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde muy joven y conoce muy bien este negocio. Su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

Don Carlos José vende perecederos en el mercado Oriental de Managua, tiene más de cinco años de dedicarse a esta actividad que la aprendió de su madre, él se dedica a esta actividad desde que se casó. Trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas y regresa en horas de la tarde para realizar compras. Su esposa trabaja junto con el, tiene un hijo pequeño que estudia en la escuela de la comarca.

Viven en condiciones de vida humildes, llegaron a trabajar con Adim por una promoción que se hizo en la comarca y les gustó la forma de trabajar porque ellas no tienen garantías que dar para un crédito y en Adim se les dio confianza.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: Clara del Socorro P. González, María Damaris C. y Carlos José Martínez. Clara del Socorro is dedicated to making shoes. She has a small workshop in her home and two workers. She sells her product in the Masaya market to shops who buy at wholesale prices. She has various years' experience in this business. She offers shoes to men and sandals to women. With the loan, she bought paste, leather, soles, etc. She has four adult children who help her in the shop. They study and work. Her husband helps her with the bills. She dreams of improving her workshop so she can work well in the winter. María Damaris C. is a young mother with two adolescent children. They study at a school close to their house. She dreams of seeing them finish their studies and to improve their little house. She is dedicated to selling fruit and produce in the Masaya market where she has many customers. She has been dedicated to this type of work from a young age and knows this business well. Her husband helps her with the bills. Carlos José sells perishable items in the Managua East market. He has been dedicated to this activity, which he learned from his mother, for more than five years. He has done this work since he married. He works every day from the early hours and returns in the afternoon hours to make purchases. His wife works alongside him. He has a small son who studies in the area's school. They live in humble living conditions. They came to work with Adim due to a promotion made in the region and they liked this form of working because they had no guarantees that they would be given a loan but Adim trusted them.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits at wholesale price to sell at retail and purchase materials to make shoes.

loans.name: God Is Wonderful Group

texts.en:
Doris is a hairdresser by profession. Her salon is in her community. She is 24 years old, married and has a son. Doris is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘God is wonderful’. In the group photograph, Doris is first on the right wearing a cap.

Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and/or farmers. They work to help their spouses provide for their families. They buy their raw materials, wares or goods from other towns, and sometimes from nearby communities, and sell at the local market square. Some of them trek to other towns to sell on their market days as well. The members have been in business for some time and have amassed a great deal of experience in their businesses. They are asking for this loan to help them procure more goods to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a member of the Ushirikiano borrower group in Kola, Mororgoro. She is 34 years old, married and mother of two children. Her children are ages 9 and 6.

Judith started her own café business selling food six years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 120,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Judith’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more rice, wheat, sugar to grow her business. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Judith hopes to save money, get more food for her family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy rice, wheat and sugar

loans.name: Reina Leonor

texts.es: Reina Leonor G. M. 34 años de edad reside en Cojutepeque municipio de Cuscatlán. Reina vive con su esposo quien trabaja como comerciante y sus dos hijos menores de edad, y estudiantes. Reina posee su negocio hace diez años es una venta de frutas y boquitas ubicada a los alrededores del Instituto Escolar Nacional de la zona, donde en su mayoría los clientes son los estudiantes, el crédito que solicita Reina es para comprar de su mercadería al por mayor, logrando de esa manera obtener un margen mayor de ganancia, lo que le permitirá mejorar la vida económica de los suyos.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn S. is a 39-year-old mother of three kids. Her eldest is 15 years old. Her dreams for her children are for them to grow into responsible people and be able to pursue college degrees in the future. Her business is rice farming. She grows rice and earns enough to feed and clothe her family well. 

She requested a loan of Php 15,000 to buy farming materials. She will also use some of it to buy piglets and feed for her small piggery.

She said CEVI helps her small business to grow. It provides not just loans but education as well.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Felixberta

texts.en: Felixberta B. is from the village of Owaon. She is 52 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Felixberta owns and operates a business running a food stall, selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Felixberta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Felixberta is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital for her business. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
