Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en: Anabelle R. is from the village of Nailon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Anabelle owns and operates a "sari-sari" retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Anabelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Anabelle is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is 42 years old and is married to Ernesto, a retired soldier.  They have four children: Michael, 24 years old, college graduate; Mark, 21 years old, high school graduate; Mariel, 12 years old, first year high school and their youngest is Marvin, 8 years old, in grade 2. They live in the rural village of Alinam, Cauayan City, Isabela. 

Jasmin is engaged in beauty services.  She offers manicures, pedicures and hair cutting and she is able to earn a daily income of PHP20.00.  Their other source of income is from a motorcycle transport which is operated by her husband.  She wants to obtain a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 12,000.00 for additional requirements in her business, and for the education of their children. She hopes and prays that KIVA lenders will grant her loan in order for her to have a productive business.

loans.use: Additional capital for her beauty services

loans.name: Snguon

texts.en:
Mrs. Snguon S. is 51 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province. She has given birth to four children, who are married and live in their own homes. For many years, she has serviced her neighbors by grinding their rice for flour with her flouring machine. She typically earns a profit of approximately $4 a day.

Her husband, Phout Choum, is 53 years old. Since 2007, he's been making a living by repairing and washing vehicles at his home. He normally earns about $3 a day. Snguon S. has used her machine for a long time, and recently it has often broken during the processing.

Snguon S. would like a loan of $1200 in order to buy a new grinding machine.

loans.use: To buy a new grinding machine

loans.name: Battogtoh

texts.en:
Battogtoh S. is 29 years old and the father of 2 daughters. He lives with his wife and two daughters in Uvs province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. His oldest daughter is 9 years old and a first grade student at a local secondary school, while his other daughter is just 2 years old and stays at home.

Battogtoh drives a cab in the town, which he bought last year. In the winter, he sometimes works in local gold mining - a temporary job that gives some additional income for his family. Since he bought the taxi cab, he has been able to earn some income on a daily basis and contribute to his family's income. He says that he works hard to bring up their daughters and make sure that they get a good education and pursue their dream professions. He is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary motor accessories for his car to get it repaired well.

About XacBank:
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva's 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

loans.use: To purchase necessary repairs for his car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Estefania

texts.en:
Estefania D. is from the village of Capellan,Ilagan,Isabela. She is 54 years old, married, and has adult-aged children.

Estefania owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. With her vending business, she earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

Estefania joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her ninth loan taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
el sr. Juan Bautista F. R. tiene 47 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene 2 hijos.
Juan  tiene una pulperia en donde vende productos de la canasta basica familiar. 
 
este negocio opera desde el año 2003 hasta la fecha le a ido bien, de este negocio saca los gastos del hogar, ahora esta solicitando el credito para poder surtir mas su negocio ya que se a quedado con poco prodcuto y necesita comprar al por mayor para tener mayores ganancias.
la epoca de navidad fue buena en sus ventas y las ganancias que tuvo las invirtio hacer unas pequeñas remodelaciones a su casa.
necesita el credito para poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Bautista F. R. is 47 years old, and lives unmarried with his partner and their two sons. Juan owns a small store where he sells basic grocery items. This business has been open since 2003, and has done well since it began. From his business, Señor R. earns enough to cover his household expenses. He is now requesting a loan to help him develop his business further, since he currently has little merchandise left, and needs more money than he has in order to purchase products wholesale. The Christmas season was very good for his sales, and he put the earnings that he made toward making a few small remodels on his house. Señor R. needs this loan to be able to continue improving the success and well-being of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de tortillas, huevos, harina de maiz y trigo, leche, churros, cereal, condimentos, pan, galletas, pastas dentales, papel higienico, jabones, cloro, jabon en polvo.

loans.name: Remove

texts.es: REMOVE L.
texts.en:
Ms. Delfina Lucía Menchú Ordóñez is 32 years old. She is single and she is a craftswoman who produces typical fabrics. She has a workshop with two looms. She has spent 10 years producing typical fabrics in her home, located in the Chaquiral area, Quiaquix canton, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. Currently her clients' demand has grown, but her economic situation is not good enough for her to increase her capital, which is why she went to ASDIR association to ask for a L., with the intention of purchasing raw material and thus increasing her sales. She hopes to get ahead with her business and have better life conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Raw Materials

loans.name: Oisulov

texts.en:
I. Oisulov is 48 years old, married, has three children, and makes a living selling children's toys. She sells these items in a store she rents in a local market. Oisulov has run this business for five years, and has done well in part because she does not have many competitors. She has always dreamed of owning her own small store and not having to depend on anyone else. She believes that someday this will happen, but for now has  requested a loan for $1,500 to buy new goods to sell to her customers. Oisulov thanks everyone for supporting her and promises to repay this loan fully and on time. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother and make her dream come true.   
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which began soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and its lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have viable businesses. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new children's toys to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Kulshanbu Kanaeva`s Group

texts.ru:
Сарвар, 52, замужем. У нее 4 детей: 2  сына и 2 дочери. Старшие двое детей находятся на заработках в России. С родителями проживает только младший сын. Клиент и ее супруг занимаются разведением МРС, преимущественно коз. Кроме этого на своем участке они выращивают яблоки. В данное время у нее есть 10 коз и корова с теленком. Кредит будет использован для закупа 2 коз другой породы. 

Мехман, 53, замужем. Мать 5 детей. Самой младшей дочери 22 года. Супруг клиента помогает ей в бизнесе. Клиент закупает МРС на рынке, откармливает около 30 дней и перепродает с прибылью. У них есть 15 коз, корова и один теленок. Кредит будет использован для закупа 10 овец.

Кулшанбу является лидером этой группы. Она замужем и проживает со своей семьей в Кадамже. У нее 3 детей: 1 сын и две дочери. Клиент занимается торговлей продуктами питания с магазина который находится около ее дома. Кредит запрашивается для увеличения ассортимента товаров в магазине.

Гульнур 56 лет, вдова. У нее трое взрослых детей. Клиент работает поваром в столовой местной администрации, а также привозит с соседнего Узбекистана хлеб для реализации в своей столовой.  Кроме этого в своем доме она печет булочки и пирожки. Кредит нужен для закупа 2 мешков муки.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Kulshanbu is the leader of this group. She’s married and lives with her family in Kadamje. She has three children: one son and two daughters. She sells food products from a store, which is close to her home. She is asking for a loan in order to increase the variety of products in the store. Sarver, 52, is married. She has four children: two sons and two daughters. Her two eldest children work in Russia. Only her youngest son lives with her. Sarvar and her husband breed large and small cattle, mainly sheep. Additionally, they grow apples in their yard. Up to this day, they own ten sheep, a cow and her calf. The loan they receive will be used to buy two more sheep of a different breed. Mehman is fifty-three years old and a mother of five children. Her youngest daughter is twenty-two years old. Mehman is together in this business with her husband. They buy small or large cattle on the market, fatten it for about thirty days and resell it for profit. They have fifteen sheep, a cow and a calf. Their loan will be used to attain ten new sheep. Gulnur, 56, is a widow. She has three grown-up children. She works as a chef in the local administrative building. Additionally, she imports bread from adjacent Uzbekistan to sell in her kitchen. She also bakes pastries and rolls.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 goats

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La señora A., se traslada desde su comarca Monte Redondo donde vive hasta el  M. de la terminal tercera calle desde las 5:00am, con el objetivo de ofertar a su clientela la variedad de productos lácteos, finalizando su venta a las 2:00pm que es la hora que ingresa el ultimo vehículo en su comarca donde vive.
Este crédito que solicito es  para  incrementar su capital de trabajo y de esta manera ofertar producto de mejor calidad, además quiere aprovechar la temporada de semana santa que es la época donde se consume más el producto.
texts.en:
Starting at 5:00 a.m.,Mrs. A. travels from the Monte Redondo area where she lives to the market at the Third Street terminal, with the aim of offering her customers a variety of dairy products. She ends her sales at 2:00 p.m., when the last vehicle goes to the district where she lives. The loan she is requesting is to increase her working capital, so that she can offer higher-quality products. In addition, she would like to take advantage of the Easter season, which is a time when more of these products are consumed.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hard cheese, farmer's cheese and clotted cream

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 56 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo, que tiene como oficio chofer, y su último hijo que estudia, puesto que los 3 primeros hijos son  independientes. Hace 10 años se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, en un local alquilado a media hora de su casa. Desde entonces su actividad empieza desde las 7.00AM, momento en que inicia con la preparación de sus platillos. La ventaja que tiene en su establecimiento, es la afluencia del público, por situarse al costado del  terminal de buses, favoreciéndola en la venta, logrando vender todo en su totalidad, lo cual ha hecho que su negocio sea rentable. Por ello está feliz con lo que hace, solo que a veces no se abastece en atender sola a sus clientes, pero igual termina por complacer a todos. Gracias a la preferencia de ellos, es que pudo educar a sus hijos. En adelante dese incrementar su capital de trabajo y de ese modo mejorar su estilo de vida. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de productos de primera necesidad, así como utensilios de cocina para agilizar su labor.
texts.en:
María, 56, is a hard-working woman; she lives in her own house with her husband, who is a driver, and her youngest son, who is a student. Her three oldest children are independent. For the last 10 years she has sold prepared food in a rented location half an hour away from home. Her work day all this time has begun at 7am when she starts to prepare her meals. An advantage that her location has is that it is alongside the bus terminal so it has much foot traffic. Her sales, therefore, are good and she sells out all her production thereby producing good profits. She enjoys her work very much, although sometimes it’s very difficult to tend to all her customers alone; still, she ends up pleasing all of them. Thanks to their patronage, she was able to provide an education for her children. In the future, she would like to increase her working capital so that she can improve her life style. This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She will use the requested funds to buy basic ingredients as well as kitchen utensils to facilitate her work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and utensils.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 40 years old and is married with five children: a boy and four girls. Her husband is a carpenter and he also supports their home.

Patience fries and sells potato chips and is well known in her neighborhood for her chips. She hopes to grow her business so that it becomes bigger and stronger in the future.

Patience is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more cooking oil and potatoes to fry more potato chips to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more potatoes and cooking oil to fry more potato chips to sell

loans.name: Tien Hung1 Group

texts.en:
Bich T. N. was born in 1983. She lives in Tien Hung village, N. Khe commune with her husband and two of her children. Two of her children are still young. She grows and sells vegetables in the market. Her husband is a worker. Her family has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has a participated in SEDA since 2006 and repaid punctually. She is the group leader of 5-member group loan in SEDA. In this loan cycle, she wants T. borrow 5,886,000 VND T. expand her business.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Minh T. T. was born in 1968. She has two children. She breeds the pigs and poultry. Her husband is a driver. They have a daily income. She wants T. borrow 5,886,000 VND T. use in her small business.
Hoa T. N. was born in 1982. She sells pork in the market. She has a son. Her husband is a worker. Mrs Hoa wants T. borrow 6,322,000 VND T. expand her business.
Hien T. Dao was born in 1971. She has two children. She has a store. She wants T. borrow 4,142,000 VND T. invest in her store.
Chinh T. T. N. was born in 1983. She has two children. She has a mechanic wokshop. She want T. borrow 5,886,000 VND T. expand her mechanic workshop.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
From the village of Militar, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur, Arlyn C. is 33 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Arlyn owns and operates a specialized retail store buying and selling charcoal in the local community. Engaged in her business for over six years, she earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Arlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to to purchase additional products to sell, Arlyn is requesting a new loan, her fourth, of 12000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosefina

texts.en:
Rosefina D. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 47 years old. Rosefina is married and has two adult and one school-aged children. Rosefina owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling bag & shoe products in the local community. Rosefina is just starting this business.

In 2007, Rosefina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from PMPC, which was for 14,900 Philippine pesos (PHP) and was used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital.

Rosefina is now requesting her fifth loan from PMPC, for 14,900 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her bag and shoe business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her ukay-ukay business

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly S. is an old woman who currently stays at home to do housework. She is widowed and has three children who are already married and still live at home. Her two children, who work as laborers in a wine distilling company, contribute towards covering the family expenses. Ly S. has a son who needs to continue obtaining a university degree, but he doesn’t have money to pay for his school fees (he is pictured here). Therefore, Ly S. would like to ask a loan of $500 to be used to pay this fee.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Gabriel Luis

texts.en:
Gabriel is a 60-year-old father of six who lives with his wife and two daughters in Los Chiles, located in the northern region of Costa Rica.

Like many member of the Los Chiles community, Gabriel is a farmer and dedicates his time to the planting and harvest of various subsistence crops including tuber(a type of plant structure that stores nutrients) and chili peppers.

Gabriel is always busy: when he isn’t tending to the needs of his own plot of land, he hires himself out as a laborer on a nearby farm. The money he earns helps to complement the income generated from the sale of his own produce.

Gabriel organizes his day so that in the morning he wakes up early, eats breakfast, and then feeds his cows and pigs. He spend six hours per day working as a laborer and in the afternoons he switches gears, taking on the work in his own fields.

This loan will be used to finance the production of Habanero chili peppers. Specifically, Gabriel will use this money to purchase seeds, fertilizer, tools, pesticides, and other materials and ingredients necessary for the production of chili peppers. All labor and transportation tasks will be carried out by Gabriel and his family.

Gabriel dedicates part of his time as a hired hand on a nearby farm. He worries about the coming harvesting season and hopes that he will be successful this year. Gabriel´s goals are to maintain stability in his family, achieve higher production rates, improve his economic situation, and offer a better standard of living to his family.

A major difficulty and limitation for Gabriel has been his lack of working capital. He hopes to use this loan effectively to improve life on the farm for everyone.

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial, or PROPICA, is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Los Chiles, thus ensuring that their products will reach market.

The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA, represents a unique opportunity to Gabriel, his family, and his community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, Gabriel wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented; he wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in his neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and nutrients necessary for the production of chili peppers

loans.name: Marisol July

texts.es:
Marisol July tiene 40 años y vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Marisol July abrió una pequeña tienda en su domicilio, donde vende comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y muchas cosas más. Ya son 8 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La pueden encontrar en su tienda, los 7 días de la semana, desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche o hasta que se agote el suministro del pan.   
 
Con su próximo préstamo, Marisol July espera recibir $600 USD. Por el momento, tiene suficiente mercadería en su puesto. Le gustaría con el dinero del préstamo comprar más comestibles como por ejemplo bolsas de azúcar, bolsas de arroz y muchas cosas más para que pueda abastecer su tienda. 

El banco comunal “Las Leonas de San Jerónimo”  ya tiene 10 ciclos de funcionamiento, pero Marisol July hace varios años atrás que recién participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien. El nombre que le pusieron al banco comunal es en homenaje al distrito de San Jerónimo y donde viven los socios
texts.en:
Marisol July is 40 years old and lives in the city of Cusco with her husband and two children. Marisol July opened a small store in her home where she sells rice, sugar, noodles, and other groceries. She has been working in this business for 8 years and has thrived due to the determination she puts in her work. One can find her in her store seven days a week from 5 a.m. to 10 p.m. or until her products sell out.

With her next loan, Marisol July hopes to receive $600 USD. For the moment, she has enough merchandise in her store. She would like to buy more groceries such as bags of sugar, rice, and many more things to supply her store.

The communal bank "The Lionesses of San Jerónimo" has completed 10 loan cycles, but Marisol July participated several years ago and has been doing very well. The name of the communal bank is a trbiute to the San Jerónimo district and where the members live.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of more products such as bags of rice.

loans.name: Buyantsogt

texts.en:
Buyantsogt M. is 42 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Tuv province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His elder son is a student, the middle daughter attends a local secondary school, and his wife is a cattle breeder in their province. 

Buyantsogt graduated from a local vocational training center in 1987 and began his private business in 1990. He operates a dairy products and cattle breeding business with the help of his wife. He says, “I want to continue to pay the tuition fees for my elder child, and I want all my children to be educated young adults with a great passion and enthusiasm for life. My wife and I are planning to increase our business of transferring livestock pasturing into more intensive farming”. 

Buyantsogt is planning on expanding his business in order to increase the quality of his life as well as purchasing an apartment for his elder son. He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to pay his son's tuition fee.

loans.use: To afford his son's tuition fee.

loans.name: Alikram

texts.en:
Alikram A. is 32 years old, married, and has two children. He owns a shop in which he sells spare moped engine parts, a business he has been running for the last 2 years. The average monthly income he earns, between $375 to $500, allows him to support his family, including his parents. 

To meet his customers’ constantly growing demand, Alikram would like to increase his shop’s capacity.  He applied for an 800 AZN loan. The profits from these sales will allow him to continue to improve his family's living conditions. The loan will greatly improve Alikram’s income and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: purchase more spare parts to increase profit

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife L. is from the village of San Jose, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 39 years old. Marife is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marife owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marife has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marife joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marife has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marife is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Marife from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence N. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, beans, onions  and groundnut phase. She is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes and onions to sell.  Florence is 40 years old and is married. her husband is a soldier. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en:
Anastasie was born in 1967 and she is married with one child.  Anastasie is a businesswoman who is commonly known in the business of selling beer in her pub.  She has owned a pub where she sells beer for about six years.  Her pub is open from 6 am to 9 pm every day.

Anastasie is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing a variety of beer in her pub.  With this additional quantity of beer, she will satisfy the demand of her customers and her profits will increase more than previously.  If successful, she will keep reinvesting for a better financial stability in her future.

loans.use: Expanding her business through purchasing a lot of beer for her pub

loans.name: Johanna's Group

texts.en:
Johanna S. is from the village of Calaocan, Angadanan, Isabela. She is 26 years old and the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Johanna is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Johanna raises pigs for fattening and sale. Johanna is just starting this business.

In 2010, Johanna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy some essential tools

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel, de 28 años, es un hombre soltero, que vive con su papá Juan, de 60 años y sus 2 hermanos: Franz, de 15 y Alex, de 14 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Centro Culebrayoc. El trabajo al que se dedica es la agricultura, sus principales cultivo constan de papa, arveja, habas y demás hortalizas. Cuenta que desde que tenía 15 años, se dedicó a administrar sus cultivos, los cuales con el tiempo, esfuerzo y mucho trabajo; lograron ser los mejores del mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, lugar donde vende su producción. La satisfacción que tiene Manuel según afirma, “es poder ayudar a su padre en la crianza y educación de sus hermanos”. Por ello para más adelante desea abrir una tienda de comestibles, donde pueda adquirir mejores ganancias. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, y asegura que en todo este tiempo de trabajo conjunto y esforzado con su banco comunal, logró obtener muchos éxitos y bendiciones. Por lo que agradece el apoyo brindado. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, para su cosecha de papa, asimismo invertirá en la contrata de peones, para que le ayuden a sembrar los 100 sacos de cosecha de papa de otra variedad; que sembró en uno de sus terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Manuel is 28 years old.  He is single and lives with his dad Juan, who is 60, and his 2 brothers, 15 year-old Franz and 14 year-old Alex.  They live together in their own home which is located in Centro Culebrayoc.  Manuel works as a farmer.  His main crops are potatoes, peas, beans and other vegetables.  He says that since he was 15 years old he has been looking after his crops and with time and a lot of effort and hard work these have become the best in the wholesale market of the city of Tarma, which is where he sells his produce.   The satisfaction which Miguel has is “to be able to help my father in raising and educating my brothers”.  In the future, he would like to open a grocery store from which he can make better profits.

This is Manuel's tenth loan with MFP and he assures us that, in all this time of working hard together with his community bank, he has managed to obtain a lot of success and blessings.  He is therefore grateful for the support he has been given.  Manuel will use his loan to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer for his potato harvest and he will also invest in hiring laborers who will help him with his 100 sacks of a different variety of potato which he will plant on his land.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer and hire laborers to help him plant his potatoes

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra Elizabeth C. D. V. D. 28 años D. edad, es una madre D. familia muy responsable, quien cuida mucho D. su hogar el cual esta conformado por su esposo y dos hijos D. 9 y 2 años D. edad, junto a los cuales resiD. en Ciudad Arce en el departamento D. La Libertad. Sandra posee un molino y así mismo su propia tienda en la cual comercializa productos varios como golosinas, pan, papel higiénico, pastillas y algunos tipos D. detergentes, a pesar que ya cuenta con 8 años D. experiencia, debido a que la mayoría D. ganancias son destinas al sostenimiento del hogar, ella invierte muy poco al negocio, por lo que necesita una ayuda para mejorarlo. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a Integral, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad D. productos D. primera necesidad, D. manera que sus clientes tengan mayor variedad para escoger y así comprar más, D. esta misma forma desea contar con el dinero necesario para brindarle un mejor mantenimiento a sus molinos. Sandra es una persona muy dedicada a lo que hace, es por ello que su mayor deseo es poder crecer en su negocio y así mismo brindar un mejor servicio en el cual sus clientes se sientan cómodos y D. esta manera ella pueda mejorar sus ganancias, lo cual sería D. gran beneficio para su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra Elizabeth C. D. V. is 28 years old.  She is a very responsible mother who looks after her household very well.  Her household consists of her husband and her two children aged 9 and 2.  The family live together in Ciudad Arce, in La Libertad department.

Sandra has a mill and also her own store in which she sells different products such as candy, bread, toilet paper, sweets and some types of detergent.  In spite of the fact that she has 8 years of experience, owing to the fact that most of her profits are used to support her household, she invests very little in her business.  This is why she needs help to improve it.

Sandra is requesting a loan from Integral which will give her the money she needs to buy a larger quantity of essential household products so that her customers have a larger variety of products from which to choose and will, therefore, buy more.  She would also like to have the money she needs to do maintenance work on her mills.  Sandra is a person who is very committed to what she does.  For this reason, her greatest dream is to be able to grow her business and thereby proviD. a better service with which her customers feel comfortable.  This will allow her to improve her profits which will be of great benefit to her family.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on her mills and to invest in her store

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson, 58, is a dairy farmer from the town of Kitale in Western Kenya. He has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now. He sells his milk to a local cooling plant. He also earns income from his large-scale farming of maize.

He has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 41,600KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the proceeds from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children. He says that his major challenge has been the poor road network. He hopes however to purchase a pick-up in the future to assist him in transporting his products to the market.

Jackson is a married father of three children who are now between the ages of 16 and 24. Two of the children are currently attending school. He comments that Juhudi's terms and conditions are convenient and good.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio pertenece al banco comunal “Kukuli” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene cuatro años de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva. 
Julio, tiene 34 años y tiene un hijo, él vive junto con su pareja en la ciudad del Cusco, el socio julio es cheff de profesión y trabaja en un restaurante. Actualmente, el socio Julio vive en el distrito de Wanchaq de la ciudad del Cusco.  

Julio y su pareja tienen un pequeño negocio de venta de artesanía. Ya son 10 años que se dedican al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Julio con el microcrédito desea comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo ceramica, chompas, mantas, polos y muchas cosas más.
texts.en:
Julio belongs to the “Kukuli” Communal Bank of the UMF Arariwa Association of the city of Cusco, Perú. The Communal Bank has been in operation for four years and is well managed by its governing board.
Julio is 34 years old and has a son, he lives with his partner in the city of Cusco. Julio works as a chef in a famous restaurant. At present, Julio lives in the district of Wanchaq in the city of Cusco.
Julio and his partner have a small business where they sell crafts. For some 10 years they have had the business and have done quite well because of their hard work. Julio with the microloan wants to buy more merchandize like ceramics, sweaters, blankets, shirts and many other items.

loans.use: To buy more merchandize like ceramics, sweaters, blankets, shirts and many other items.

loans.name: Paing

texts.en: Paing S. is 36 years old and has been selling Khmer noodles in her community for more than five years. She sells her noodles every morning, making an average of $4 per day to support her family's daily expenses. She is divorced and has two school-aged children. In order earn additional profit, Paing S. says that she intends to buy fish to make fish-paste to sell.

loans.use: To buy fish to make fish-paste to sell.

loans.name: Zeenat's Group

texts.en:
Zeenat lives in Okara, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. For 14 years, she and her family have lived in the Faisal Park area in a 2-room brick house. 

She is supportive by nature, and she shares the family's financial burden with her husband by making shoes. Zeenat receives orders from different shoe stores and fulfills them to earn a profit. Her husband, M. Y., sells fruit from his four-wheeled cart.
 
Zeenat has 11 children. Due to poor financial conditions, she hasn't been able to provide an education to her children.  Two of  her sons do private jobs; the third drives a rickshaw. Her fourth son is a tailor.  The other children stay at home and don't work.
  
Zeenat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her shoe-making business because she has a large order to fulfill. With the loan, she will buy leather, shoelaces, nails, shoe polish and other supplies to make shoes to fulfill the orders.  She has been in this business for more than 9 years.  She is hopeful that this loan will enable her to fulfill the orders on time and build a positive image with her clients by providing quality service. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loans, she maintained good credit and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy leather, shoelaces and other supplies

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. is married to a carpenter, and they have four children. She has completed her senior high school education. For the past 22 years, Rose has been selling banku (a Ghanaian staple made of fermented maize), fish and corn dough at Takoradi near Effiakuma Estate. 
Her income pays for her children’s school fees and the household utility bills. Rose will use the loan to buy more maize to grow her business. The new profit as a result of the loan will be reinvested back into her business.

In the photo, Rose has her hand on the corn dough she uses for banku.

loans.use: To buy more maize.

loans.name: Erling

texts.es: Erling, de 31 años, es un hombre luchador, pues hace 7 años falleció su padre. Dejándole así la responsabilidad de la familia. Él vive junto a su mamá Dora y a sus 6 hermanos en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Su principal sustento son sus estudios de Topografía; lo que le permite trabajar en las instituciones del estado peruano brindando estudios sobre el área. Pero la actividad que le apasiona es la “agricultura”, donde tiene 6 años de experiencia sembrando café en sus 15 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas; los cuales abona y cuida, los fines de semana con la ayuda de sus hermanos. “Ellos me apoyan en el cuidado de mis cultivos cuando estoy ausente”, afirma. Asimismo se siente agradecido por el apoyo que recibe de parte de los socios de la cooperativa de Sanchirio, donde comercializa sus grano de café; porque le apoyan constantemente en las capacitaciones para que el café que siembra sea de mejor calidad.  Ahora desea trabajar con más ahínco para poder obtener más ganancias, y así apoyar en los estudios de sus hermanos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “desarrollando para el futuro de prisma”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por el apoyo recibido. Erling, invertirá el crédito en la compra de 6 sacos de abono orgánico, los cuales esparcirá en la hectárea de cultivo de café que le falta.
texts.en:
Erling, age 31, is a strong-willed man. Seven years ago, his father passed away so he was left with the responsibility for his family. He lives with his mother Dora and six siblings in their own home in the town of Unión Palomar located in the central Peruvian jungle. His main occupation is that of a topography instructor, which allows him to work with the Peruvian state institutions and teach classes in his field of expertise. However, farming is his passion. Erling has six years of experience growing coffee on fifteen hectares of land. He fertilizes and cares for his crops on the weekends with the help of his siblings. “They help me look after the crops while I’m away,” says Erling. In addition, he is grateful for the support that he has received from the members of the Sanchirio Cooperative where he sells coffee beans. This organization provides training to help farmers produce better quality coffee. Now he wants to work harder in order to earn more income and help his siblings with their education.

Erling is a member of the Communal Bank “Desarrollando Para El Futuro de Prisma” (Developing for the Future of Prisma). This is his first loan with MFP and he is grateful for the support he has received. Erling will invest this loan in the purchase of six sacks of organic fertilizer to apply on one hectare of coffee plants.

loans.use: To purchase six sacks of organic fertilizer to apply on his coffee crop.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora teresa es habitantante de un lugar llamado Tierra Blanca el cual significa novia del del sol, 
la cual es una region ganadera. Doña tere(como la llaman sus amigos y vecinos) tiene la edad de 28 años, estudio hasta la preparatoria y esta casada con el señor Juan Carlos con el cual tiene dos hijos de nombres frenando de 8 años que asiste a la primaria y carolina de 3 años.

Doña tere nos platica que ella invertira su credito en la compra de catalagos y ropa interior para dama la cual vende con sus vecinas y compañeras de trabajo.

ella nos dice que ya tiene mas de 3 años vendiendo ropa interior y que antes tenia una pequeña tiendita pero como la situacion economica no es muy buena decidio buscar un empleo y en sus ratos libres vende su ropa.

Ella espera que con la inversion de este credito su negocio siga cresiendo dia a dia, como sus hijos aun son pequeños ella tiene pensado ahorrar para poder darles estudios en un futuro y una mejor calidad de vida.

ella nos dijos"mi negocio a iniciado a crecer desde que la fundacion me da prestamos me gustaria agradeecerles todo el apoyo que me ha brindado"
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa is a resident of a place called Tierra Blanca, which is also known as “The Bride of the Sun”. In addition to being a livestock region, it is one of the warmest places in the State of Veracruz. Doña Tere (as she is called by her friends and neighbors) is 28 years old and has a high school education. She is married to Sr. Juan Carlos and has two children named Fernando (an 8 year old elementary school student) and Carolina (age 3).

Doña Tere says that she will invest her loan in the purchase of catalogs and women’s undergarments to sell to her neighbors and co-workers. She has been selling undergarments for more than three years. Teresa previously had a small store, but due to the bad economic situation she decided to find a job and sell clothes in her free time.

She hopes that the investment from this loan will help grow her business day after day. Since her children are small, she has plans to save for their education so that they will have a future and a better quality of life. She says, “My business has started to grow since receiving loans from Fundación Realidad. I am grateful for all the support that has been given to me.”

loans.use: To purchase undergarments to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 50 years old, married and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy more stock to sell.
Lydia has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her sari-sari store for two years and also earns an income from abaca weaving. She aspires to repair and renovate her house to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Tuvshinjargal

texts.en:
Tuvshinjargal is 39 years old and she lives with her two daughters in a house in Songino-hairhan district, Ulaanbaatar city of Mongolia. Her older daughter, 18, goes to a secondary school while younger one is in kindergarten. 

Tuvshinjargal manages a household good trading business at a rented stall at Harhorin market, second biggest market in Ulaanbaatar city. She started her business in 2002. She sells variety of blankets, sheets, quilts and sleeping bag etc. She has gained much experience and is planning to continue her business in the future. She is an honest women who says, "I am doing my best to feed my children and to pay their education cost." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more goods for her business sales.

loans.use: To purchase more goods.

loans.name: Las Vecinas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “LAS VECINASS”, está integrado por 10 clientas, en este grupo se encuentra la señora Noemi de 37 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos de 14, 12 años y una hija de 10 años, nos platica que hace aproximadamente 7 años decidió poner su negocio de dulces que inició en la comunidad en el Estado de México, y gracias al apoyo de su familia su negocio ha ido creciendo, ya que desafortunadamente se separó de su esposo; ahora que sus ganancias le ayudan a solventar los gastos de su familia por lo cual ya no se siente tan preocupada por sacar adelante a sus hijos y espera en un futuro brindarles una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Vecinas" (The Neighbors). It is made up of 10 customers.

One member of this group is Noemí. She is 37 years old and has two sons, who are 14 and 12, and a 10-year-old daughter. She tells us that about seven years ago she decided to start her business selling sweets. She began it in the State of Mexico, and thanks to her family's support her business has grown. Unfortunately she and her husband separated, but now her earnings help her to cover the family's expenses, so she is not as worried about providing for her children and hopes to help them go to college in the future.

loans.use: to invest in her business selling sweets.

loans.name: Vertiz Abraham

texts.es:
Abraham tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo de 10 años de edad en la zona rural y humilde del distrito de Pitipo en Ferreñafe – Lambayeque.

La esposa de Abraham cuenta con un negocio de crianza y venta de animales, con lo que ayuda a los ingresos del hogar al igual que Abraham, quien es obrero de campo y también cría animales menores (aves de corral) desde hace 5 años.

Abraham solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que invertirá en su negocio familiar de crianza y venta de animales. Él comprará animales menores para expandir su negocio. 

Debido a que cuenta con clientes establecidos, Abraham se siente confiado de poder aumentar sus ingresos para el bienestar de su familia. Además, pretende atraer a clientela nueva.
texts.en:
Abraham tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo de 10 años de edad en la zona rural y humilde del distrito de Pitipo en Ferreñafe – Lambayeque.

La esposa de Abraham cuenta con un negocio de crianza y venta de animales, con lo que ayuda a los ingresos del hogar al igual que Abraham, quien es obrero de campo y también cría animales menores (aves de corral) desde hace 5 años.

Abraham solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que invertirá en su negocio familiar de crianza y venta de animales. Él comprará animales menores para expandir su negocio. 

Debido a que cuenta con clientes establecidos, Abraham se siente confiado de poder aumentar sus ingresos para el bienestar de su familia. Además, pretende atraer a clientela nueva.

loans.use: Comprar animales menores.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru: Ольга проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 42 года. Она замужем. У нее 5 детей. Ее муж вместе с детьми находится в России. Сама Ольга предоставляет услугу. Она занимается шитьем национальных и других видов платьев. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения швейной машинки. Она хочет открыть свое ателье.
texts.en: Olga lives in the Shahrituz region. She is 42 years old. She is married and has five children. Her husband and children are now in Russia. Olga provides a service, she sews traditional and other types of dresses. She has been in this business for twenty years. She is taking out the loan to buy a sewing machine. Olga wants to open her own shop.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma, 31, was born in Yucay and still lives there. She lives with her partner and has one child who is four years old. Norma has a farm on which she produces vegetables such as onions, lettuces and cabbages. In addition, she raises guinea pigs in order to sell them. With her $1,000 loan Norma plans to buy guinea pigs and better tools in order to cultivate her crops. Her dream is to eventually purchase cars and become a driver who transports people from place to place. She is very dedicated to her work and promises to follow through with all the necessary payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and tools for her farm.

loans.name: Maria Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta de 29 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son dependientes, Violeta  vive en la zona rural del distrito de Morrope,  ella cuenta con casa propia que solo tiene servicio de agua, su comunidad es pequeña con un aproximado de 200  familias.

La actividad a la que se dedica Violeta es la crianza y comercialización  de animales menores y aves de corral como patos y gallinas, la crianza de estos  animales la realiza desde hace 4 años, en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su casa, ella aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el negocio rubro, además cuenta con clientela fija para su negocio.

Violeta está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles, el cual será para invertir en compra de aves menores con sus respectivo alimento balanceado y pastos naturales. Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización, por eso violeta seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Violeta es una mujer  responsable y  trabajadora que desea poder ayudar a su esposo y de esta manera logar que su familia alcance una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Violeta, age 29, is married and has two children who are still dependent. Violeta lives in a rural zone of the Morrope district. She has her own home which only has running water. Her community is small and has approximately 200 families.

Violeta raises and sells small animals and barnyard birds such as ducks and hens. She has raised these animals for four years in corrals located in the back of her home. She learned this work from her parents, which means that she has a thorough knowledge of this business. She has a fixed customer base.

Violeta is requesting a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. This will be invested in the purchase of barnyard birds, and balanced feed and natural grass for these animals. This business has competition, but it also has a large market. For this reason Violeta wants to continue expanding her business.

Violeta is a responsible and hard-working woman who wants to be able to help her husband and thus ensure that her family achieves a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase animals, with balanced feed for said animals, for sale.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa, agricultor y ganadero, ademas cria cerdos, él aprendio gracias al apoyo de su cuñada quien se dedicaba a lo mismo y lo ayudo para tener su propio negocio, cuenta con varios clientes, la granja de cerdos la tiene ubicada en su vivienda.
Actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cerdos, esta compra le permitirá ampliar su negocio e incrementar las ganancias con la clientela.
El quiere montar una granja mas grande, conocer más clientela y desarrollandose como comerciante.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife.  He’s a farmer and raises cattle.  He also raises pigs.  He learned thanks to a sister-in-law who was in the same line of work and helped him have his own business.  He has several customers.  His pig farm is located at home.

At present, he’s asking for a loan to buy pigs.  This purchase will make it possible for him to expand the business and increase profits from customers.

He wants to set up a larger farm, to get to know more customers and to develop as a merchant.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: 3.9.73 Thiệu Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Điệp operates a food stall selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Điệp  is 37 years old and she is married with one child. Điệp is the group leader of the 3.9.72 Thiệu Hóa  solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her one dependent.

This is Điệp's  first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Điệp  has been involved in this business for four years. The main hardship that Điệp faces in her business is not being able to meet the high demand for products.

With her business profit, Điệp hopes to remodel her house and to maintain her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is from the village of San Isidro in the province of Isabela. She is 47 years old and married with four adult children. She has a high school education and has been working in agriculture for the past 20 years. She provides economic support to her family. 

Mercedes considers herself to be a hardworking, honest person. She hopes to save enough money to renovate the family home. 

She would like a loan to purchase an additional pig. She expects her income to increase by 20 percent with this investment. She is pleased with the services of microfinance and says the prices are reasonable. She wants to continuing living in Quirino, surrounded by her relatives and friends.

loans.use: to buy feed and a piglet to raise.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
For some time now Aba has been producing Fante kenkey. Fante kenkey is a common dish (of fermented corn dough wrapped in plantain or banana leaf) popular in the Central Region of Ghana. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. 

Aba supports her husband in taking care of the home. Aba will use the loan to obtain bags of maize to make kenkey to sell. Aba plans to reinvest the new profits back into the business.

loans.use: to obtain bags of maize to make kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Modesto Noel

texts.es: Modesto Noel tiene su negocio que es brindar el servicio de costura. Hace más de 42 años que tiene este medio de vida, esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos con Fundación por lo que siente muy feliz de tener un medio de ingreso que sea necesario para su hogar. Tiene 8 hijos y siempre les brindo lo que ellos necesitaban. Las prendas de vestir que realiza son pantalones, trajes, prendas de graduación entre otros. El motivo del crédito es para la compra hilos, telas, tijeras, dedales, entre otros.
texts.en: Modesto Noel has been a tailor for more than 42 years, and this is not the first time he his requesting loans to the Fundación, as he feels very happy about having a way to earn the income he needs for his family. He has 8 children to whom he has always given what they needed. Among the clothes he creates there are trousers, suits and graduation dresses. He is requesting a loan to buy threads, scissors and thimbles among other items.

loans.use: To buy threads, scissors and thimbles.

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan was born in 1982. She lives in Loc Ha village, Mai Lam commune. She is married. She has one child who is still small. Her husband is a policeman. He has an income. 

Not only does Ngan grow rice, but also she makes noodle (Vietnamese name is "bun"). She has had this job for two years. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

Since 2007 she has participated in SEDA. The last time she borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This time she would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to buy rice to make noodle.

loans.use: to buy rice to make noodle.

loans.name: Rigail Ramiro

texts.es:
Rigail Ramiro tiene 26 años de edad  es casado tiene una hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo de dos años de edad en el cantón ventanas provincia de los ríos.

LA VRC NUEVA UNIÓN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul.
Rigail se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza Echeandia. 

Con el dinero  del prestamo anterior pudo comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
En la familia la relación ha mejorado porque ahora puede aportar un poco más para el bienestar de la familia, en el trabajo le va mucho mejor porque a aumentado la producción en los ingresos a mejorado mucho porque ahora con la venta de los productos obtiene más ingresos. Con el apoyo de anterior crédito le ha ayudado a superarse y no tuvo ningún problema para poder cancelar las cuotas establecidas por la cooperativa. 

Este nuevo Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque le servirá para comprar semillas, plantas de cacao e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es seguir trabajando para poder comprar una casa para la familia.
En los tiempos libres le gusta ver televisión y practicar los deportes en especial el futbol

"Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada".
texts.en:
Rigail Ramiro is 26 years old.  He is married with one son, aged two years old, and lives with his wife and son in Ventanas canton, in the province of Los Ríos.

The NUEVA UNIÓN communal bank is located in the Guamayacu precinct, which is part of Echeandía province.  This communal bank focuses on short-cycle agriculture, specifically corn, rice and beans.

Rigail works in agriculture planting corn, rice, and beans.  He makes his purchases and sales in Echeandía . 

With the money from his previous loan, he was able to purchase seeds and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte brand herbicide, fertilizers and weedkiller, in order to keep his crops in good condition.  His family relationships have improved because now he is able to bring in a little more for his family's well-being.  His work is going much better, because he has increased his production and his income has improved greatly too, because now he earns more income from his products.  He has been able to succeed with the help of his previous loan, and he had no problems in making his scheduled repayments to the cooperative.

This new loan will be very helpful, because he will use it to purchase seeds, cocoa plants, and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte brand herbicide, fertilizers, and weedkiller to keep his crops in good condition.

The challenges that he faces most often are the competition and insect infestations.  His dream is to continue working so that he can buy a house for his family.

In his free time he enjoys watching TV and playing sports, especially football.

"He is very grateful for the support being provided".

loans.use: to purchase seeds, cocoa plants, and agricultural supplies such as urea, Matamonte brand herbicide, fertilizers, and weedkiller to keep his crops in good condition.

loans.name: Jassem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and father of three children.

Jassem has been an owner of a food market since 2003, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there is a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a loan of $3000 in order to renovate his market, to buy a tricycle truck and to add more foodstuffs to his inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his market, to buy a tricycle truck and to add more foodstuffs to his store's inventory.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
El señor Juan Jose es casado, tiene 30 años de edad, cursó los 4 años de educación primaria, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa típica para damas, inició este negocio por iniciativa propia y lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuanta con el apoyo de su esposa quie la lo apoya.

solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, consistente en suéteres, blusas, fajas, cortes, etc. espera en el futuro tener un local de venta y negocio mas grande.
texts.en:
Juan Jose is 30 years old, married, and attended four years of primary school.  He works selling traditional clothing for women.  He started this business himself and has five years of experience.  His wife helps him with the business.

He is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise, which includes sweaters, shirts, belts, and skirts.  He hopes in the future to have a shop to sell his merchandise and make his business larger.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his traditional clothing sales business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is applying for a loan for Kshs 60,000 to expand her shop by buying bundles of wheat flour, sugar, rice and maize flour to sell to her customers. In the future, she dreams of expanding her shop and opening a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: La socia Dolores; continua trabajando en su negocio, ella administra y atiende su restaurante todos los dia y desde muy temprano como siempre, la socia, desearía futuro implementar su local y hacerlo mas grande para comprar mas mesas, sillas y tener mas clientes, ella en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de insumos para la cocina, la socia desea comprar al por mayor bolsas de arroz, azucar para los refrescos, papa por arrobas, fideos en cajas, aceite en bidon grande, condimentos y especias al por mayor, ella desea hacer esta inversión para tener mas ingresos. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la cocina.
texts.en: Dolores is still working in her business: she runs a restaurant and tends to it every day. As always, she gets up very early to do so. In the future, she wants to fit out her restaurant and make it bigger so that she can buy more tables and chairs and have more customers. She now wants to invest in the purchase of kitchen utensils wholesale. She wants to buy bags of rice, sugar for the drinks, potatoes by the kilo, pasta in boxes, a large barrel of oil, condiments, and spices. She wants to make this investment in order to have more income. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of kitchen supplies.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of kitchen supplies.

loans.name: Salimah

texts.en:
Salimah is a 63 year old married woman with nine children who are all grown ups.  Her husband is a businessman who supports the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses is food for her family. 

Salimah has operated a retail shop for the past two years and she also sells fish.  Her potential clients are her neighbors and friends.  She faces a major challenge of transportation.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase more maize flour, wheat flour, rice, sugar and cooking oil, all for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, sugar and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Vun

texts.en:
Vun, age 51, is married and resides with her husband and seven children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers who grow mushrooms to sell at the market. Additionally, Vun grows rice to generate more income. Two of her children are employed as receptionists at a hotel. 

Vun is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase oxen to yoke in order to till her farming land and to carry her rice crop. In doing so, she can reduce her plowing service expense. In the future, she would like to expand her business of growing mushrooms, renew her house and support her children to study until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase oxen to yoke in order to till her farming land.

loans.name: Josue Abinadab

texts.es:
Josué, está iniciando un nuevo proceso de siembra de maíz, por eso solicita nuevamente un préstamo para invertirlo en los insumos como son semilla, abono, herbicidas, para darle los cuidados necesarios en todo el proceso de crecimiento del maíz, su intención es tener una buena producción a través de la aplicación de estos insumos.
El considera que estos préstamos de ayuda estar trabajando en la agricultura ya que este oficio lo realiza desde hace varios años y es su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Josué is starting a new method of corn farming. For this reason he is requesting a new loan to invest in supplies such as seeds, manure and herbicides to provide the necessary care during the whole growing period of the corn. His intention is to have a good production by means of applying these supplies. 

He believes that these loans help him in his job as a farmer which he has carried out for several years and is his source of income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, herbicides.

loans.name: Soum

texts.en:
Soum is 54 years old and widowed.  She resides with one child in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (such as the ancient temples of Angkor Wat, Bayon, and Banteay Srey). 

Soum has been involved in growing a variety of vegetables to sell at the market to generate income. Her child is employed in a hotel. In order to improve her family's livelihood, Soum is requesting a loan of US $600 to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for growing rice in the dry season. By doing so, her family's economic situation will be improved. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer for growing rice in the dry season.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
Lucas is a forty-two-year-old married man with five children. He rears goats and grows flowers in Kangemi. Lucas has been in the business for eight years now and gets a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This will be Lucas’ third loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase more goats to rear and sell later at a profit,and also plant flowers for sell. 

With the profit that he will get he wants to diversify in his business. In the future he wants to be able to expand his business and sustain his family by improving their standard of living

loans.use: to buy goats and pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Hambinintsoa

texts.fr:
Hambinintsoa est âgé de 29ans et est marié à une femme au foyer. Le couple a 1 enfant de 5ans, scolarisé. Son activité a débuté en 2011. Avant cela, il a travaillé comme maçon mais son contrat est arrivé à terme.  Il en est à son 3eme prêt et il hérite de cette activité de sa femme à cause de son état de santé défavorable. Le prêt servira à acheter : Du poisson séché, de l’huile, du savon, des bougies, du sel, des nouilles (Apollo, Presto), des couches pour bébé et cube à saveur (jumbo).
Leur maison, ainsi que leur terrain leur a était offert par son père. De plus il a déjà habité ces lieux dès son plus jeune âge. Le couple espère devenir un grossiste pour toute catégorie de produit et aussi de construire une maison, encore meilleur que la sienne en ce moment.
texts.en:
Hambinintsoa is 29 years old and married to a homemaker.  The couple has a five-year-old child who goes to school.  Hambinintsoa started his own business in 2011.  Before that, he used to work as a bricklayer but his contract came to an end.  This is his third loan.  The activity he is now involved in used to be his wife's but he took it over from her when she had to deal with some health problems.  Hambinintsoa will use his loan to buy some dried fish, some oil, soap, candles, salt, noodles (Apollo, Presto), baby diapers, and savory bouillon cubes (Jumbo).

Hambinintsoa's house, as well as the land around it, was given to him by his father.  This is where he grew up.  Hambinintsoa and his wife would like to become wholesalers one day and sell a large variety of goods.  They would also like to build another house, even nicer than the one they have at the moment.

loans.use: to buy various staple foods and dried fish.

loans.name: Ehmeedah

texts.en:
Ehmeedeh is 38 years old, is married and has five children, and lives with them and her husband in under privileged area ‎which is Rsaifeh. She is known for being hard-working and responsible with the desire for personal improvement. She ‎struggles every day in order to get ahead with her family and to provide her children with a better future. Unfortunately, she ‎was not able to go to school due to the lack of financial resources, Ehmeedah wants to be productive woman and she ‎decided to open her business which is beauty salon to help her husband in the household supplies and to be productive ‎woman.‎
Her current goals and objectives are to provide a better future for her children and to give them better living conditions, ‎therefore she decided to apply a loan is to invest in beauty products like dyes, blush , acrylic nails, straighteners, eye ‎shadow, and nail polish, etc. to increase her incomes, and improve her standards of living.‎

loans.use: to invest in beauty products like dyes, blush , acrylic nails, straighteners, eye ‎shadow, and nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is 28, single, lives in Salyan region Khaladj village.
She has been engaged in farming for 4 years.
She is hard worker, strong woman, enjoys with her business. 
It is a very dificult work, but she is not afraid of work.
Gulnaz has a lot of plans. She wants to expand her business. 
You can see in the picture a sociable, very kind, friendly young woman. 
Now she needs a loan of $700 to start being busy with a stock breeding. She wants to buy 10 sheeps.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheeps

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.en:
Luz Maria is 38 years old. She started selling purified water in 1995, helping an aunt. At the time she needed the income to support her son, since she was a single mother and had no one to help her. Later she met her current partner, Oscar; they have a 2 year old child. When they moved to a new home, Luz continued in the purified water business. Because she is in a new neighborhood she has had excellent demand and has been able to grow her business through the distribution of her product.

At the moment Luz Maria needs a loan of $475, which she will use to buy plastic bottles for her water. She is expanding her delivery area and needs this investment. She will repay the loan in 4 to 8 months. Support Luz Maria in the growth of her business. She needs your help and she sincerely appreciates it.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Luz Maria tiene 38 años de edad e inició con la venta de agua purificada desde 1995 ayudándole a una tía, por la necesidad que tenía de obtener los recursos para el sustento de su hijo, en ese entonces era madre soltera y no tenía quien le ayudara. Después conoció a Oscar, su actual pareja, y tienen un pequeño hijo de 2 años. Se cambiaron de domicilio y Luz continuó con el negocio del agua purificada, por ser una colonia nueva, han tenido mucha demanda y ha visto la oportunidad de hacer crecer su negocio mediante la distribución de su producto.
