Este es el crédito numero 4 que el Sr. Mercedes M. T.  tiene con Ceprodel en un periodo de 5 años. Mercedes M. T.  expresa que con los financiamientos de Ceprodel el a podido llevar a cabo varios proyectos familiares que de manera propia no los habría podido logra como es la compra del zinc para la reparación del techo ya que les brindara mejor seguridad a el y su familia antes los cambios climáticos.
texts.en:
Mercedes M. T. has a business making clay bricks for the construction of structures such as houses, etc. He is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL that will be used to purchase corrugated metal sheeting. Mr. T. began this line of work 6 years ago, and since then he has continued to make this product, which is in high demand in these areas. He works from 7am until noon, since this is the estimated time that it takes to make up the daily orders. Prior to this, he worked in agriculture. Mr. T. hopes to improve the physical condition of his house with the purchase of corrugated metal roofing materials, since the roof of his house is quite deteriorated. Mr. T. is married and has 2 daughters, one whom is school-aged, and he must pay for her studies. This is the 4th loan that Mr. T. has taken with CEPRODEL over a period of 5 years. He says that with the financings from CEPRODEL he has been able to bring about various family projects on his own that he never would have been able to manage, like the purchase of metal roofing materials for the repair of his roof, which will provide better security for his family before the rainy season comes.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials (corrugated metal roofing material)

loans.name: Nidia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La  señora Nidia M. labora como secretaria en uno de los mercados de Managua.
 
Ella  tiene  un hijo a su cargo el cual se encuentra en edad escolar y ella busca la manera de cómo brindarle las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.

Actualmente está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción para el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que así se requiere. Ella comprará  5 láminas de zinc y otros materiales para llevar a cabo esta obra y así beneficiar a su hijo que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Nidia M. M. works as a secretary for the administrators of the Israel Lewites Market in Managua. She has one child that is of school age and is looking to provide the best conditions necessary for his development. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to invest in construction materials, such as 5 sheets of zinc for her home's kitchen, which is currently in poor condition. Nidia reports that thanks to the loans she has received, she has been able to improve the home in which she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving and expanding her home

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar has been working as a farmer for the past 12 years. He is a married man, 51 years old, and has three children. He owns land and cultivates it with a variety of fruits and vegetables according to the season. His children help in the household and they cooperate as a family to better their living conditions. 

Today, Omar is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers for the summer cultivation.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
K. Sarin, 35, is married with three children and lives in Takeo province. She is a farmer, making around US$2 each day. Her husband is a construction foreman who is able to generate US$2 each day as well.

K. Sarin is asking for a loan of US$550 to raise chickens, pigs and cows. She needs the money to purchase the animals and also the feed. Along with her ability to generate income through the purchase of animals, she would like to purchase a water pump.

K. Sarin believes that this loan can raise her standard of living and provide valuable resources for her family.

loans.use: To raise cows, pigs and chickens and to purchase a water pump

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel B., 58, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She is married to Fernando B., a retiree, and they are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for the last eighteen years.

Isabel has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow sixteen times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.

Now, with your help, Isabel would like to obtain a PHP 15,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying groceries and other supplies needed to replenish her current product inventory.

Isabel dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she is able to show her children, through her example, how to be self-reliant and independent.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries and other supplies needed to replenish her inventory

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Perfil del Cliente 	Esta cliente se dedica a la venta de comida, fresco gaseosa dulces como arroz en leche, atolillos cajetas en su casa de habitación, tiene diez años de experiencia en el negocio y el crédito lo necesita para poder cubrir un encargo de treinta servicios de comida extra  que le esta contratando una institución para su personal por lo tanto tiene que invertir para poder cumplir con el pedido y poder dar respuesta a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This client sells food, soft drinks, sweets like “arroz en leche” (rice in milk), hot drinks, and caramels in her house. She has ten years of experience in the business. She needs the loan to be able to cover the cost of an order to provide service for 30 extra meals. An institution wants to contract her to provide this service. She needs to make purchases to be able to fill the order and give an answer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her eatery

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco T. is from the village of Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 53 years old. Francisco is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Francisco owns & operates a business operating a motor transport service. Francisco has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Francisco joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisco has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. Francisco is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Francisco from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Sali

texts.fr:
Âgée de 46 ans, Sali B. est une femme mariée et mère de six  enfants. Elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants à Mamassoni, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).                       
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle s’est vite initiée depuis plus de dix ans à cette activité de petit commerce d’achat-vente de pagnes wax , de tissus brodés,  de bazins teintés, etc. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée surtout de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des femmes) pour la qualité de ses produits.  
 Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de cinq  ans. Elle a bénéficié  de plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier et  est actuellement à son onzième individuel qui lui permettra d’acheter 15 pièces de pagnes Wax, 6 complets de tissus brodés, 5 complets de bazin “moins riche” en couleur à Bamako.                                                                                                         Elle dispose d’une place au niveau de marché de leur quartier où elle vend ses marchandises au comptant et à crédit avec une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes. Elle amène souvent ses marchandises dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso les jours de leur foires pour être vendues.                                                                                                            Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 190 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
46 years of age, Sali Mamba is married and the mother of six children. She lives with her husband and children in Mamassoni, an outer district of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali). Not having had an opportunity to attend school for social reasons, about ten years ago she quickly launched a small business buying and reselling wax “pagnes” [traditional fabric for wrap clothing], embroidered fabrics, dyed “bazins” [a type of damask cloth highly prized in West Africa], etc. Her business is very popular with her customers (mostly women) due to high quality of her goods. In order to better meet the demands of her growing customer base, five years ago she decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. She had benefitted from several “solidarity” loans (group loans) in the past, and is now on her 11th individual loan, which will allow her to purchases 15 sets of wax “pagnes,” six sets of embroidered cloth, and five sets of dyed “bazins” of mid-range quality in Bamako. She has a vendor spot at the local market, where she sells her goods in cash or on credit to a customer base composed essentially of women. She often brings her goods to other areas around Sikasso in order to sell them on local market days. With this loan, she plans to achieve a monthly income of 190,000 West African francs, which will be mainly used to bolster her business capital, contribute to the family budget and pay off the interest on her loan.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics for traditional apparel

loans.name: Marine

texts.en: Marine G. lives in Ijevan city. She is married and has two children. Marine works at Ijevan city administration, and at the same time she runs her own bakery, which is on the ground floor of her house. With the profits from her business, Marine takes care of her family and pays for her daughters’ education. Marine delivers her production to 12 nearby food shops, and now she is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy a car, which will allow her to deliver her production to distant food shops as well. Marine has borrowed loans from Nor Horizon 3 times, and she has never been delayed with her repayments.

loans.use: To buy a car to deliver her production to distant food shops.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda S. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 42 years old. Yolanda is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Yolanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This will be the second loan taken out by Yolanda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Crusanita

texts.en: Crusanita E. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old and is single. Crusanita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Crusanita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Crusanita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia N. is from the city of Ambalatungan Santiago. She is 45 years old. Sylvia is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Sylvia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising ducks for sale. Sylvia has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Sylvia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sylvia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Sylvia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Santa Martina

texts.es:
La microempresaria: Santa Martina C. Z. tiene 51 años de edad es viuda con cuatro hijos todos adultos, tiene una pulpería la cual era de la propiedad de su fallecido esposo de origen chino. En este negocio la señora C. vende productos en general y como especialidad la venta de tallarín (Crudo) y otros ingredientes que se utilizan en la preparación de esta comida tales como chile chino, salsa china entre otros.

La microempresaria C. ya ha sido beneficiada anteriormente con un préstamo por parte de Kiva, el cual cancelo en tiempo y forma, aprovechando este medio para agradecer a los prestamistas que confiaron en ella y le concedieron el préstamo. El principal problema que tiene esta microempresaria  es la seguridad de su local ya que la construcción es de madera y ya tiene mas de 30 años, por lo que requiere remodelarla por completo.

Con su primer préstamo ya inicio la reparación y poco a poco va  a ir reparándola en esta ocasión requiere un financiamiento para reparar otra parte del negocio por lo que necesita comprar los siguientes materiales de Construcción:

5 Quintales de Hierro de 3/8 cada quintal lo compra a US 50; 5 bolsas de cemento el cual compra a US 52 cada bolsa, 150 unidades de  bloques a US 0.80 cada unidad y  5 metros de arena a US  14 cada metro.
texts.en:
Santa Martina C. Z. is a small business owner. She is a 51 year old widow with five adult children. She has a store that was started by her late husband who was of Chinese origin. She sells general merchandise, but specializes in the sale of noodles (uncooked) and other ingredients used in the preparation of noodles like Chinese chili, Chinese sauce and other items. Small business owner C. has had one previous loan with Kiva, which she paid off in a timely manner. She wants to thank all the lenders who showed confidence in her and granted her the loan. The main problem that she is having with her business is the safety of the building since it is made of wood and is 30 years old. For this reason she would like to completely remodel it. With her first loan she started making repairs and little by little has made more. She is requesting a loan to repair another section of the building. She needs to buy the following construction materials: 5 quintals (a quintal equals 100 lbs.) of 3/8 inch rebar with each quintal costing $50, 5 bags of cement at $52 per bag, 150 units of blocks at 80 cents per unit and 5 meters of sand at $14 per meter.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 3/8" rebar, cement, blocks and sand

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 43 years old and a married father of five children between the ages of 2½ and 14, four of whom are attending school. Elijah, who has a mixed farm in the town of Litein in Rift Valley Kenya, has been farming for the last nine years and employs two farmhands. His main products are milk, cabbage, beans and tea, all of which he sells to the local market. He depends on the income from his farming to provide for the basic needs of his family.

Elijah has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 80,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase a dairy cow. He says that the income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of his family, enable him to pay school fees for his children and provide for their basic needs. In five years' time, he hopes to expand his dairy farming by increasing his number of dairy cows, buying a piece of land upon which he will plant nappier grass, and purchasing other required farming machines.

His primary challenges are an inadequate market for milk, diseases, and insufficient dairy feeds.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KAROLL WOKTILA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio  Roberto, tiene 52 años de edad, el socio es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, el socio trabaja en su propio negocio, el tiene una carpintería en la calle Bolognesi, el socio desde hace 12 años trabaja en la carpintería. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas para su carpintería, el desea comprar maquinas para implementar su carpintería.

 El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Introducing Roberto, a member of the “KAROLL WOKTILA” Communal Bank, located in Huanchac, a district of the Cusco province in the Cusco region. Roberto is 52 years old, he lives with his live-in partner and has 3 children. He is a carpenter and he owns a carpenter’s shop in the calle Bolognesi (Bolognesi street). He has been a carpenter for 12 years. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy tools for his shop: he wishes to buy machines to implement his shop. He his thankful for the loan that will be granted to him, and at the same time he commits to comply with the repayment of his dues in the set time.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools for his carpenter's shop.

loans.name: Abashyirahamwe No 10 Group

texts.fr:
Pierre Bungura, née à Ruhuha l’Est du Rwanda, il a 43 ans, il est marié et il a 8 enfants, son ainé a 19 ans et son cadet a 1 ans, son niveau d’étude est primaire. Elle vit avec sa famille à Ruhuha Bugesera. 5 enfants vont à l’école.
Il appartient dans un groupe solidaire appelé ABASHYIRAHAMWE NO 10 cultivateurs de riz,  qui est un groupe dont les membres sont  agriculteurs de riz et ils se garantissent mutuellement, Pierre et son groupe travaillent pour faire vivre leurs familles en améliorant leurs conditions de vie et en payant les minervals pour leurs enfants. Le groupe a contracté un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les engrais chimique pour félitiliser leur champ. Quand le groupe récolte, une partie de la récolte est vendue et une autre est utilisée pour les familles.
texts.en:
Pierre Bungura was born in Ruhuha, in eastern Rwanda. He is 43 years old, married and has 8 children. The eldest is 19 years old and the youngest is 1. Pierre has completed primary school. He lives with his family in Ruhuha Bugesera. 5 of his children go to school.
He belongs to Abashyirahamwe No 10, a solidarity group of rice growers who guarantee each other’s loans. Pierre and his group work to support their families, to improve their quality of life and to pay their children’s tuition fees.
The group has taken out a loan from Amasezerano Community Banking to buy chemical fertilisers for their fields. When the group harvests their crops, a part is sold and the rest is used for their families.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilisers

loans.name: Agustina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Agustina de 52 años, tiene 2 hijas ambas mayores de edad, la mayor trabaja como docente de secundaria y la otra es ejecutiva de ventas, su esposo trabaja en la finca que ellos poseen que es donde viven en la colonia San Juan, trabaja para el  MINED de  docente desde hace 24 años desempeñandose con gran responsabilidad y honestidad.      
                                                                                                  Està Solicitando su sexto  crèdito para comprar materiales de construcciòn que pretende construir una habitacion  de esta manera mejorar sus  condiciones de vida y tener mejor comodidad en el hogar .    

Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia goce de salud y tener estabilidad laboral para vivir una vida digna como toda persona lo desea.
texts.en:
Mrs. Agustina is 52 years old and has two grown daughters. The elder works as a secondary school teacher and the other is a sales executive. Her husband works on their farm and that is where they live in the San Juan region. She has worked for MINED as a teacher for 24 years, putting forth a lot of effort and showing responsibility and honesty.

She is asking for her sixth loan to buy materials to build a bedroom and improve her life and the comfort of the home. Her greatest dream in life is for her family to enjoy good health and have steady work and, like everyone else, to live a life of dignity.

loans.use: To build a bedroom

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith T. is from the town of Banga. She is 30 years old. Judith is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Judith owns & operates a business raising crops. primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Judith also grows pigs for fattening and sale.

Judith joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Judith is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed and farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase feed and farm supplies.

loans.name: Erjan

texts.en:
Erjan D. is 34 years old and lives with his wife and four sons in Bayan-Ulgiy province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest son attends a local secondary school.

Erjan operates a meat-selling business in his province. He explains that herders drive herds anywhere from 100-200 km to sell their livestock in the capital city of the province. In Mongolia, it is common for a household to buy at least one cow and ten sheep to be eaten during the long Mongolian winters. People of this province usually prepare their meats for winter in October and November and finish those prepared meats in March. As a result, Erjan plans to sell his products during the spring season. He usually purchases livestock from herders and slaughters the livestock to sell at the local market. His wife is responsible for selling the meats at the market. He sells lamb for 2,000-2,500 MNT per kilogram and horse meat for 3,000-3,500 MNT per kilogram. His net profits per day are between 10,000 and 15,000 MNT.

Erjan hopes to continue his success. He says, "All I want is to have a big house for my family." Now, he is requesting a loan in the amount of 700,000 MNT ($550) to purchase more livestock, such as 50,000-60,000 MNT per sheep and 200,000 MNT per cow, for re-sale purposes.

loans.use: To continue to expand his business by purchasing additional livestock

loans.name: Togtohbayar

texts.en:
Togtohbayar B. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two children in an apartment in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her older daughter currently attends a local secondary school. 

Togtohbayar sells flour and rice at wholesale. She started her business in January, 2010, and has since built a stable operation within this short period. She hopes to continue growing her business. She says, "My only wish is to provide a good education for my children and to help them become good people." 

Togtohbayar is requesting a 500000 MNT loan to purchase more flour and rice to sell in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more flour and rice

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Loeng T. (pictured here) sells ansorm (a kind of Cambodian cake made of rice paste and wrapped in banana leaves) in her village. She has been married since 2006. Her husband, Mr. Phalla Chan, is a construction worker. They live in a small village along National Road Number 5 about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh and have six children: three sons and three daughters.

In addition, the couple also grows rice. Loeng asked for a Kiva loan one time already; she now is asking for her second loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting and she will also use a part of her loan to continue her farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting and to use for growing rice

loans.name: Blanca Isabel

texts.es:
Blanca de 27 años, tiene un puesto de venta de pollos en la vereda de una calle. Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo es conocida porque vende pollos lista para preparar y comer. 

El puesto de venta de pollos es un negocio familiar que ya ha venido desarrollándose hace 35 años por su mama y ella para seguir la tradición continua con el negocio. Trabaja con ayuda de su mama desde las 06h00am hasta las 14h00pm ya que ella está estudiando en la universidad. Cada pollo lo vende según sea el peso peo el promedio de vender un pollo entero es de $ 6.50.

Para seguir con su negocio familiar ella quiere comprar con el préstamo pollos para poderlos vender en su puesto. En el futuro quiere continuar con su negocio y uno de sus objetivos tener un cyber como un nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
27 year-old Blanca has a stall on a street sidewalk where she sells chickens.  She lives in an urban area called Guasmo.  Blanca is well known because she sells chickens that are ready to prepare and eat.

Blanca's chicken stall is a family business which has been in existence for 35 years.  Her mother used to own the business and she is following family tradition by continuing the business.  Blanca works, with her mom's help, from 6.00am to 2.00pm since she is studying at university.  She sells every chicken according to its weight but the average price she sells a whole chicken for is $6.50.

To continue with her family business, she would like to use her loan to buy chickens to sell on her stall.  In the future, she would like to continue with her business and one of her goals is to own an Internet cafe as a new business.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Nyabuto

texts.en:
Nyabuto has been farming for fifteen years in Kisii town in western Kenya. He employs four casual laborers. His farm produces maize, milk, tea and beans which are all sold locally. He also runs a retail shop in the same area.

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help pay school fees for his children and improve his family's livelihood. He also plans to venture into poultry farming in the next five years. 

Nyabuto is 42 years old. He is married and has been blessed with five school-aged children who all attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy La Lechera milk, rice, chicken, sugar, instant soup and beef

loans.name: Busara's Group

texts.en:
Milk production is very successful in Kyrgyzstan. Such companies as Bishkek-Sut and Vimm Bil Dan provide the residents with high quality milk products. According to statistics an average person consumes milk products at least once a day.

Busara J., 47, is a leader of this group. She is married to a farmer and has a twelve-year-old daughter. She started her business of milk production in 2003 and hasn’t regretted it at all. First she purchased a dairy cow and sold the generated milk to friends from the neighborhood every morning. Busara's business became so popular in the neighborhood that she had to buy more dairy cows in order to generate more milk. Soon local ice-cream and cake producers started purchasing her milk on a regular basis. They liked high quality of this raw material. The next idea was to diversify her products. Busara bought new equipment for making high sorted cheese, sour cream and butter. She loved how everything worked out and sold all of her products almost immediately. The reason Busara applied for this loan is that she’s in need of new equipment for making milk products because her old one is getting exhausted. Busara’s dream is a two-storied big house where her daughter would be happy to live. 

      --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok P. is 50 and lives with her family in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples. Sok is a farmer, earning a daily income of 1.5 USD. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and earns a daily income of 3 USD. Each month, the family has to spend 55 USD on food and 35 USD on other necessary expenses. 

Sok is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. In the future, Sok would like to use the additional income to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Doña Blanca D. 46 años D. edad, resiD. en San Miguel, vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos D. 18, 22 y 26 años D. edad, se dedica a la sastrería, este negocio fue fundado hace 18 años, aprendió el oficio en una academia D. corte y confección, trabaja todos los días D. la semana D. 6:00am a 8:00pm, hasta el momento no ha tenido dificultades en su trabajo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. materiales como hilos, ciper, telas, botones y broches, esta inversión es muy necesaria para ella y el taller, pues estos materiales son la base para la confección D. prendas D. vestir, además D. que ayuda a fortalecer el negocio y continuar con este por un largo periodo.
Su objetivo es mantenerse siempre trabajando, realizar sus trabajos D. la mejor manera y ayudar a sus hijos con sus gastos personales y educativos.
texts.en:
Blanca, 46, lives in San Miguel with her husband and three children who are 18, 22 and 26 years of age.  She’s a tailor.  She started her business 18 years ago.  She learned her craft at a dressmaking academy.  She works every day of the week from 6am until 8pm and to date has had no difficulties in her work.

She is asking for a loan to buy materials like thread, zippers, fabric, buttons and clasps.  This is a very necessary investment for her workshop because these supplies are the basics for making articles of clothing.  Besides, it will help to strengthen the business so that she can continue with it for a long period of time.

Her goal is to always continue working and to make her items in the best possible way and to help her children with their personal and educational expenses.

loans.use: To buy materials like thread, fabric, zippers, buttons and clasps.

loans.name: Miriam Patricia

texts.es:
Miriam de 45 años, es una mujer trabajadora que es comerciante de artículos plásticos. Trabaja desde muy temprano con la ayuda de sus hijos. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con sus ventas por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar artículos plásticos como bandejas, jarras, vasos etc. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando para generar más ingresos y ayudar a su esposo que es taxista y así con dos ingresos darle una buena vida a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Miriam, 45 years old, is a hard-working woman who sells plastic articles.  She works from very early in the morning with the aid of her children.

Miriam has many aspirations concerning her sales.  That is why she wants the loan -- to buy plastic articles such as trays, pitchers, glasses, etc.  In the future, Miriam wants to work hard to generate more income and help her husband, who drives a taxi, and thus, with two incomes, to offer a good life to their 3 children.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE TRAYS, GLASSES, AND PITCHERS TO SELL

loans.name: 3 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Trọng Lê Thị (10) is a 56-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Trọng is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 3 Đông Vệ (08.05.3 Đông Vệ).


Trọng is married and has 2 adult children.  To making a living, Trọng owns and operates a business in the food sector, making & selling food.  While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community.  Trọng has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Trọng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Trọng has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,253,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,159,600 VND, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Trọng plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị Huệ (11) is a 49-year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector, a general store.


2.  T. Thị Cứ (12) is a 63-year-old female who is requesting a 6,159,600 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector.  T. also runs a general store.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas of the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Trọng  Lê Thị (10) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Trọng  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 3 Đông Vệ (08.05.3 Đông Vệ).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Trọng  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Trọng  kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND.  Vào 2010, Trọng  đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Trọng  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,253,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,159,600 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Huệ (11) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


2.  T. Thị Cứ (12) là 63 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,159,600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is currently in the business of selling maize and bread. She is 36 years old, married, and has 6 children. All of her children go to school. 

Margret has borrowed a loan to stock more maize and bread to sell. She hopes to pay her children's school fees with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To stock more maize and bread to sell.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en: Olga H. lives in Yerevan with her daughter who is a student. She has been engaged in the clothing trade since 2003. Olga rents a premise in the city and trades in women’s clothing, which is the family’s main source of income. To continue doing business, Olga needs to purchase clothing stock, and this loan is taken for that purpose. Olga’s income covers the family’s needs and her daughter’s university fees.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Karina Norma

texts.es: La señora Karina nació en el país del Perú, pero actualmente radica en Bolivia desde sus catorce años. Vive con su madre en un departamento en la zona Miraflores que se encuentra a quince minutos del centro de la cuidad de la paz. Karina se dedica a la venta de dulces, chocolates, golosinas, sándwiches y hamburguesas en un kiosco dentro de un  colegio desde hace dos años. Ella dice que se siente muy contenta de trabajar dentro el colegio ya que sus clientes son todos los estudiantes del colegio debido a que ella vende sola en el único kiosco dentro del colegio. Karina solicita el préstamo para aumentar su capital en el kiosco comprando mercadería para surtir su kiosco, como ser dulces, galletas, refrescos, etc., es una persona muy trabajadora con ganas de superación agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Karina was born in Perú, but has lived in Bolivia since she was 14. She lives with her mother in Miraflores, just 15 mins. outside of La Paz.  For the past few years, Karina has run a shop selling sweets, chocolates, sandwiches and hamburgers from a kiosk inside a school compound. She has an ample clientele, and is the only shop selling snacks to students in the school. Karina seeks credit to buy more inventory of snacks, sweets and soft drinks.  She is a very hardworking woman and is very grateful for the support she has received.

loans.use: to buy inventory of sweets and snacks such as cookies and chocolate

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.en:
Madeleine is a 26 year-old Rwandan entrepreneur that works as a tailor and also sells fabric.  She started her business four years ago as a tailor, and since acquiring capital has been able to add the sale of fabrics to her business services. 

Madeleine is married  to a technician and they have two children that are one and five years old. They are too young to be currently enrolled in school but will attend when they are old enough.

Madeleine will use this loan to purchase fabric and make dresses that she will sell.  The profits from her business will provide the funds she will need to pay for her children to go to school.

She runs her business with the ambition of one day becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and make dresses to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other gear for fishing.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fish nets and other gear for fishing.

loans.name: Tagoykhon

texts.ru: Тагойхон житель района А. Джоми. Ему 44 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его сын находится в России. Сам он занимается растениеводством и одновременно животноводством. У него среднее образование. При доме он имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Кроме того он разводит скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности Тагойхон занимается 18 лет. Он берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Tagoykhon lives in A. Jomi.  He is 44 years old, married, and has four children. His son is in Russia. He works in farming and in animal husbandry.  He has a secondary education. He has a plot of land at home where he grows vegetables. He also raises cattle at home. Tagoykhon has been doing this work for eighteen years.  He is taking out a loan to buy cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca is 47 years old and lives in Machachi in central Ecuador. She is divorced and lives in her own house with her two children. Her daughter is 13 years old and her son is 10 years old. Blanca is a person who fights adversity and her enterprising personality gives her the ability to move forward with her children.
Blanca has a car wash service that was established as a family business. The business washes, vacuums and sprays cars. It also does oil changes, air filters and gas filters. Through this loan, Blanca is going to finance new machinery. She began working in 1994 with only one machine. Later, with her profits, she began growing the business little by little. Now, with the help of a loan from Kiva partner, FODEMI, she is better equipping her business. She is seeking this loan to continue equipping her business, changing old and obsolete machines for more modern ones. Blanca hopes this loan will improve her equipment and that her family will have a larger income. She wants it to improve their quality of life. Blanca’s goals are to continue her family’s business tradition and for her family to have good health.

loans.use: to upgrade the machinery at her auto service station

loans.name: Von

texts.en: Mrs. Von is a 28 year-old rice cultivator in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham. She has been planting rice crop and potato since 2003 and earns approximately $1 per day. She works together with her husband in the same business. In addition, they also buy a small amount of vegetables from the other villagers to sell in the market to supplement their farming income.  They have three single children who they support.  Mrs. Von would like to ask for a loan to buy potato seeds for planting during the upcoming rainy season.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds for planting.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es:
Eleuteria, vive con su esposo, un hijo, la nuera y su nieto, tiene un negocio D. Jarcia que consiste en confección D. hamacas, dicho negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, atienD. a sus clientes todos los días a tiempo completo. 
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. hilo D. seda para la elaboración D. las hamacas, esta compra le ayudara a tener y realizar un mejor trabajo y aumentar la produccion.  
Su principal objetivo es ayudar a su hijo a ser independiente y a que tenga su propia vivienda junto a su esposa y su hijo.
texts.en:
Eleuteria lives with her husband, one son, her daughter-in-law and her grandson. She has a twine-based business that consists of hammock production. She started up this business under her own initiative. She attends her clients every day, full-time.

She requests a loan to purchase a silk twine to make hammocks. This purchase will help her to maintain her business and to carry out higher quality work, and to increase production.

Her main goal is to help her son to become independent so that he will have his own house in which to live with his wife and his son.

loans.use: to purchase twine of different colors to make hammocks.

loans.name: Naranchimeg

texts.en:
Naranchimeg is 48 years old and lives with her daugther in an apartment in the city of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.  Her daughter is a college student.  Her husband was desceased not long ago.  

She started her business in 2000 by selling foods at the Narantuul market.  Currently, she is an authoized distributor of NaranFoods LLC.  Her business is her main income source.  She has gained much business experience in her field.  She is a hard-working and open-minded woman who says "I want to expand my business activity."  She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery products and to increase her capital turnover and business activity.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en: Laurence wants a loan to clear land and prepare it for cultivation.  He is a 38 year old farmer hailing from Kyenjojo District in Uganda and is a father of 10 children whom he lives with together with their mother in a semi-permanent house.  His dream is to educate his children and become a model farmer.

loans.use: to clear land and prepare it for cultivation.

loans.name: Vi

texts.en:
Vi is a 31-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has a daughter. She and her husband earn a living running a general store, which they have done for four years. They sell milk, coffee and instant foods.

Vi would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods such as foods and beverages to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and increase the turnover of her business. She also hopes that through this loan her business will generate a higher income and help her improve her family's living conditions and enable her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy more instant foods and beverages for selling.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Don Manuel tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida, sus dos hijos y su mamá.

Don Manuel es un hombre, que se esfuerza día a día para salir adelante con su familia, desde la edad de 10 años inicio a trabajar en la agricultura con su papá. Él se levanta todos los días a las 5:00 de la mañana para empezar su jornada laboral en la agricultura. 

Él debe viajar a la ciudad más cercana, en busca de los insumos agrícolas necesarios, debe viajar durante 30 minutos en la palangana de un carro desde su comunidad hasta la ciudad.

Él tiene mucha experiencia en la siembra de maíz por lo que actualmente, esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundacion Campo para, comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios para sembrar dos manzanas de maíz. Don Manuel con su producción venderá una parte obteniendo los ingresos necesarios, para cubrir las necesidades del hogar y la otra parte la almacenara, para la alimentación de su familia. Así estaría asegurando la alimentación de su familia y obteniendo ingresos que seran utilizados en satisfacer otras necesidades del hogar.

El sueño de don Manuel es, ahorrar para construir  una casa de ladrillo, por que la que tienen es de bahareque y ahí viven sus hijos su esposa y su mamá. Por eso él trabaja muy fuerte para lograr su sueño y esta seguro que a través del préstamo lo conseguirá.
texts.en:
Manuel is 36 years old. He lives with his partner for life, his 2 children, and his mother. 

Manual is a man who tries every day to provide for his family. He began to work in farming with his father when he was 10 years old. He wakes up every day 5:00AM in the morning to begin his daily work in agriculture.

He has to go to a nearby city to buy agriculture supplies that he needs, traveling 30 minutes in the back of a pickup truck from his community to the city.

He has a lot of experience in the growing of corn and now is asking for a loan from Fundacion Campo, in order to buy what he needs to be able to plant 2 rectangular blocks of corn. He will sell some of what he grows to cover household expenses and he will store some in order to feed his family. In this way he will be sure that his family has food on the table and income to meet household expenses. 

Manuel’s dream is to save for a brick house, because now they have a home with mud walls and he lives there with his children, wife, and mother. This is why he works so hard to achieve his dream and he is sure that through this loan he will reach it.

loans.use: to buy the supplies he needs to plant corn

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a very hardworking 39-year-old widow with one child. Jane offers food and water to the residents of Mathare, Nairobi with her clients being both male and female. She has been in this business for the last eleven years and gets an income of KES.6,000 per month.

Jane is applying for her first loan of KES.20,000 from KADET LTD which she plans to use to buy food items like cereals, onions, tomatoes, and maize flour. Jane hopes to expand her business and will use the extra profit for the expansion.

loans.use: To buy food items and water.

loans.name: Irma Esperanza

texts.es:
Irma, vive con su esposo y dos hijos 2 y 4 años, ella junto a su esposo tienen una joyería (cadenas, aritos, pulseras) y tienen un taller de reparación, el oficio lo aprendió hace ocho años y trabaja de lunes a sábado.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar oro, y mantenimiento de herramientas para la joyería (arco de joyero, alicate de corte, pulidora, lamina y alambre) de esa forma tendrá más ingresos y podrá aumentar en  clientes debido a que tendrá más variedad.
El propósito de Irma es tener siempre su negocio y mantener a su familia para que tengan lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Irma lives with her husband and two children who are 2 and 4 years old.  She and her husband own a jewelry store (chains, hoops, bracelets) and they also have a repair shop.  She learned this occupation 8 years ago and works Monday through Saturday.

She needs the loan to buy gold and service her work tools (jeweler’s hoop, cutting tweezers, buffer, metal sheets and wire) so that she will earn higher income and increase number of customers because she’ll have more variety available.  Irma’s goal is to always have her business and to support her family so that they will have everything they need to live.

loans.use: to buy jewels and jewelry tools.

loans.name: Maria Debora

texts.es:
A los 55 años de edad Maria Debora ha visto crecer a sus 9 hijos, y a la ves, golpeada por la pobreza a visto como uno de ellos se pierde en las drogas. Así las cosas ella anhela poderle dar educación a sus 3 hijos menores, ya que quiere verlos salir adelante!

Sus ingresos provienen del cultivo y venta de tomates, actividad que alterna con la venta de reciclaje. Con el crédito solicitado busca mejorar la irrigación de su cultivo.

Da gracias a Dios por permitirle acceder al crédito y mejorar las condiciones para realizar su actividad productiva.
texts.en:
At 55 years of age, Maria Debora has seen her 9 children grow up, and at the same time, beaten down by poverty, she has seen one of them lost to drugs. With things as they are, she hopes to be able to offer an education to her 3 youngest children, because she wants to see them get ahead!

Her income depends upon growing and selling tomatoes, an activity she alternates with selling recycled items. With her solicited loan, she hopes to improve the irrigation of her crop.

She gives thanks to God for allowing her access to credit and a chance to improve conditions for carrying out her productive activity.

loans.use: to improve the irrigation of her tomato field.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa is a 26-year-old housewife, who started a small home-based business selling kitchen tools and items 3 months ago. She wants to help her husband, who works in the Jordanian military, and also to fill her free time at home. Her customer base has grown by word of mouth between her friends and family to include neighbors and their friends. To be able to serve these customers, Sanaa has now applied for a loan to buy more items that are missing from the products she sells.

loans.use: to buy more items that are missing from the home products she sells

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en: Marcelino is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. Marcelino has a rice field that harvests and sells rice grains during harvest time. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizers for the rice fields. Marcelino has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marcelino hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice fields

loans.name: Capilla San Juan Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Capilla San Juan" está conformado por once integrantes dos de ellos son 2 hombres y nueve mujeres todos los integrantes viven en una mismos localidad donde el transporte es muy escaso se tiene que caminar varios kilómetros para llegar al lugar donde se encuentra en grupo, solo llegan los taxis especiales pero la gente casi nunca contrata este tipo de taxis ya que es muy caro y no tienen para pagar tanto dinero entonces deciden caminar.
Decidieron ponerle Capilla San Juan así porque el lugar donde se reúne el grupo se encuentra a lado una capilla que es la más importante de la comunidad y San Juan porque así se llama la comunidad donde se encuentra la capilla.

La señora Magdalena quien es la representante del grupo tiene 46 años de edad esta casad con el señor Martin desde hace 29 años del cual dicho matrimonio nacieron 4 hijos de los cuales todos aun depende de dicho matrimonio, Laura de 17 años que ya no estudia, Amalia de 15 años que tampoco ya no estudia, Amancio de 12 años quien está cursando segundo de secundaria, Anayeli de 9 años quien está en primaria.

Doña Magdalena se dedica a atender la tienda escolar donde estudia su hija Anayeli  y por eso mismo le dieron la tienda escolar, en la actividad lleva ya 2 años de los cuales su único problema fue que las ventas bajaron mucho ya que en la escuela le prohibieron vender golosinas y comida chatarra para los niños y esto perjudico en sus ventas porque ahora los niños llevan su lonch a la escuela para ya no comprarle a doña Magdalena.
Ella esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para comprar manzanas, naranjas uno que otro dulce que le autorizaron vender también prepara comida pero solo para los maestros.
Su meta es poder llegar a tener otro negocio donde pueda vender verduras, ella y todo el grupo están agradecidos por lo que comentaron, "Gracias al préstamo hemos podido hacer crecer nuestros negocios y esto ha hecho que nuestra calidad de vida mejore" Todos los integrantes invertirán en diferentes don Alejandro invertirá en su taxi de servicio, Gregoria, Paula, María, Sofía y Juana invertirán en borregos, Ignacia en tienda, en borregos, Antonia en tienda y Guadalupe en Ropa.
texts.en:
This group is called “Capilla San Juan” (Saint John Chapel) and it has 11 members, two men and nine women.  All the members live in the same location where transportation is very scarce.  One has to walk several kilometers to reach the place where the group meets.  Only the special taxis go there but hardly anyone contracts this type of taxi because they are very expensive and they don’t have enough money for them so they decide to walk.  They decided to call it Capilla San Juan because the place where the group meets is next to a chapel which is the most important one in the community and San Juan because that’s the name of the community the chapel is located in.

Magalena, 46, is group representative.  She’s been married to Martín for 29 years.  Four children were born to this couple and they are all still dependent.  Laura, 17, is no longer in school, Amalia, 15, is no longer in school either, Amancio, 12, who is in second year of secondary school and Anayeli, 9, who is in elementary school.

Magdalena runs the school store where her daughter Anayeli attends which is why she was given this store.  She’s been in business two years and the only difficulty she’s had is that sales dropped very much when she was forbidden to sell sweets and junk food for the children.  This hurt sales because now children bring lunches from home and don’t buy from Magdalena anymore.

This time she’s asking for the loan to buy apples, oranges and one or the other sweet that she has been authorized to sell.  She also prepares meals but only for the teachers.

Her goal is to manage to have another business where she can sell vegetables.  She and the group are grateful and they commented: “Thanks to the loan we’ve been able to make our businesses grow and this has improved out quality of life.”

All the group members will invest their loans differently.  Alejandro will invest in his taxi service; Gregoria, Paula, María, Sofía and Juana will buy sheep; Ignacia in a store and in sheep; Antonia in a store and Guadalupe in clothes.

loans.use: to buy apples, oranges and candy.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 32-year-old, married man, who lives in the Al-Jalazoon Refugee camp near Ramallah with his family of six.  
On May 1st, 2011, Ashraf opened his own dry-cleaning business. He now hopes that he will be able to buy a new high tech dry-cleaning machine with this loan, which will help him do his business at a faster pace. 
Because of this he will be able to please his customers and bring in new ones.

loans.use: to buy a new high tech dry-cleaning machine

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina, a 47-year-old widow with two children, lives in Lower Langcangan, Oroquieta City where she has a general store that earns her approximately PHP 2,000 each month. A member of PMPC for a month, Gina has requested a loan of PHP7,000  to purchase more stocks for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store.
